loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia E. is from the village of El Paraiso. She is 51 years old and is married. To make a living, Virginia works for someone else who operates a service-based business. The main source of income for her family comes from doing odd jobs and providing labor services to local community. She and her husband also have income from their coco land.

In 2004, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. Virginia repaid  aprevious loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to repair their house. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase materials for repairs of their house. This loan will be her 4th loan from PMPC.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house repairs

loans.name: Slivesto

texts.en: Slivesto E. is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver. She has five children and her children go to school. Slivesto is currently in the business of selling various goods at her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more goods to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a supermarket. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Sandra María

texts.es:
La señora Sandra M. se ha destacado por ser una dama muy esforzada cuya labor es la atención de su pulpería en el departamento de León. El negocio abre todos los días ofreciendo variedad de productos. Ella se ha esforzado grandemente por mejoras las condiciones económicas en su hogar.

Actualmente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos debido a que requiere adquirirlos a lo inmediato y así mejorar en el negocio. Espera muy confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado por la institución.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra M. is a hard working lady that has a small grocery shop in the state of Leon. The business is open daily and offers a variety of products. She has worked greatly to improve the economic conditions of her household. She is asking for a loan to Ceprodel, which will be invested in the purchase of more products that will help to improve the business. She is confident that the loan will be granted by the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 42-year-old mother of four who operates her business in Nairobi. She has requested a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to enable her to introduce a M-pesa (money transfer) business to her already existing computer and photocopy services. She worked for Telkom Kenya until two years ago when she began her current business. She hopes to be a stationery supplier one day and to own a good family house and educate her children. She describes herself as diligent, jovial, loving, cheerful and funny.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Introduce M-pesa (Money transfer) business to her established business

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Seang T., age 53, is married and lives with her husband (pictured) in Phnom Penh City. Her husband is employed as a construction worker earning about US $7 per day which is the primary source of income for the family.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has made it a difficult economic year for much of the country, T. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, T. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US $600 in order to purchase a motorbike for her husband to be able to commute to work not only in the town but also to other places in the province. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to increase the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a native of Cagayan. She is already 42 years old and married to Dante who is a farmer in their village in Palao, Solana, Cagayan. They are blessed with five children with ages ranging from 15 to 23 years old. They live in an agriculture-based community where farming is the main source of income. Rice and corn are the main crops which they produce twice a year.

Wanting to help her husband in supporting the needs of their family, Elsa decided to engage in a direct-selling business. Through this, she has been able to provide the school allowances of their children.

Elsa is hoping that she will be able to obtain a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders that will be utilized as additional capital for her direct-selling business. She sells Avon and Natasha cosmetics products in their town. She purchases the products in the town proper of Solana and earns an income on a commission basis.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Belonbaboa Group

texts.en:
Allen is a 48-year-old Liberian businessman. He is married with three children. As he himself is illiterate, it is very important to him that his children attend school. He has sold mixed goods such as lox, salt, oil, pepper, and sardines at market for about five years.

Allen faces challenges with financial shortage and illnesses. However, he is successful in attracting his customers by his excellent customer service and market skills.

He dreams of building a provision shop, which will enable him cater to his children's education as well as to ensure good medical treatment for the family.

loans.use: To buy additional mixed goods to sell at market

loans.name: Agajavad

texts.en:
Agajavad J. is 48 years old, married, and together with his wife, they has 6 children. Agajavad runs the family business, which is a convenience store that sells all kinds of much needed items like oil, sugar, tea, coffee, macaroni, and many other items. He's been in this business for more than 9 years. 
Agajavad says that the business is going very well and is generating good earnings, and now he is planning to increase the variety ofgoods. The loan he's requesting will help Agajavad meet his goals.

loans.use: To increase his variety of goods

loans.name: Adiye

texts.en:
Adiye is 29-years old and is married. Her husband works as a clerk. She has three school-attending children. Adiye M. sells bread, tomatoes and groundnut phaste, and she is requesting a loan to stock more bags of groundnuts to make more phaste to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to open her own shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Baceliana

texts.es:
La señora Baceliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 5 hijos, vive en el centro poblado de San Cristóbal, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos de hace 1 año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de pescado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 400.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar redes y combustible para su bote así poder realizar la pesca artesanal  de 2 a 3 veces por semana, la señora también realiza trabajo de artesanía en tejido con la cual se apoya.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprarse una casa en Juliaca.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las facilidades de pago.
texts.en:
Sra. Baceliana is a member of the Communal Bank “Juchuy Niño” located in the District of Capachica, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 44 years old, married, has 5 children, and lives in the central village of San Cristóbal. Baceliana did not have the opportunity to attend school.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to increase her business capital for selling fish.

Baceliana needs a new loan in the amount of 400 soles to buy nets and fuel for her fishing boat. She goes out to fish 2-3 times each week. In addition, she makes hand woven crafts for extra income. Her greatest dream is to buy a house in Juliaca. Baceliana enjoys her savings and the simplicity of her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nets & fuel for her fishing boat

loans.name: Sessimè

texts.fr: A. Sessimè est née en 1975 à Adja au Mono au Bénin. Mariée à KOUDE Antoine un agent de sécurité, Sessimè est mère de quatre enfants. Trois autres enfants sont à sa charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Sessimè vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis une dizaine d’année. Sessimè n’a pas été à l’école. Il y a 8 ans de cela que Sessimè vend des produits vivriers (riz, haricot, maïs, etc.) dans son quartier à Cadjèhoun. Sessimè fait ses emplettes à Dantopa, marché international du Bénin. Sessimè a déjà obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé, qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d’agrandir son activité et de mieux satisfaire la forte demande des clients en période de préparation des fêtes, Sessimè sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.Sessimè envisage plus tard acheter sa propre parcelle, grâce aux économies issues de la vente de ses articles.
texts.en:
A. Sessimè was born in 1975 in Adja, in Mono, Benin. Married to KOUDE Antoine, a security guard, she is the mother of four children. Three other children are in her care. Some of the children are in school. For twelve years, she has been living together with her children and husband in Cadjèhoun in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Sessimè has not gone to school. For eight years, she has been selling staple foods (rice, beans, corn, etc.) in her district in Cadjèhoun. She makes her purchases at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has already obtained two ALIDé loans, which have been repaid. With the aim of expanding her business and satisfying further the strong customer demand during preparations for the holidays, she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé. Sessimè envisions buying her own parcel of land later on, with the help of the savings from selling her merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sacks of rice and beans

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn B., from Maquilao Tangub City, is 30 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn raises fish for sale. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC, she is requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 15,000 PHP to repair the equipment used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the equipment used in the business

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn G. is a 35-year-old farmer who mainly grows rice because the people in her village are constantly buying it to feed their families. She has four children, the oldest a seventeen-year-old who helps her in the fields. She dreamed that instead of helping her on the farm, her child had gone to college. She would like her children to graduate from college so that in the future they could land a better job.

Emelyn is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. The loan will go far in buying farming supplies to grow her harvest and income.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace L. is currently in the business of selling various items in a retail shop and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice, beans and posho to sell.  Grace is 35 years old and is married to a policeman. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a wholesale shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of rice, beans and posho to sell.

loans.name: Ana Emperatriz

texts.es:
Ana Martínez de 34 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico, su esposo es chofer de un bus con el tiene 4 hijos.

Ana empezó invirtiendo una pequeña cantidad de dinero en dulces, poco a poco compro víveres y después pudo poner una pequeña tienda.

Ahora Ana trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00 hasta las 21h00, trabaja en conjunto con sus hijos, ella vende arroz, azúcar, aceites, dulces, etc. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es el lodo que produce las lluvias. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, aceites para agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere expandir la tienda con una sucursal.
texts.en:
Ana Martínez, 34, lives in the outlying area of Fortín in Guayaquil. Her house is made of cane, and electricity is the only basic service she has. Her husband is a bus driver, and they have four children. Ana started investing a small amount of money in sweets. Little by little she bought supplies. After that she was able to set up her small store. Ana now works everyday from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. She works with her children. She sells rice, sugar, oil, and sweets, etc. One of the inconveniences she has is the mud that the rain produces. She wants to use this loan to buy rice, sugar, and oil in order to increase the business. In the future she wants to expand the store with a branch.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, and oil

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor L. is 51 years old. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is an iron welder while the other one is a student in the local school. They all live in Thlok Doung Tum Village, Takeo Province.

Mrs. Nhor L. is a grocery seller who earns a small income to support her family. Although they work hard at her business, she still does not earn enough income to support her family well. In order to increase her income, she has decided to ask for a loan to purchase a cow for breeding. With this loan, she hopes the family's situation will improve.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Clemencia Beneranda

texts.es:
la señora  Clemencia P. es  socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive en la comunidad La Gloria en la parroquia el Valle  siendo su nombre completo  San Bautista de el Valle se encuentra al sureste de Cuenca teniendo como atractivo su laguna de Cochapamba llena de totoras, su edad es de 44 años, se encuentra casada y tiene 3 hijos de 16, 14, 11 años de edad, su hijo de 16 años estudia en el colegio Guillermo Mensi, su hija de 14 en el colegio Manuela Garaicoa de Calderón, el  de 11 en la escuela Tomás Rendón, su esposo es carpintero y posee su taller  en su propia casa.

María es sastre trabajó en esta actividad muchos años para otras personas hasta que decidió  independizarse y ahora tiene 14 años en su propio negocio y nos comenta que el trabajo ha bajado un poco, elabora todo tipo de ropa de hombre y mujer.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo en la fundación gracais a la señora Luz Yunga  otra socia del banco comunal que la invito a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres carismáticas y alegres, con el nuevo crédito que reciba comprará  una máquina de coser para su negocio, siendo su gran sueño llegar a tener su propio taller y más grande ya que al momento trabaja en casa.
texts.en:
Señora Clemencia P. is a member of the communal bank Friends Forever. She lives in La Gloria, in the El Valle parish (full name San Bautista de el Valle) to the southeast of Cuenca, famous for Lake Cochapamba, full of reeds. She is 44, married, with 3 children ages 16, 14, and 11. Her 16-year-old son is in Guillermo Mensi school, her 14-year-old daughter in Manuela Garaicoa de Calderón school, and the 11-year-old in Tomás Rendón school. Her husband is a carpenter with a shop in his own home. María is a tailor, having worked for other people in this trade for many years, she decided to go out on her own and now she has had her own business for 14 years. She tells us that work has gone down a little. She sews all types of men's and women's clothing. This is her third loan through this foundation, thanks to Señora Luz Yunga, another member of the communal bank who invited her to join this group of happy and charismatic women. With this new loan, she will buy a sewing machine for her business, her dream being to have her own larger shop, since for the present she works at home.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing machine

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: V. Odile est née en 1972 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à SESSINOU Jules, un plombier, Odile est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille s'est installée au quartier Saint Jean à Cotonou, il y a deux ans environs. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. C'est depuis 15 ans que Odile mène comme activité, la vente de sous-vêtements (slips, soutiens-gorge, etc.) de façon ambulante. Odile s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Odile est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu quatre prêts qu'elle a eu à bien rembourser. Aujourd’hui, Odile ambitionne agrandir son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et de se faire plus de revenu à la hauteur de ses charges. C’est la raison pour laquelle Odile sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Odile V. was born in 1972 in Cotonou, economical capital of Benin. Married to Jules Sessinou, a plomber, Odile is mother of four children who are all attending school. The family has lived for about two years in the Saint Jean area in Cotonou. The couple is providing together for the various family expenses. Odile has been selling lingerie and underwear (such as panties, bras, etc.) for 15 years as itinerant vendor. Odile buys her supplies in Lomé, Togo, a neighbor country. She is an old client of ALIDé, and she has fully repaid her four previous loans. Now Odile would like to enlarge her business in order to respond to her customer demand and to increase her revenue. For this reason she is requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of underwear and lingerie

loans.name: Altantulga

texts.en:
Altantulga is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. They have been living together in their home for 16 years. Currently, Altantulga operates a second-hand product business with his wife in his town. He sells a variety of used products including clothing and blankets to his many customers. 

He started his business in 2004 with 400,000 tugrugs (~ 282 USD). After years of successful operations he has managed to increase his working capital to a level exceeding 1,200,000 tugrugs (~ 845 USD) today. With his business profit, he has been providing money toward his family expenses and his family's quality of life has been improving. 

Altantulga is a very hard-working person and has many plans for the future. He says, “I would like to expand my business and to create my own workplace in the future.” He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~ 1407 USD) loan to purchase large amount of second-hand products at wholesale prices for his business.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand products for resale

loans.name: Yine Ecuador

texts.es:
Yine Villacrés de 37 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (su casa esta situada en un lugar muy comercial). Su vivienda es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su esposa le ayuda en el puesto de comidas ellos tienen 2 hijos que estudian en escuelas fiscales.

Yine tiene 15 años con su puesto de comidas, lo empezó en la afueras de su casa (En los lugares populares del Ecuador es muy común que las personas pongan mesas y sillas afuera de su casa para vender comida) con una mesa y unas cuentas sillas. Poco a poco fue incrementando la cliente y obtuvo mas ingresos. 

En la actualidad el esta en el mismo puesto de comidas pero con mas sillas y mas clientela. El plato mas popular que vende es el encebollado (contiene pescados, vegetales, y yucas). Trabaja en conjunto con su esposa desde las 06:00 am. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mesas, sillas y ollas para su puesto de comidas. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local y poder así comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Yine Villacrés, who is 37 years old, lives in the urban area of Guasmo de Guayaquil. His house is located in a very commercial area. His has a cement home, and he does enjoy all the basic services. His wife helps him in his food stand, and they have two children who attend public school. Yine has had his food stand for 15 years. He started it outside his home with a table and a few chairs. (In the well-known areas of Ecuador, it is quite common that people will put out tables and chairs in front of their homes to sell food). Little by little his costumer base increased, and he earned more income. Currently, he is in the same stand but with more seats and more customers. The most popular plate he sells is "encebollado," (a dish made of fish, vegetables and cassava). He works together with his wife, starting at 6:00 am. With the loan, he wants to purchase tables, chairs and pots for his food stand. In the future, he wants to have his own place of business and to then be able to purchase a car.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tables, chairs and pots

loans.name: Juba B Odong Karla Group

texts.en: O. Karla is a businesswoman of 41, married with six children, three of whom are in school. She also looks after one sibling. She has a retail shop selling items such as sugar, salt, soap, flour, and so forth, which she has been operating for over three years.  She is using the loan to purchase retail items and bags of sorghum in bulk. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dreams are to obtain livestock such as cows and goats to help her children in the future.

loans.use: To purchase retail items and bags of sorghum

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is 32 years old and single. He is a hardworking farmer from Murang'a town in Central Kenya. He has been farming for 6 years and employs 2 people from the community. His main produce is french beans, which he sells to Evabest Horticultural Company in Murang'a town. 

He has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.50,000 to purchase farm supplies that will help him with growing french beans. He also intends to use KES.5,000 to purchase a bull. This loan will enable him to practice large scale farming without straining financially. His biggest challenge has been poor roads that delay transportation of products to the market. In the future, he hopes to expand his farming to cover 5 acres with an output of 5400 kgs per hectare at harvest.

He hopes to see a bright future through Juhudi loans.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Debora Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
In addition to being a vibrant entrepreneur, Janet is also the mother of five children from age 4-17 years old, who are pursuing education at various levels. She is hard-working and resourceful on behalf of her family. She is divorced and as single parent, she wants to make sure she is financially able to support all their children through university education.

Janet operates a 'cold store', selling chilled fish, chicken and meat to customers. She procures assorted fish, chicken and meat in cartons from big-time 'cold store' operators and retails it to her customers. She has operated this trade for the past year. She plans to use the loan to purchase more fish, chicken and meat to stock her deep freezers. 

Janet is currently the leader of a trust bank group called 'Debora', comprised of four members. The other members are also engaged in trades such as food-selling, soap-making and the sale of used clothes. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and to be able to support their children through university education.

loans.use: To purchase assorted frozen fish, chicken and meat for resale

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es: Hermenegildo, de 57 años, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a esposa Matilde de 57 años y su querido hijo que aún es menor de edad, quien lo ayuda en sus cultivos. Los años le han enseñado a Hermenegildo a trabajar muy duro, si quiere que sus cultivos sean los mejores de su poblado y es así que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus sembríos de papa, arveja, habas, olluco y cebada, sean muy solicitados en los mercados de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, lleva 41 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil cuidar de insectos así como del variado clima que afecta la producción. Con el tiempo, desea sembrar toda la extensión de terrenos que tiene, para que pueda aumentar su producción. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que actualmente es lo que mejor se esta vendiendo.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo, 57, is a very responsible and hardworking man. He owns his home where he lives with his wife Matilde, 57, and their young son, who they love and who helps his father with the crops. Over the years, Hermenegildo has learned to be a very hard worker and strives to provide the highest quality crops in Tarma. As a result of his extensive effort, his crops, which include potatoes, peas, beans, root vegetables and barely, are in high demand in Tarma's markets. What he enjoys most about his work is harvesting. He has 41 years experience in this line of work and believes the most difficult aspects of it to be protecting the crops from insects and dealing with an unpredictable climate that can impact production. Over time, Hermenegildo wants to plant the entire area of land that he has, so he can increase production. This is his ninth loan with MFP. He has a solid history of making payments on time and plans to maintain that history with this loan as well. He is a very supportive member of his communal bank. He plans to use the requested $900 to buy pea seeds, given that peas are currently what is selling the most.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pea seeds.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en: Ligaya T.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling rice, educational supplies and also running a mini eatery in her community. She is 29 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Lower Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. Ligaya has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Ligaya joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ligaya is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rachna

texts.en:
Mrs. Rachna Bou and her husband, Mr. Khan Preab, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1992 and have four children: two sons and two daughters.

Rachna has been a silk weaver for more than twenty years. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose S. sells bags of charcoal from her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal. Rose is 51 years old and is widowed. She has 8 children who do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up charcoal stores in various markets.

loans.use: to stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian Z. is from the town of Banga. She is 42 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. She is a farmer and has been planting and harvesting rice for more than a few years now. She also sells pork meat to the market. Sometimes, she makes "chorizo", a pork sausage famous in the Philippines. Lilian wants to have a successful business.

Lilian joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lilian is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 4th loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne A. O. is thirty-six years old. She is married and has three children aged between ten years old and four years old. Her business is located at Nyamasaria in a very business market in Kisumu along the Kisumu-Nairobi road. She sells building poles to private developers, construction workers and hardware shops. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is finding and paying for a means of transporting the poles. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more poles to expand her business and meet customer demand. In future, she hopes to diversify by opening a hardware shop. She describes herself as honest and self-motivated.

loans.use: Buying building poles for resale

loans.name: Tanenkasu Ii Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Tanenkasu II” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each member of the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Mohamed S. who is pictured in the middle. Mohamed was born in Magburaka town. He is 37 years old. Mohamed is married and has five children. His wife is a businesswoman. Three of his children attend primary school and one is in secondary school. Mohamed S. sells boards, bed, chairs, etc. With his share of this loan, he will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy boards, bed, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Narlina

texts.en: Narlina D. C. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 38 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Estrada. Narlina is just starting this business. In 2010, Narlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Narlina is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza vive en la zona de Barrio Grafico de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es comerciante, tiene una tienda de ropa, y también vende a crédito su mercadería en las oficinas.
Esta separada y tiene un hijo en edad escolar.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de poleras, chompas y camisas)
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro.
Con este crédito podrá incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Maritza lives in the Barrio Grafico area of the city of La Paz. She is a shopkeeper and has a clothes store.  She also sells her goods on credit in offices.  She is separated and has a school-age son.  Her loan will be used as working capital (to purchase t-shirts, sweaters and shirts).  This is the first time that she has requested a loan from Impro.  With this loan she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase of t-shirts, sweaters and shirts which are products she sells to her customers

loans.name: Martha Jennifer

texts.es:
Martha de 25 años, vende almuerzos en las tarde por $ 1.60. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Hace tres años comenzó vendiendo comidas en un comedor familiar poco a poco con algunos ahorros y la experiencia que tenía en vender comidas decidió tener su propio negocio de almuerzos por esa buena decisión ahora tiene su pequeño comedor en donde trabaja todos los días con su hermano desde las 06h00am hasta que se acaben los almuerzos. El almuerzo viene con jugo, sopa, segundo por solo $ 1.60. 

Ella quiere continuar con su negocio por eso ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, carnes, frutas para hacer los almuerzos. En el futuro quiere cambiar su comedor en un lugar más segura ya que donde está ubicado es muy peligroso.
texts.en:
Martha is 25 years old.  She sells lunches in the afternoon for $1.60.  She lives in a peri-urban area called Paraíso de la Flor which is a region known for its dirt roads and mountains.

Three years ago she started selling food in a family eatery.  Little by little, with some savings and the experience which she had of selling food, she decided to start her own business selling lunches.  Due to this good decision, she now has a small eatery where she works every day with her brother from 6.00am until her lunches run out.  The lunch comes with juice, soup and main course for only $1.60.

She would like to continue with her business.  For this reason, she would like to use the loan to buy rice, meat and fruit for making her lunches.  In the future, she would like to move her eatery to a safer place since the place she is now is very dangerous.

loans.use: To buy rice and meat

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 42 años de edad,es conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia vende en el mercado de San Pedro de Cusco todos los dias, este es el medio por el cual saca a sus hijos adelante.   

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas insumos para su negocio como arroz,verduras y menestras.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 42 años de edad,es conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia vende en el mercado de San Pedro de Cusco todos los dias, este es el medio por el cual saca a sus hijos adelante.   

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas insumos para su negocio como arroz,verduras y menestras.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Elma Beatriz

texts.es: Elma Beatriz S. L.: trabaja todos los dias Vendiendo en su local carne de res en su carniceria todo los dias menos sabado, tiene que aprovechar en si las fetibidades para vender aparte de eso vende chorizos, y longanizas y pollo destazado, cuenta con el apollo de su familia ya que ella se quedo viuda oproximadamente hace dos años ella lucha por sus hijos todos los dias para llegar a su negocio, ella solicita el credito para comprar un molino de carne y compra de mas bariedad de carne para su carniceria, agradece a fape por la ayuda brindada sueña con agrandar mas su negocio y asi ahorrar un poco mas para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elma Beatriz works every day except Saturday selling beef in her butcher stall.  She tries to take advantage of festival days.  She also sells sausage (chorrizo and longaniza) and cut-up chicken.  Elma can count on the help of her family, since she has been widowed for approximately 2 years.  She comes to her business daily to struggle for her children.

Elma is soliciting a loan to buy a meat grinder and to purchase a greater variety of meat for her butcher shop.  She is grateful to FAPE for offering help and she dreams of enlarging her business and, thus, saving a little bit more to advance her children.

loans.use: TO BUY A MEAT GRINDER AND SELL MEAT

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es:
María Julia tiene 67 años D. edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos ya independizados. ResiD. junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Picsi, una zona agrícola que s encuentra ubicado a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta D. cervezas en su domicilio desD. hace más D. 15 años. Su negocio es bastante conocido en la zona debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad y al buen trato con el que suele atender a sus clientes. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad le permiten ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. los gastos familiares.

María desea adquirir más cerveza para satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes durante esta temporada. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Julia is 67 years old, married, and has four adult children.  She lives with her husband in the district of Picsi, an agricultural area located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been selling beer from her house for over 15 years.  Her business is rather well known in the area because of how long she has been doing this work and for the good treatment she shows her customers.  With the income provided by this business, she is able to help her husband with meeting their household expenses.

María hopes to stock more beer to meet her customers' demand during this time of year.  This is why she decided to request a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to stock more beer to meet her customers' demand

loans.name: Ongau

texts.en:
O. is 84 years old and married with 14 children who are all adults. He has been farming for 40 years in Nyamira town, western Kenya. His mixed farm produces maize, tea, beans, tea, sugarcane and bananas, which are all sold locally. Farming is his only source of income.

He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will enable him to acquire a quality dairy cow that produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas T., 66, is married and lives with her family in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products. T. is a housewife, while her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 9 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 100 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. T. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase pesticide to improve her husband’s farming business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy pesticide to improve her husband's farming business.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia L. is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Claudia is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Claudia owns & operates a business planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Claudia is just starting this business.

In 2008, Claudia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claudia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Claudia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Claudia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Chheuy

texts.en:
Chheuy V., 51, resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. V. and her husband grow mushrooms to sell, earning an income of USD 6.50 each day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 100 on other necessary expenses. 

V. is requesting a loan of USD 1100 to purchase a new motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. V. was not available so V.'s husband appears in the photograph instead of her.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Rahama

texts.en:
Rahama, age 35, is currently in the business of selling tomatoes. She and her husband have five children, all of whom attend school.

Rahama has requested a loan in order to stock more tomatoes to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business with the extra profits expected from her loan.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Purevdash

texts.en:
Purevdash, 54, is married and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, or Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. They have a decent standard of living.

He began selling consumer goods at a local market in 2007. His wife co-works with him and his daughter sells cosmetics. His business is more family-based and they operate three stalls, two of which are for clothes and one of which is for cosmetic sales.He has expanded his business so far and is increasing his business profits continuously. He is a hardworking person who takes initiative and said, "We are trying hard to expand our business and increase our business revenues to help our children finish their college successfully and we are planning to build a house where we can have a comfortable life in the future." Purevdash is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase clothes and cosmetics from China.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn P. is from the village of Cagay-anon, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Marilyn is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a motorcycle transport service.  She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC.  

Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase tires and other accessories for her vehicle. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this investment to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories for her transport vehicle

loans.name: Louch

texts.en: Louch P. is a 38-year-old farmer and mother. She was blessed with five kids, four of whom are attending the public school while one is already married. Louch P. has been working in the farming business for many years. She inherited farmland from her grandmother, where she grows different kinds of crops. She has a life partner in her husband who is a horse and cart driver. Louch P.’s husband uses his own horse and cart to run a taxi service, picking up merchandise and people who want to go anywhere in and around Kompong Cham province. Presently, his cart horse is getting old. He really wants to buy a new one. To do this, Louch P. would like to ask for a loan to buy a cart horse to replace the old one for her husband. She hopes to use the rest of the funds to buy a new horse as well.

loans.use: to buy a cart horse and a new horse.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es: Marcial, D. 56 años; es un hombre responsable. Hace 20 años que se casó con Carmen, su querida esposa. Ambos tienen 4 hijos a los que cuidan con mucho amor en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío D. Santo Domingo. Como buenos esposos y socios, ellos se dedican a diferentes actividades. Marcial desD. hace 25 años, se dedica a L. agricultura, donD. siembra productos oriundos como arveja, zanahoria, maíz y papa, los cuales cuida y fertiliza constantemente. Asimismo se dedica al negocio D. compra y venta D. verduras; donD. lleva una vez a L. semana los productos al mercado central D. L. capital del país, ganando un dinero extra. Además ayuda a su esposa en L. venta D. carne D. carnero, que es muy cotizada en L. capital, por lo que tiene que viajar cada cierto tiempo. “A veces coincidimos en el viaje, y nos ayudamos”, afirma. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es poder coordinar los gastos con su esposa, pues ambos aportan en L. economía familiar. Ahora desea ahorrar para solventar, los gastos futuros para los estudios universitarios D. sus hijos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Santo domingo D. Tapo”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donD. se siente realizado, pues el apoyo que recibe es constante. Marcial, sembrará arveja, por ello con el crédito comprará 1 bolsa D. semilL. y 10 sacos D. abono orgánico para comenzar con éxito su siembra.
texts.en: Marcial, 56, is a responsible man.  He has been married to his beloved wife, Carmen, for 20 years.  They have 4 children who they have lovingly raised in the a house they own near Santo Domingo.  Like all good partners, Marcial and Carmen focus on what each does best.  Maricial has operated a farming business for 25 years.  He grows peas, carrots, maize and potatoes, all of which need constant care.  He also buys and sells vegetables, traveling down to Santo Domingo once a week to sell his merchandise in the central market there.  Carmen operates a butchering business and Marcial helps her sell the meat she produces in the capital where they can get the best price for it.  "We sometimes go together and help each other", he says.  The businesses are important to Marcial because the income they generate have allowed him and his wife to support their family.  He wants to save enough now to send his children to university.  Marcial belongs to the Santo Domingo D. Tapo community bank.  This is his sixth MFP loan and he's grateful for the on-going help that he's received from the bank.  Marcial is planning his next pea crop and he will use this loan to buy 1 bag of seed and 10 bags of organic manure for the farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his pea crop.

loans.name: Badilisa

texts.en:
Badilisa is 64 years old and widowed with one child. She is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. To make a living, Badilisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, beverages, shampoo, soap, and biscuits in the local community. Badilisa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Badilisa joined HSPFI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, junk food and beverages. This will be the first loan taken out by Badilisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to expand and improve her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, junk food, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Habel

texts.en:
Habel is a 58 year old married man with nine children. He has been selling charcoal in Marereni Town in Malindi for the past four years now.  He earns a monthly income of about KES 10,000 from the business. 

This is Habel’s first loan cycle with KADET LTD, and he has applied for a loan of KES 10,000. He plans to use the money to put up a wooden structure that will serve as his business premises, to add to his stock of charcoal for sale, and to buy a new weighing machine for the business. He intends to use the anticipated profits from his business to continue taking care of his family and to save for future investments.

loans.use: to put up a wooden structure that will serve as his business premises, to add to his stock of charcoal for sale, and to buy a new weighing machine for the business.

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es:
Desde hace unos años Álvaro Antonio comenzó su negocio de diligencias en horas de la tarde, ya que en la mañana trabaja como empleado en una empresa.

Álvaro para poder mantener su negocio y para que pueda crecer necesita tener un crédito para sacar sus tarjetas personales y así poder incrementar sus clientes, además de esta forma el podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: A few years ago Álvaro Antonio started his small message delivery and odd jobs business in the afternoons since he’s employed by a firm mornings.  In order for Álvaro to keep his business running and so that it can grow he needs a loan to print his personal business cards so that he can increase his customer base.  Besides, he will also be able to improve his family’s quality of life this way.

loans.use: to print his business cards.

loans.name: Brenda Maria

texts.es: La señora Brenda Maria, tiene 38 años es madre soltera con un hijo. Brenda tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos y ropa, este negocio empezó hace 5 años con muy poco capital  de trabajo, como una búsqueda de fuente de ingresos alternativos. Ella empezó vendiendo muy pocos cosméticos, después fue que empezó a invertir un poco más al observar que la mayoría de sus clientes le solicito variedad en productos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de lápiz labial, brillo, estuches de sombra y estuches de vanidad. Su meta es llegar a tener un una tienda de artículos variados que pueda estar ubicada en el mercado, que brinde las facilidades económicas a ella y a su hijo.
texts.en: Brenda Maria is 38 years old and a single mother with one child. Brenda has a business selling cosmetics and clothing. She started this business 5 years ago with very little working capital, in search of an alternative source of income. She began by selling small amounts of cosmetics, and later she began to invest a little more, upon observing that most of her customers were requesting a greater variety of products. The loan will be invested in buying lipstick, gloss, eye shadow sets and vanity cases. Her goal is to open a store within the local market, where she can sell a variety of items, in order to provide economic security for herself and her son.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, gloss, eye shadow sets and vanity cases.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en:
Narciso is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 8 children. 

Narciso has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. He has had this business for 11 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Narciso is a new member of HSPFI.

In the future, Narciso hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Fairouz

texts.en:
Fairouz is a 38-year-old widow, mother to three lovely children; she has devoted her life to  taking care of them and raising them the best way she can. Fairouz has struggled and is still struggling to provide the best living for her children and to fill the empty place her husband left in her family. She's the mother and the father at the same time; she's the friend and the relative that her children might need. 

She has to be ready for their needs at anytime, and she wants to provide them with the best education ever, that's why she requested a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to pay her children's school fees. Fairouz has been an Al Majmoua borrower for five consecutive loans; they all had a positive impact on her social and financial situation. 

She believes that it's her children who give her support and strength for living and improving their social and financial situation. She hopes to stay healthy to take good care of her precious kids.

loans.use: To pay  her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 46 years old, married to Ruth and they have five children. He has been buying and selling cereals for the last nine years. He transports the cereals around town on his motorcycle. 
 
He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy more cereals to sell.

In the future, he hopes to grow and become a leading supplier of cereals in his town.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to sell

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE BELLA MARIA ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Agustina tiene 35 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 4 hijos, la socia se dedica ahora al engorde de ganados y comercialización de productos secos. La socia  es una mujer muy trabajadora y ella todo el año está trabajando y variando sus actividades principales según la época del año, la socia está sembrando productos de maíz blanco y amarillo, también compra y vende ganados y animales pequeños, ella en esta ocasión esta criando y engordando animales vacunos y también está con su negocio de compra y venta de productos secos, la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra y venta de productos secos y en la alimentación balanceada de minerales que les dará a sus ganados vacunos. La socia solicita el préstamo para el alimento de sus animales vacunos y para la compra de productos secos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “The Triumphant Beautiful Mary” Bank that is located in the Ocongate District in the Quispicanchis Province in the Department of Cusco.
This member, named Agustina, is 35 years old. She is married with four children. She currently works raising cattle and selling dried food products. She is a hardworking woman and works all year, but varies her work depending on the season. She grows white and yellow corn and also buys and sells cattle and small animals. Right now she is raising and fattening up vicuñas and also is working in a business buying and selling dried food. This member would like this loan in order to buy dried food and also to buy a balanced diet to feed her vicuñas. She is asking for this loan in order to buy vicuña food and more dried food products. She is thankful for this loan and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for her animal food and to buy dried food.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped-in water, and her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past two years, she has earned a living selling vegetables from her home. Her main challenge is competition from other local vendors, but she is committed to expand her business and meet the needs of more customers. She is applying for a loan for Kshs. 30,000 to buy bundles of onions, green vegetables, cabbages and bananas. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans which will allow her to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of onions, green vegetables, cabbages and bananas.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en: Magdaline is a hardworking businesswoman who is 23 years old. She is married and has two children. For the last six years, she has been operating a cafeteria to earn a living. She gives gratitude to Faulu Kenya for helping her to grow her business.  Currently, she has employed one person in her business.  In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to buy ingredients such as beans and rice.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice and beans

loans.name: Rougui

texts.fr: Depuis le décés de son époux il y'a prés de 10 ans, l'emprunteuse se bat seule pour entretenir ses 7 enfants dont l'un  est à l'école.Elle pratique l'embouche ovine  en achetant des moutons qu'elle engraisse et revend au bout de quatres mois.Cette activité lui permet de fare face aux multiples besoins de sa famille.Aujourd'hui, elle sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter 30 moutons et de l'aiment concentré.Son ambition est de cloturer son terrain pour en faire une ferme d'élevage de moutons et de volaille.
texts.en:
Since the death of her husband almost 10 years ago, Rougui is struggling to support her seven children by herself. One of them still goes to school.

She raises sheep by purchasing animals that she fattens and resells after four months. This business enables her to answer the multiple needs of her family.

She's now seeking a loan of XOF 400'000 to buy 30 sheep and concentrated food. Her ambition is to fence her land to turn it into a sheep and chicken farm.

loans.use: to buy 30 sheep and concentrated food

loans.name: Nafees Begum's Group

texts.en:
Nafees Begum has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk to be able to fulfill the orders on time and increase her sales. 

She has been operating her business for past 10 years. She does this work to supplement the income of her family.  

Nafees is a mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder son works in a private company and the younger one is in class one, while her younger daughter is in 4th standard. 

Nafees is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her business and increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is married and has three children. Jerry is 30 years old, residing in Segatic Diot Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Jerry plants bananas and does buko (young coconut) vending to earn a living. He's been two years in this business. Each month, he earns PHP 15,000 doing this business. 

Jerry has been a member of GDMPC for a year. He requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase fertilizer. 

In the future, Jerry wants to expand his banana and buko business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
La señora lizbeth tiene 19 años de edad, y está casada con el señor francisco, con quien tiene 1 hijo, se llama Eduardo apenas tiene 2 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hacen más 2 años.
Dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio, porque está buscando la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su pequeño, también para contar con una buena solvencia económica y una mejor calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como: camisas, playeras, camisetas, blusas, vestidos, shorts, faldas, ropa interior, etc. Y así tener un poco mas surtido.
Doña liz (así es como le dicen sus familiares), comenta que el más grande propósito que tiene para su negocio, es el de hacerlo crecer  mucho mas, ya que quiere construir un local y poner su tienda de ropa, puesto que así aumentara sus ganancias, para asegurar la educación de su hijo.
Ella está muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva y FRAC, por esta ayuda que les están ofreciendo, ya que les beneficia muchísimo.
texts.en:
Lizbeth, 19, is married to Francisco with whom she has one child, Eduardo, who just turned two. She has been selling clothes for more than 2 years. She says that she decided to start this business because she was looking for a way to help her husband with the costs of the home and to offer her son a better future. She also wanted to have good financial credit and a better quality of life.

The loan that she received will be used to buy more merchandise like shirts, t-shirts, blouses, dresses, skirts, underwear, etc, so that she can have more inventory. 

Liz (as she's known to her family) says that her biggest goal for her business is to make it grow so that she can build a store to sell her clothes. This will increase her earnings so that she can ensure her son's education. She is very thankful to the Kiva and FRAC donors for the help they've offered her because it benefits her so much.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like blouses, t-shirts, dresses, shorts, skirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Villa Del Sol Group

texts.es:
El comité “Villa del Sol” es D. la ciudad D. Asunción,  se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo del programa D. Mujeres Emprendedoras D. la Fundación Paraguaya, todas las integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas el cual las ayuda en los objetivos que tienen.
Una D. las integrantes es la señora Mirtha, quien por medio D. la venta D. quesos ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, sumado a esto el sacrificio y las horas D. trabajo que ella invierte. Nos comenta que hace un tiempo se dedica a ello y que le ha ayudado mucho, es por eso que le gustaría seguir en lo que hace y D. ser posible ir creciendo más y más.
Ella solicita la ayuda D. la fundación y D. kiva, para la compra D. quesos en cantidad, lo cual le será D. mucha ayuda para abaratar costos y que tenga mayor ganancia. Mirtha, al igual que sus amigas, está muy agradecida a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
The “Villa del Sol” committee is in the city of Asunción.  It’s in its fourth cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s Mujeres Emprendedoras Program.  All of the members carry out productive activities which help them reach their goals.

One of the members is Mirtha who has raised her children by selling cheese added to the sacrifice and hours of work she expends.  She comments that she’s been doing this for some time now and it has helped her much which is why she’d like to continue doing what she does and if possible grow more and more.

She’s asking for help from the Fundación and from Kiva to buy cheeses in quantity which will help a lot to lessen costs and increase her profits.  Mirtha, like her fellow members, is very grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for the opportunity they give her.

loans.use: to buy cheese for subsequent resale.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William, 51 years old, is married and has 3 children. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. William purchases and resells cocoa. His business faces some challenges such as limited capital and price fluctuations. William wants his family to have a good permanent house. He needs money to purchase cocoa for resale.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa for resale.

loans.name: Ime

texts.en:
Ime is a 25-year-old woman living in the town of Safua. She is single and has two school-age children.

To make a living, Ime owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector by raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, her primary source of income from her business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Ime has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 WST per month from these activities.

In 2011, Ime joined SPBD to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, she is now better able to engage in business activities and hopes to improve her family's living situation. Ime is requesting a loan for the first time from SPBD. Specifically, Ime is seeking a loan in the amount of 1,000 WST, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Ime plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business on account of the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is single and has no children yet. She describes herself as an outgoing and smart woman. She has run a beauty salon for the last two years and has two employees. Her business is located in an ideal place with potential for customers. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy beauty products and equipment. In the future Joy hopes to run a bigger parlor where she will be offering various services.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and equipment.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with two children. Judith is 35-years-old and resides at Cabungaan Clarin, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Judith owns and operates a business venture, selling wood and wood-related products in the local community to earn a living. She's been 5 years in this business. 

Each month, she earns PHP 10,000.00 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 13,500.00 to have an additional capital for lumber business. In 2010, Judith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Judith wants to build a house and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to have additional capital for a lumber business.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is married and works hard to support her family. She has a ready-to-wear clothes retail business in the Philippines. Jinky has been in this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more items such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, curtains and other ready-to-wear clothes. 
In the future, Jinky would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, curtains and other ready-to-wear clothes.

loans.name: Robilyn

texts.en:
Robilyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 3 children. 

Robilyn has a shop that sells used clothing like shirts, sweaters and blouses.  She has had this business for 3 years.  She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Robilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Robilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Dionisie

texts.en:
Dionisie aged 54 years. She is married with 2 children aged between 13 and 16 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 8 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house and to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en: Hamlet is 51 years old and with his wife, two sons and his parents in Kapan city of Syunik region. Hamlet’s sons are already grown up and they greatly help their father about their farm. Hamlet is a driver with many years of work experience and all that years he never stopped of being engaged in land cultivation works. He has large vegetable garden where he cultivates potato, tomato, beans, cucumber and cabbage. These vegetables Hamlet sells with his wife at their district to their regular customers. Hamlet asks this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams as he has a lot of works to do about his vegetables garden; he must buy diesel fuel for his final land cultivation works, also potato seedlings and he must settle water pipes along his vegetable garden.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel for his final land cultivation works, also potato seedlings and he must settle water pipes along his vegetable garden

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 34 yrs old, married with 5 children. Her two children are in High School, 2 in primary school while the other is yet to join college. She has been doing this business for the last two years and has recorded tremendous achievement because she has been able to pay farmers on daily basis unlike cooperatives which pays on monthly basis. She has been using plastic Jericans but this has been stopped recently by the cooperatives that they are not hygienic. This has forced milk vendors to buy aluminium cans.

loans.use: She would like to purchase 12 aluminium cans and each cost USD 25.

loans.name: Arweya

texts.en: B. Arweya is a 45-year old father of five children (4 sons and a daughter). He lives with his family in one of the slums of Kisumu, Kenya.  He initiated his tayloring business in 1989 with the help of a sewing machine that he rented for US$ 2.86 a month. Through hard work, he managed to purchase his own machine in 1990. He specializes in making women's dresses and school uniforms. The central location of his shop, in addition to eight years of successfully doing business within the community, has gained him a good reputation and a wide customer base.  With access to the loan, he will be able to expand his business to include a training site (dressmaking) for students. In response to the growing market demand, B. plans to purchase 2 new sewing machines and additional dressmaking materials with a portion of his third loan of US$ 570 which he received from KMET.

loans.use: Expanding business to include Training

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Mrs Phuong is 35 years old; her husband is 38. They have 4 children. The oldest is 14 and the youngest is 6 years old. They are all pupils. The family has a small amount of land but not enough water for cultivation. Her husband has to work as a day-laborer and his work is unstable. Mrs Phuong has to trade vegetables in order to support the family. She needs US $75 for this small business.

loans.use: To trade foods

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: D. T. Hoa is 33 and her husband Huynh van Suu is also 33. The family has 5 persons. The elderly grandmother is 74. Mr. Suu and his wife raise green dragon bushes as a daily labor. Their children, ages 12 and 7, are in 4th grade and 1st grade at school. Their family's average income is US$13 per person per month. They want to borrow US$75 to invest in their green dragon garden. They will pay back US$15 per month over 5 months.

loans.use: invest in their green dragon garden

loans.name: Boris

texts.en:
Boris decided to begin a small market business after retiring and finding he needed to supplement his small government pension. He’s now been selling for over a decade and has developed a successful business that allows him to provide for himself and his wife. He currently sells practical clothing items such as socks, underwear and women’s lingerie.

Not long ago, the market where Boris is located had some remodeling done and he was able to move to a bigger selling location. He has requested a loan of $1200 to help purchase additional inventory that he can use to fill new retail space. Boris has been a great client with Nadiya Ukraine, developing a reputation of honesty and responsibility and never being late with his loan payments. We are happy for this opportunity to continue assisting Boris with his business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for expanded sales location

loans.name: Shohista

texts.ru:
Shohista’s husband is in Russia working as a seasonal laborer. Shohista is 35. She has 2 children. The money that her husband sends over is not enough to sustain her family, so Shohista earns the rest by selling clothing and shoes for children. She received her first MicroInvest loan in 2003. Since then, Shohista increased the assortment and improved the quality of goods sold. She plans to use this loan to refresh her Fall clothing inventory.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Муж Шохисты находится на заработках в России. Ей 35 лет, у нее 2 детей. Присылаемых мужем денег не хватает на жизнь, тем более растут дети и поэтому Шохиста занимается предпринимательством.
