Она продает детскую одежду и обувь. В Микроинвест первый займ получила в 2003 году. С тех пор в ее бизнесе произошли изменения в лучшую сторону. Увеличен ассортимент и улучшено качество продаваемого товара. С новым займом она собирается обновить осенний ассортимент одежды.

loans.use: To refresh clothing inventory

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Ny was married in 1993 and has five children, two sons and three daughters. She has been in the business of selling bananas since 1993. In 2004, she started an additional business planting food crops. Her husband is also in business with her, planting food crops and running a motor taxi. Three of her children are studying at primary school in the village and the other two are at home.

She is asking for a loan from MAXIMA for the second time in the amount of $500. She will use this loan to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run his motor taxi business.

loans.use: Purchasing a motorbike for running a motor taxi.

loans.name: Matilde Benita

texts.es:
Her main economic activity is the selling of fruits such as apples, bananas, oranges, etc. It's been 10 years since she's had her business, it was a gift of C$800.oo given to her by her husband.

She began her business selling vegetables and is actually in a steady market located by the bus terminal. Mrs. C. is a single mom who works very hard to move ahead and support the 6 children that are actually attending primary and secondary school.

Ceprodel has given her financial support for over a year and a half and given her 15 credits. With these credits she has been able to buy more quantities of products that have allowed her increase her earnings; this way she has been able to support her 6 children who need their mom now more than ever.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Su principal actividad económica es la venta de frutas como manzanas, banano, naranjas, etc. Tiene 10 años de tener el negocio que se inicio con un aporte que le obsequió su esposo de C$800.00.

Inicia su negocio vendiendo solamente verduras y se ubica actualmente en el mercado de la Terminal en un puesto fijo que se encuentra al aire libre. La señora C. es madre soltera que viene luchando por salir adelante y apoyar a sus 6 hijos todos estudiando actualmente la primaria y secundaria.

Ceprodel le ha apoyado financieramente desde hace año y medio con un total de 15 créditos otorgados que le ha beneficiado por lo que ha comprado mayores cantidades de productos que le permiten obtener mayores ganancias para así seguir apoyando a sus 6 pequeños que hoy mas que nunca necesitan del apoyo de su madre.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for the stand

loans.name: Suryani

texts.en: Suryani, 27, is the mother of 2 children ages 14 and 3. She sells detergents and earns $3 a day, while her husband, S., sells waste (salvaged) materials and earns $21 a week. She requests a loan of $75 to buy more goods. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Daniela is a married 46 year old with 5 children, all of whom are students. She has spent about 15 years on her business, which consists of selling basic nutritious products, carbonated beverages, dairy products, personal hygiene products, and housecleaning products. Her small grocery store has been able to grow as a result of her efforts, and through the economic support of her husband, who works as a skilled construction worker. Her husband's work is not steady helps in the same way with house expenses.

The small grocery store has been the main source of fixed income in this family and with it they have been able to maintain themselves and live with dignity. At this time, Daniela reports there is not sufficient money to stock the grocery store and offer a significant variety in the products that she has in the store.

Translated from Spanish by Katrina H, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase Basic Grains, Meats, Vegetables, and Perishable Products

loans.name: Farkhanda's Group

texts.en: Farkhanda Q. has lived her entire life in the small city of Chichawatni, Pakistan.  She is a mother of six, with three daughters and three sons. To earn living, her husband works at a factory, whereas one of her sons is a rickshaw driver.  Currently, her family wants to buy an additional rickshaw, which her son plans to rent to another driver to supplement her household's present income. There are several other women in this group applying for a loan: Rasheeda B., who wants to expand her family's shop; Ghafooran B., who wants to buy a rickshaw; and Zareena B., who will invest her share of the loan to expand her family's restaurant.  Altogether, they are applying for a $1,000.00 loan.

loans.use: To buy an additional rickshaw.

loans.name: Sea

texts.en:
Seam S. is a 46-year old widow living in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She has 6 children, three of whom are married. The other three work as garment workers.

Since 2001, Seam S. has operated a small business selling yams wholesale. With this loan, she would like to purchase additional yams in higher bulk quantities so that she can resell them for greater returns.

loans.use: To purchase yams in bulk for resale

loans.name: Dong Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Dong Thi N., 51 years old, joined the Fund in 2003. Her family includes the couple and four grown children, one of which has already started a family. In the first round of funding, she borrowed 100USD to invest in keeping pigs and chickens with the goal of becoming familiar with how the Fund works. After the success of the first year’s loan Ms. N. borrowed larger amounts to do business selling chickens and ducks. After subtracting the costs of running the business, Ms. N. earns 200USD per month. In addition to her husband’s pension, the monthly income brings the couple a comfortable life. With the business growing smoothly, in the coming round of funding Ms. N. requests a loan of 950USD to buy more chickens and ducks.

translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Đông, 51 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 4 người con đã trưởng thành, trong đó người con đầu đã lập gia đình riêng. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị xin vay 100USD đầu tư cho chăn nuôi lợn gà với mục đích làm quen với cơ chế của Quỹ. Sau khi năm đầu vay vốn mang lại hiệu quả, chị Đông vay những mức vốn lớn buôn bán gà vịt. Trừ chi phí một tháng chị Đông lãi được 200USD. Cộng với lương hưu của chồng thì thu nhập hàng tháng giúp cho hai vợ chồng có một cuộc sống khá giả. Công việc tiến triển thuận lợi, vòng tới chị Đông xin vay 950USD để mua gà, vịt bán.

loans.use: Buy poultry

loans.name: Leab

texts.en:
Mrs. Leab T., 32, and her husband, Mr. Seng Ket, 32, were married in 1999 and have three sons, one of whom attends a local school. The family lives along National Road Number Two, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Leab has been growing rice for nine years. Her husband is a construction worker. Three months ago, she has started another business selling vegetables at market in Phnom Penh and it is going well. Mrs. Leab is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Hidaya B.. She is married and has four children aged between 4 and 18. In 2004, Hidaya established her clothing business. Hidaya requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of cloth. In the future, Hidaya plans to increase the quantity and range of her inventory. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of cloth

loans.name: Alba Patricia

texts.es:
Alba Patricia is a young, 33-year-old married mother of 3 children ages 18, 15, and 10. She lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood, in which she runs her own general store to serve her neighbors. Eight years ago, Alba was one of the few people who received water services in the neighborhood, which is why she used to sell water to the people who did not have it. However, after all of the inhabitants were provided with water services, she had to seek a new way to make money. She and her husband decided to sell assorted products from home using their own capital. Alba started out with only a little capital, which is why she needed loans to be invested in her business. This loan will be used to purchase products such as staple grains and pulses, cleaning products, and perishable goods to invest them in her general store because she currently has little merchandise, and would like to expand and diversify her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Alba Patricia es una joven de 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos de 18, 15 y 10 años. Habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, en donde tiene una pulpería en la que atiende a sus vecinos. Hace 8 años Alba era una de las pocas personas que contaba con el servicio de agua en el barrio es por eso que se dedicaba a la venta de agua a las personas que no tenían, pero al instalarse el servicio a todos los pobladores, tuvo que buscar una nueva forma de negocio, y junto a su esposo y con capital propio decidieron comenzar las ventas de diversos productos en su casa de habitación. Alba al inicio contaba con poco capital para empezar, es por eso que ha necesitado de créditos para inversión de su negocio. El préstamo será usado para la compra de productos como granos básicos, de limpieza y perecederos para invertirlos en su pulpería, ya que actualmente cuenta con poca mercadería, y desea diversificar y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase assorted products for general store

loans.name: Luth

texts.en:
Mrs. Luth L., 25, is married with two little children and has been working as a rice farmer since 2005, making about $2 each day.

Her husband is meanwhile self-employed as a construction foreman and typically earns about $5 each day. Mrs. Luth L. would like to request a loan from KIVA to purchase more fertilizers and farming tools to accelerate her work as well as to keep expanding her crops. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Luth L. was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer and farming tools

loans.name: Ejla

texts.en: ŠEjla was born in 1989 and she lives in Bijeljina, a rapidly-growing town in northeast Bosnia. At 19, she is unmarried and lives alone.  She works as an employee at a cosmetics store, where she struggles to make a living on just 300KM/month. She requests a 1,200KM loan from Women for Women International to buy cosmetics and perfumes that she will re-sell to family and friends.  She needs this business to supplement her low income, and she hopes that it will help her to someday open her own cosmetics store.  Her friends have already expressed interest in buying her products.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics that she can re-sell to family and friends.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase products and materials for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mrs. Saret Y., 45, and her husband, Mr. Vun Kimchhun, 46, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1988 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Their sons attend school and their daughter assists her mother in selling grocery items.

Saret has been selling groceries for six years, buying them from Phnom Penh for resale at her house. Her husband has had full-time employment for ten years. Saret now wants to create another business selling diesel oil, and so is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase the oil for resale.

loans.use: To purchase diesel oil for resale.

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en: Mr. Samorn K. lives in Chour Teal village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. With this land, he now faces an obstacle. He does not have an  animal to plow the field. In order to solve this problem, Mr. K. decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. He would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to strengthen the field and make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Prak Yit, is a vegetable seller at the local market. Mr. Samorn K. has eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other two help their parents with the businesses. The remaining four attend the local school. His wife is presented with him.

loans.use: to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow a rice field

loans.name: Annette Nabukenya  ‘S Group

texts.en: Annette is a leader of 5 members of a loan group.  She is 40 years old and married with 5 children, aged between 4 and 22 years. All her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She resides and rents a one roomed house where is staying with six people. They have electricity and no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day . She works in a semi urban area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala.   She sells second hand shoes in the Kalerwe Market, near Kampala city. Annette works seven days a week and uses public transport to and from the market. She buys from Owino Market, one  the busiest markets in Kampala. Annette sells to an average of 10 customers a day and sells to all categories of people.  Annette has been in the retail business since 2005. She has been a member with MCDT for two and half years and is servicing her fifth loan, with the same loan group mates. Annette monthly expenses include rent for her business and accommodation, school fees and feeding the family. She wants to use this loan to buy a supply of more shoes .

loans.use: To stock more shoes

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Dionicia es una mujer que toda su vida a trabajó para salir adelante, a sus 53 años ha logrado tener su casa propia y vive muy feliz. Tiene un puesto D. venta D. ropa en la explanada Laguna Temporal (Lugar donD. se realizan Ferias en Juliaca), sus prendas se venden rápidamente, ya que tiene los últimos modelos D. moda, además que ella es una vendedora muy alegre y siempre está D. buen humor. A Dionicia lo que más le gusta D. su negocio es conversar con sus colegas que venden cerca D. ella, ya que le hacen más amenas sus largas jornadas. En el futuro desea tener una tienda muy granD. donD. pueda vender mucha más ropa y pueda brindarle a sus clientes mayores comodidades, lleva 35 años realizando este negocio y lo más difícil para ella es transportar la ropa, ya que le es muy cansado y agotador. Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido y está dispuesta a ahorrar cada día para pagar todas sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar D. las demás socias. Dionicia invertirá el dinero que solicita en incrementar su capital D. trabajo, con lo cual comprará más ropa, para surtir mejor las prendas que venD..
texts.en:
Dionicia who has worked all her life to improve her situation. At 53 years of age, she managed to have a house of her own and she is very happy. She sells clothing in the Laguna Temporal esplanaD., where markets are held in Juliaca. Her clothes sell quickly as she carries the latest fashions and because she is a pleasant saleswoman and always in a good mood. The best part of her work is being able to speak with her colleagues who sell near her as they make the days pass more quickly. She would like to have a larger store in the future, where she could sell more clothes and offer her clients greater comfort. She has been in this line of business for 35 years and she finds transporting the clothing the most difficult part of the job as it is very tiring and exhausting. This is her second loan from MFP. She is very happy to have been approved and is ready to save money every day in order to repay the loan. She is very much loved by her community bank as she is always concerned about other members' well-being. Dionicia will invest the loan in the purchase of more clothing and to stock up on the clothes which she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to retail

loans.name: Hanch

texts.en: Hanch K., 39, is married and lives in the Siem Reap province with her husband. Since 2003, she has been selling vegetables and raising pigs to earn a living. She is able to make US$4 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer and makes US$5 a day. This couple has one school-aged child. Hanch K. would like to request a loan to purchase fertilizer and gas.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and gas.

loans.name: Isaías

texts.es:
El señor Isaías Marques y su esposa la señora Leonor Tapia ya son personas grandes de edad y sus hijos que tiene sus propias familia. En esté momento ellos están viviendo con uno de sus hijos, y desean tener su propio vivienda.
Esta solicitando una casa por medio de Infonavit (Crédito Gubernamental) pero le está haciendo falta una cantidad para completar la vivienda y en este momento no cuenta con el dinero para pagar la diferencia, por tal motivo nos solicita un préstamo para completar y así le pueden entregar su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Isaias Marques and his wife Ms. Leonor Tapia are mature adults and their children already have their own families. Right now they are living with one of their children and they would like to have their own house. He is requesting a house through a government program called Infonavit but lacks the full amount to complete the house. Right now he does not have the money to pay the difference. He is requesting a loan to finish it so he will finally be given his house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquisition of a home through Infonavit program

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
M. Ruth is one of the executive members of Naalya agali awamu group in Kampala. She is a businesswoman with a retail shop that she has owned for over nine years. She has seen it grow ever since she joined her group and started getting loans for business expansion.

She is married with four children who are all in boarding schools and she is grateful that she has been working hand in hand with her husband who is the Deputy Headmaster of Naalya SS.

She needs a new loan to help with recapitalizing her shop with more sugar, rice, soap and milk that she buys in large quantities for profitability.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more sugar, soap, milk and rice

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
La señora Constantina es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene 5 hijos, vive en el Barrio 3 de Mayo Av. Del Niño y cuenta con estudios de 3ro de segundaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años e inició su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su negocio de compra y venta de carne.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo por el monto de 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad de de carne.  Su mayor deseo es vender al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la solidaridad y los apoyos.
texts.en:
Señora Constantina is a member of the Manuela Ramos communal bank in the district of Mazocruz, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 49, lives with her boyfriend, and has 5 children. She studied through her third year of secondary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 4 years, and her first loan was for 300 PEN, which let her expand her business by buying and selling meat. Currently she is requesting her ninth loan in the amount of 3,000 PEN, which will let her buy a larger quantity of meat. Her biggest dream is to become a wholesaler. What she likes most about her communal bank is the solidarity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris G. is 41 years old, and is married with one daughter. Her daughter had a child and dropped out of school. Doris now lives with her daughter and grandchild in a rented apartment in the town of Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Doris' husband is a farmer and Doris is a cereals trader. She procures bags of maize from farmers in nearby communities and sells in the local market to retailers. She also treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe V. is from the village of Tamban, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Fe is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Fe works in someone else's business venture selling agricultural equipment. The main source of income for this business comes from planting and harvesting rice and mangoes for sale. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Fe is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP to be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Fe from PMPC. She plans to use it for full payment towards a motorcycle for livelihood use. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for livelihood use.

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Rauf

texts.ru: Саидов Рауф проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 25 лет. Женат, детей не имеет. Рауф имеет собственную хлебопекарню, где печет лепешки и продает их на рынке. Ему в этом также помогает его сын. Клиент просит кредит, для закупа сырья, т.е. увеличение товараоборота.
texts.en:
Rauf S. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 25 years old, married and has no children. Afzal owns a bakery, where he bakes flatbread and sells them at the market. His son also helps him with the business. Our client is requesting this loan in order to buy raw materials and increase turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing turnover

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Karina es casada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, de profesión profesora y culminó la carrera de enfermería, Karina vende cosméticos por catalogo y también ropa a pedido, todas sus ventas son al crédito.
Karina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lencería.
Los sueños de Karina son sacar el titulo de enfermería y velar por el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Amor Divino Microfinance Institute.

Karina is a 32-year-old married mother with 2 children. She is a teacher who completed the Nursing Program. She also sells cosmetics by catalog and apparel by special order on credit.

She needs a 600.00 PEN loan, which she will use to purchase lingerie.

Karina dreams of obtaining her Nursing license and of watching over her children’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lingerie

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has owned and run a small milk distribution business for the past two years. A 30-year-old man, Patrick has requested his third loan of Ksh. 30,000 after successfully repaying two loans of Ksh. 10,000 and Ksh.20,000, in order to add stocks of milk. He hopes that this loan will help to raise his income and allow him to grow his milk business. One day, Patrick wants to get married and raise a strong family. Patrick describes himself as jovial, friendly and diligent.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Kem T., age 29, is a widow and has a child. She lives with her child in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, she operates a business producing Cambodian traditional cake, earning approximately 4 USD per day. This amount of income is the primary source of income for the family.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, T. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, T. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of 500 USD to purchase rice and sugar to manufacture more cakes to sell. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money for her child's education.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to two sons and three daughters, all of whom attend school. Joyce is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo, a town in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She runs a grocery store by the street in her community. Joyce buys her goods from Kumasi, a nearby city. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy all kinds of provisions in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisios for her store.

loans.name: Yamuna

texts.en:
Mrs. Yamuna S. operates her own bag shop. She sells ladies bags and school bags at her shop. She opened her bag shop two years ago to improve the living standards of her family. These days, she is facing heavy competition in her business. So, to stay competitive, she must be able to provide the latest fashion bags. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 rupees to buy a variety of new fashionable bags to meet her competition.

Mrs. Yamuna S. lives in Chetrapati, Kathmandu, with her husband and three children. Her husband, Mr. Dipak lal S., works in a government office. She has two sons and one daughter. All her children are now in school.

loans.use: To buy the latest fashion bags

loans.name: Elizabet

texts.es: Elizabeth es una mujer trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa  región D. Ucayali, es madre D. seis hijos todos mayores D. edad, se dedica al alquiler D. cuartos y también tiene un motocarro que lo alquila diariamente, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que es empleado en una institución estatal. Es socia del Banco Comunal “La Positiva” desD. hace tres años. Ella empezó con un crédito D. 300 soles que le ayudo a invertir en productos para la venta D. menús, ahora ella necesita un crédito  D. 2300 que le permitirá construir cuartos para alquiler. La meta D. Elizabeth es comprarse un motocarro y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very hard-working woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She has six grown children. She rents rooms, and she also has a “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) that she rents out daily. She counts on her husband’s support; he works for a state institution. She has been a member of the La Positiva Communal Bank for three years. She started with a loan for 300 PEN, which helped her to buy products for her meal sales. Now she needs a loan for 2,300 to allow her to build rooms to rent. Elizabeth’s goal is to buy a “motocarro” and to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Hellen Wambui

texts.en:
Hellen Wambui N. is married and resides in Nairobi. Hellen believes she is hardworking. She has been in the housing rental business for 17 years The people residing in her rental houses are mainly casual laborers and business people of the area.

Hellen was introduced to KADET through existing clients. She intends to use this loan to renovate her rental houses (painting and repairing walls).

With the extra profits she intends to purchase more real estate.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their families across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To renovate her rental homes (paint and repair walls)

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La señora Mery, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Luz y Esperanza II”,  Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años y 03 hijos,  todos ya independientes. 

Mery anteriormente, trabajaba realizando limpieza en una casa, posteriormente dejo D. hacerlo, ya que por motivos D. salud, debió reposar. Actualmente después D. su mejorarse, decidió implementar su propio negocio, D. venta D. chupetes y chichas (Bebida Regional D. la Selva, preparado a base D. maíz molido), ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, que a día a día la frecuentan, por el sabor rico que le pone a sus chupetes.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,300.00, comprará ingredientes para la preparación D. su producto como azúcar en kilos,  cajas D. leche y frutas que a diario necesita para la preparación D. los chupetes, a diario cuenta con sus productos surtidos, para así poder captar una mayor clientela. 

Mary, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse en el medio donD. se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Mery, 40, is married and the mother of 3 children, all of whom are independent. She is a member of the “Luz y Esperanza II" (Light and Hope II) communal bank and lives in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She used to work as a housekeeper but had to leave this employment for health reasons. Now, having recovered, she decided to set up her own business: sale of popsicles and chichas (a regional drink from the jungle maD. from a ground corn base) from her own home, in a well-apportioned ambience, to care for her customers who daily consume from her thanks to the delicious flavor of her popsicles. With this 1,300 sol loan she will buy ingradients like kilos of sugar, boxes of milk and fruit which she needs daily for popsicle preparation which she produces daily in a variety of flavors to attract a wider clientele. Mary feels strong to continue working and persevering daily and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the help it gives women like her to have opportunities to develop in their areas of interest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and ingredients for her popsicle preparation.

loans.name: Siama

texts.en:
Siama T. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more chairs and tables in order to seat more customers. Siama is 40 years old and married. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for renting.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more chairs and tables in order to seat more customers.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Mrs. Rom C. is a villager in Dam Nak village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. 

Her husband, Mr. Nao Run, is a motorbike repairer. He needs some motorbike supplies to support his business. Thus, Mrs. Rom C. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, as well as to buy three piglets for breeding. She is 45 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, three help their parents' businesses, and the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy three piglets for breeding

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla V. is 53 years old. She has a farm that she tills every day so she can buy food, clothes, and other basic needs. She is planning to expand her business so she needs a consistent, abundant harvest from her farm. Her family eats the rice from her harvest and then sells the excess to traders for income. 

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies so she can expand her harvest and earn more income for her family.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bags of beans, in bulk.

loans.name: La Costanera Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Costanera” esta representado por la señora María Ylda y conformada por 14 miembros que van cursando ya un segundo ciclo con la institución demostrando puntualidad y solidaridad con sus integrantes. Cada socias tiene un negocio propio como la venta de comida, empanadas, refrigerios, bebidas en licorerías, pescado, abarrotes y gasolina; la presidenta se dedica la venta de refrigerios al paso ella tiene un puesto se sándwiches y hamburguesas al paso ella es madres soltera y tiene una pequeña niña, vive con su mama  por lo que no paga alquileres pero también tiene hermanitas menores a las cuales debe ayudar a educar es por esta razón que se esfuerza para sacar a delante a sus familia ya que desea que sus hermanas puedan terminar de estudiar y ayudar a su mama a mantener sus hogar. A pesar de existir mucha competencia en el mercado laboral muchas de las socias saben como salir adelante ya que tienen años trabajando en su rubro y saben como salir de apuros. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de insumos, materiales y herramientas para seguir con sus negocios por ejemplo la presidenta desea un carrito móvil para vender sus hamburguesas y poder desplazarse más cuando no hay muchas ventas.  La mayor expectativa de las socias es poder tener sus puestos de trabajo con más  Implementación, equipamiento, ampliación y surtir mercadería para tener buenas  ventas en el futuro que ayudaran a brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
"La Costanera" ("The Coast") is led by Mrs. Maria Ylda. The group's 14 members are working with Fundación AgroCapital for the second time; they have proven to be co-operative and punctual. Each member of La Costanera has his/her own business. They sell food, baked goods, snacks, alcoholic drinks, fish, groceries and gasoline. Maria, the group leader, sells snacks and has a job making sandwiches and hamburgers. Maria is a single mother; she lives with her young daughter, her mother and her little sisters. She doesn't have to pay rent, but she works to get ahead because she wants to help her sisters get an education, and she wants to help her mother with household responsibilities. There's a lot of competition in the local labour market these days, but the members of La Costanera have experience and problem-solving skills working in their favour. They'll be using this loan to purchase the supplies, materials and tools they need for their businesses. For example, Maria wants a push-cart that she can use when selling burgers. She'd be able to move to new locations when sales in one spot taper off. The group hopes that more and better supplies and equipment will help their sales, their families and their overall quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Thoek

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoek K. is 35 years old and she lives in Moeang Prachen village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares (3.75 acres) of land which she cultivates. Her husband; Mr. Lorn Ly, is a fisherman and he is shown on the right in the photo.

In order to support her growing crops, Thoek K. decided to ask for a loan to dig a well. The rest of the loan she would use to buy baby fish to raise.

Thoek K. is the mother of five children, four of whom are students in the local public school and also help their parents as part of their daily chores, while the youngest one is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To dig a well and to buy baby fish

loans.name: Nang

texts.en:
Mrs. Nang M., 33, has been making rattan cupboards from home to generate income. She is a married mother and is blessed with two kids. Both of them are too young to go to school. 

Another source of family income comes from her husband who buys and sells used goods. He uses his old vehicle as transportation in his business. Recently, the vehicle has frequently broken down. This impacts on the income from his business. Therefore, Nang M. has requested a loan of $500 to replace the old vehicle.

loans.use: To replace an old vehicle.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan R. is currently in the business of selling beer and local brew at home, and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Susan is 20 years old and is married to a policeman. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a pharmacy.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma C. is from the village of Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 47 years old. Emma is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products as well as "hypo"or all-purpose detergent powder in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Emma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Francisco Eremi

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Eremi de 47 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Haydee Mejía, tiene 4 hijos: El mayor de 19 años de nombre estudia segundo año de su carrera universitaria y además colabora en las actividades de su pequeña parcela, Yudelsi segundo año de secundaria, Sadrach tercer grado de primaria, y Samir el menor de 3 años de edad,  doña Haydee trabaja como docente en colonia los Laureles apoyando con los gastos familiares. Francisco desde hace 10 años labora como docente en colonia los Laureles como maestro educacion de primaria y secundaria, se recibio de Licenciado en Español y ademas es Ingeniero Agronomo.  

Actualmente tiene la necesidad de construir anexo en su casa de habitacion para ampliar y  mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, pero no cuenta con los recursos economicos necesarios para llevar a cabo dicha obra, por lo que  esta solicitando su 1er credito pues a la institucion esperando que le apolle para hacer realidad su sueño.   

El mayor sueño de don Francisco es poder ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y personas de bien que ayuden a sacar adelante el pais.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco Eremi is 47 years old and married to Sra. Haydee Mejía. They have four children. The oldest child is 19 years old, a second-year university student, and also helps with the activities on their small plot of land. Yudelsi is a second-year high school student. Sadrach is a third grade elementary school student. Young Samir is three years old. Doña Haydee works as a teacher in the Laureles subdivision and helps with the family expenses. Francisco has worked ten years as a teacher in the Laureles subdivision at both the elementary and secondary levels. He recently received a degree in Spanish and is also an agricultural engineer.

He currently needs to build an extension to his house in order to expand and improve the living conditions of his family. However, he does not have the financial resources to carry out the work, so he is requesting his first loan from the Institution in hopes of realizing his dream.

Don Francisco’s greatest wish is to see his children develop into professionals and good people who will help the country move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build an extension to his house

loans.name: Lamin Nyim East Okello Beatrice Group

texts.en: O. Beatrice is a forty-year-old, hardworking businesswoman; she is married and has nine children, four of whom are going to school. She has a grocery business and she has been operating in it for over ten years. She is using the loan to purchase grocery items such as silverfish, tomatoes, onions, and so forth. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items such as silverfish, tomatoes, onions, and so forth.

loans.name: Noorzia Noori Group

texts.en:
This is Zabihullah son of E.. He is 27 years old and the leader of Noorzia Noori group, and a married father of three children. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a barber and has a shop in the city. He has been involved in this business for more than two years. Now he wants to buy new furniture for his shop.

Therefore, he has requested a loan. With this loan, he wants to buy three chairs for his shop. He would like to say thanks to all lenders, Kiva and AFS in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy new furniture for his shop

loans.name: Yrene

texts.es: Yrene tiene 31 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo Orlando D. 32 años y sus 3 hijos, en su acogedora casa que es propia D. material rustico a base D. madera y calaminas. Sabe que los esfuerzos que realiza sobre sus cultivos son fundamentales para obtener una cosecha productiva, por eso cada mañana sin interrupciones trabaja en sus cafetales y platanales. Lleva 4 años labrando L. tierra junto a su esposo, paralelamente tienen una tienda D. comestibles que abren en las tardes y los fines D. semana, ya que son los días D. mayor demanda. Lo que más le gusta D. L. agricultura es L. cosecha a pesar D. que le resulta pesado trasladar sus productos hacía el mercado D. su ciudad, pero lo considera rentable por los beneficios que le deja. Por eso planea comprar más terrenos donD. pueda incrementar su productividad D. café, asimismo quiere ampliar y modernizar su bodega. Esta es L. primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y se compromete ser puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas. Además considera a sus compañeras D. su grupo comunal, como personas muy responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, contratará operarios para instalar un vivero D. café.
texts.en:
Yrene, 31, lives in her own house with her husband, Orlando, 32, and their three children. Her cozy house is maD. of rustic materials like boards and metal sheeting. She realizes that the efforts put into her plantings are fundamental to obtaining a productive harvest. Therefore, every morning without exception, she works on her coffee and banana plantings. She has been in this line of work with her husband for the past 4 years. They also have a grocery store that they open during afternoons and weekends because that’s when demand is highest. What she enjoys most about farming is harvesting even though it is hard work to transport the crops to the city’s market; however, the work is profitable and yields good benefits. She is planning to buy more farmland to increase coffee production and she also wants to modernize and enlarge her grocery store. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She also considers her fellow communal bank members to be very responsible people. She will use the requested funds to hire workers to install a coffee nursery.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To hire workers to install a coffee nursery.

loans.name: Nils

texts.es: Nils, de 29 años, es un padre de familia muy sencillo y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Reyda de 24 años y su único hijo, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo al que se dedica Nils, es la siembra de papas, choclos y arvejas, los cuales después de cosecharlos, vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de tarma, en donde ya tiene varios clientes, que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todo al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus siembra de la plaga o de otros insectos que perjudicasen su siembra. En adelante, espera seguir vendiendo sus productos, por lo tanto anhela comprarse un auto, con el que pueda transportar sus cultivos. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro préstamo en el futuro. En su grupo comunal, es un socio muy responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará fertilizantes e insumos para proteger su siembra de la plaga.
texts.en:
Nils is 29 years old, he is a very simple and happy family man, and he lives in a house he owns with his wife Reyda, who is 24 years old, and their son, the two reasons behind all of his efforts. Nils dedicates himself to agriculture, sowing potatoes, maize and peas: after the harvest he sells them on the wholesale market in the town of Tarma. He already has many customers there who, knowing the quality of his products, do not hesitate to wait for him to buy all his products in bulk. What he likes more about his job is sowing his lands and making them rich and productive. He has been working in this field for 5 years, and he thinks that the most difficult part is to protect his crops from the blight or from other insects that may harm his crops. He hopes to keep on selling his products in the future, and for this he wishes to buy a car to transport his crops with. This is his ninth loan with MFP: he knows he has to be punctual in his repayments if he wants to be granted another loan in the future. He is a very responsible member of his communal bank, always worried about the well-being of his group. With the two thousand PEN he is requesting he will buy fertilizer and supplies to protect his crops from the blight.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and supplies to protect his crops from the blight

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen H. is 28 years old. He is married and has a son. Karen lives in Gandzakar village, Ijevan area and works at the State Labor Agency as a specialist. He is also engaged in animal husbandry. Also, Karen and his brother run a woodworking shop. Thanks to income from these occupations Karen supports his young family.

Now Karen is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy five pigs and fodder for his farm's cows, calves and pigs.

loans.use: To buy five pigs and fodder for his farm's cows, calves and pigs.

loans.name: Haltar

texts.en: Haltar N. is 47 years old and lives with her family in Hovd province, western Mongolia in their own ger, a traditional housing tent. Her oldest child currently attends university, another child goes to a local middle school and her husband works in Hovd University. Haltar began her business in 2000 and currently operates a clothing retail business out of a rented stall at the local market along with providing a veterinary service as a veterinarian. She has found success in her trade and has used her earnings to support her family and pay her son's tuition fees. In the future, she hopes to continue seeing her business succeed and grow. She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials in order to complete their house building.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials in order to complete their house building

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama K. is a widow with five dependants. She has no educational background.  Ama prepares kenkey to sell and distribute. She also sells the uncooked maize at Takoradi. Ama uses the income she generates from her sales to educate and feed her children. Ama will use the loan to purchase more maize to cook kenkey to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to establish a kenkey production centre.

loans.use: To purchase more maize

loans.name: Davlatbegim

texts.en:
C. Davlatbegim is divorced and has 4 children. She runs a business selling women’s shoes and fabrics for sewing national dresses at the central market of Kumsangir, Tajikistan. Her business exhibits good economic characteristics and fundamentals. Davlatbegim has a unique talent for identifying new opportunities and determining appropriate growth policies for her business. She has been in this trade for 6 years.

 Davlatbegim would like to get a loan of 3,000 USD to increase her working capital so that she can continue working to improve her business. We believe her natural ability to please her customers by perceiving their needs and offering speedy, courteous service will help Davlatbegim achieve her goals, sustain her success, and succeed as an entrepreneur.  
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Celestino

texts.en:
Celestino Y. is from the village of San Isidro.  He is 53 years old.  Celestino is married and has two adult-aged children.  To make a living, Celestino owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice.  Celestino has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Celestino joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celestino is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.  This loan will be the first loan taken out by Celestino from ASKI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Ramona Cecilia

texts.es:
Ramona de 56 años, Tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.   

Inicio con su tienda porque no quería depender de su esposo, y también porque su sector no había un lugar donde vendieran víveres, poco a poco la ha venido surtiendo con aceites, arroz, bebidas etc. Sus dos hijas en ocasiones le ayudan en la tienda ya que trabaja desde las 08h00am.  

Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo enlatados, arroz, bebidas. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Ramona, 56 years of age, and has a small store in the back part of her house. She lives in a suburban zone called Duran, characterized by an ecology in decline. She began her store because she didn't wish to depend upon her husband, and also because her sector didn't have a place selling foodstuff. Little by little, she has begun to stock it with cooking oil, rice, drinks, etc. Her two daughters help in the store on occasions, and it opens for business at 8:00am. To better stock her store, with this loan she wishes to buy canned goods, rice, and drinks. In the future, she wants to finish constructing her house.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MILK PRODUCTS, RICE AND DRINKS TO SELL

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 52 years old. Rebecca is married and has 6 school-aged children. She is involved in farming. She has been planting and harvesting rice crops for more than a few years now. She also grows pigs for fattening and sale. Rebecca hopes to have a stable income to sustain her children's education.

Rebecca joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and feeds.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence N. lives in the Kawala neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  Florence has a business of selling bananas.  She has been in this business for over than 10 years and she works six days a week.  Florence sells her bananas at the market.    Florence has requested a loan for 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.  Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot of land and to start going to farmers directly.   Florence lives in a home, which she rents, and does not have access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Las Semillitas Group

texts.es:
Los miembros de este grupo son vecinos y su nombre significa "The Little Seeds" porque tienen gran planes para crecer.  El grupo trabaja con Edaprospo desde el 2008.  Juan es el tesorero, trabaja en labores de construcción. La Presidenta del grupo se llama Ana, y usa la camisa verde.  Ana está casada y tiene 42 años.  Éste es su cuarto préstamo con EDAPROSPO.   Sus dos hijas con edades de 7 y 13 años, van al colegio todos los días.  Lleva nueve años con su negocio, una bodega (tienda de comestibles) que era de su suegro.  La bodega se llama "Pancho" y vende leche, arroz, azúcar y mucho más,  todo que necesiten sus
vecinos que son cosas de primera necesidad.  Ana intenta ofrecer a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos, y con este préstamo, será posible aumentar su mercadería.
texts.en:
The members of this group are all neighbors. They named their group "The Little Seeds" because they have big plans to grow.  They have been working with Edaprospo since 2008.  Juan is the treasurer and works in construction.  The president of the group is Ana and is wearing the green shirt.  

Ana is 42 years old and married.  This is her fourth loan with Edaprospo.  Her two daughters, ages 7 and 13,  attend school every day.  For the past nine years Ana has been running a grocery store that used to belong to her father-in-law. The store is called "Pancho" and they sell milk, rice, sugar and many of the other basic necessities that her neighbors need.  Ana tries to offer her customers a wide variety of products and this loan will make it possible for her to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Agnes Ekua Korankyewaa

texts.en:
Agnes Ekua korankyewaa A. sells banku (corn dumplings eaten in hot soup) and maize in Abura.  Agnes has no educational background. She is divorced and has one child. She is responsible for the welfare of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to sell and to use in cooking banku, which she also sells. She hopes to reinvest her new profits.

In this picture, Agnes is displaying the maize she sells and cooks.

loans.use: To buy maize to sell and use in banku

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, es socia del Bancomunal Imperio, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos de 18, 16 y 4 años.
Faustina tiene una tienda de abarrotes.Decidió abrir un tienda de abarrotes, porque en el lugar donde vive no había tiendas, le va bien en su negocio. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, leche, pollo, carne, huevo, aguas gaseosas, jabones, detergente.
Le gusta las reuniones de su bancomunal porque puede acceder a los créditos y puede ahorrar, le enseñan y practican los valores. Su sueño es poder construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Susana is a member of the Communal Bank “Imperio” (Empire). She is a single mother with three children (ages 18, 16, and 4).

Susana manages a grocery store. She decided to start this business because the area where she lives does not have any stores, and is doing well in this venture. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of groceries such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, chicken, meat, eggs, water, sodas, soap, and detergents.

Susana enjoys the Communal Bank meetings because she is able to access loans and accumulate savings. She is also able to teach and practice the values. Her dreams include building a home and seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. sells cooked rice at Takoradi. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer.  Ama assists her husband in providing for the basic needs of the family, such as food, clothing and shelter.

Ama plans to use the proceeds from this loan  to buy rice and other ingredients to expand her business. She hopes to use any increased profits from her business to build a better place for her customers to sit to eat.

loans.use: to buy rice and other ingredients for a stall that sells cooked food

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 55 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger housing districts of the city. Narantsetseg and her husband are both retired and her husband helps her in her business. Narantsetseg’s two daughters live apart from her, in Selenge province in northern Mongolia. 

Narantsetseg supports her family by selling coal and firewood at Tsaiz, the largest outdoor firewood and coal market in Mongolia. 

In 1995, when she first began her business, she had 500,000 MNT in working capital. She purchases coal and firewood by truck from her suppliers and sells them in small bags.  Now her working capital is 1.5 million MNT.  Besides firewood and coal trading she also sells candies, bakery products, purified water, juices and other small foods from a small booth.

She is requesting a 1,000,000MNT loan to purchase a large amount of coal and firewood before the Mongolian Lunar New Year holiday. During this holiday, demand for her coal and firewood is very high and it is the best time to purchase coal and wood in large amounts from the suppliers.

Narantsetseg says that she want to grow her business with this loan and become a supplier of firewood and coal trading with her own truck.  Her goal is to improve her living by moving into an apartment so her family can unite with the two daughters in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of coal and firewood before the Mongolian Lunar New Year holiday

loans.name: Ngeang

texts.en:
Ngeang T., 53, is married and resides with her family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. T. sells groceries, earning an income of about $25 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $100 on food and $70 on the other necessary expenses. 

T. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her 4th loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria F. is from the city of Carmen Annex Ozamiz City. She is 56 years old, a widow and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a transportation services business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor services. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair the existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be Gloria's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair the existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem H., 29, resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for angkorean temples. H. is a housewife while her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 3 on the other necessary expenses. 

H. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to pay for the children’s school fees. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To pay for the children's school fees.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, age 30 and married, owns and operates a shop where he sells a variety of goods. Emmanuel has owned his shop for seven years and is well known in his community. The hours of his business are from 7 a.m. until 8 a.m. every day. Emmanuel employs two people in his business.

Emmanuel is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, Emmanuel will expand his business by investing in the sale of foodstuffs such as beans, rice, cooking oil, and sugar. He has high hopes that his revenue will increase as a result of such an investment. If successful, Emmanuel will keep reinvesting in his business for better financial stability, with the ultimate goal of better providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods, mainly foodstuffs such as beans, rice, and sugar, to offer for sale in his shop

loans.name: Mary Grace Pastor's Group

texts.en:
Mary Grace P. is from the village of Simmimbaan. She is the leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Mary Grace P. Group.
Mary Grace is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a bakery, baking and selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Mary Grace joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baking equipment. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena S. is from the village of Kimanait, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Lorena is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Lorena owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, detergent, biscuits, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Lorena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Lorena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital for her business. 

Lorena is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods & beverages. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this investment to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia V. is from the village of Kilikili, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 42 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business making general household furniture and selling them to local businesses and community members. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. 

Virginia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase tools & other equipment to expand her business. This loan will be her 6th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy tools & equipment for her furniture business

loans.name: Diana Flor

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer soltera de 21 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres , cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la calle Chile del distrto de José Leonardo Ortiz que a la vez pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican principalmente al comercio al por mayor y menor.
Diana  se dedica a la venta de utencilios de cocina (ollas, cucharas, platos,etc), negocio colocado  en el mercado Modelo de Chiclayo; actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años aproximadamente, su negocio lo tiene abierto mañana y tarde, estos productos se venden todos los días y así puede tener los ingresos que necesita para solventar sus gastos.
El crédito que ha solicitado Diana a Edpyme Alternativa es de 3000 nuevos soles y su destino será para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para seguir ofertándolo en el mercado a sus clientes, ha pesar de la competencia que tiene en la misma zona trata de seguir adelante.
Diana es una nujer trabajadora y gracias a su esfuerzo puede tener más adelante una tienda más grande con productos  nuevos y  seguir a yudando a sus padres en tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diana is 21 years old and single.  She lives in her parents' home which has water and electricity and is located in Chile Street, in José Leonardo Ortiz district, in Chiclayo province.  The residents of this district mainly work selling products wholesale and retail.

Diana sells cooking utensils (pans, spoons, plates, etc.)  Her business is located in the Mercado Modelo market in Chiclayo.  She has been in this business for approximately four years and her business is open mornings and afternoons.  She sells her products every day and this is how she is able to make the income she needs to cover her expenses.

Diana has requested a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa and she will use this money to buy a larger quantity of merchandise so that she can continue selling to her customers in the market.  In spite of the competition that she has in her area, she tries to get ahead.

Diana is a hard-working woman and, thanks to her efforts, in the future she will be able to own a larger store with new products and continue helping her parents to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more cooking utensils

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is from the village of Kulasihan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Gemma is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Gemma owns and operates a a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and breads in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Gemma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods. This will be the second loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods.

loans.name: Jiguisseme 2 Group

texts.fr:
JIGUISSEME 2 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Blendio dans l’ex cercle de NIENA région de SIKASSO troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Le groupe est composé de 7 femmes.  Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et au moins 5 enfants et exercent la culture d’arachide de riz et de mil.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, de riz des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Blendio et de Nina ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de NIENA et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
KADIA compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter, 2 sacs d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000 à 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Jiguisseme 2 is a group of married women from the village of Blendio in the former circle of Niéna, in the Sikasso region, which is the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.  There are seven women in the group.  They live in large, traditional families extending to their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc.  Their average age is 32, they have an average of five children each, and they work growing peanuts, rice and millet.

Hoping to make their agricultural work more profitable, the group members decided to take part in the Soro Yiriwaso loan program.
