The current loan will be used to purchase a sufficient quantity of seeds for peanuts and rice, as well as small equipment and soil inputs for cultivating the plants; these will be purchased at the large market of Blendio and the city of Nina.  After wintering over, the harvests are stored for some time to build their value before being sold at the large market in Niéna and the surrounding markets.  They are sold retail (and often wholesale), over the counter to customers who generally come from large cities.

Kadia plans to use her loan to purchase two bags of urea and two bags of complex fertilizer, with the remaining amount going towards costs of labor, including hoeing.  She is aiming for an average profit of between 50,000 and 60,000 CFA francs, which will be used to pay off interest on the loan and for her family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase soil inputs and cover costs of labor.

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es: Jorge Antonio tiene 44 años, su actividad es un bar y comedor. Hace más de 4 años que lo tiene, el local se encuentra en un punto en donde es transitado por muchos clientes pues él lo inicio con su compañera de vida con el objetivo de buscar ingresos para su hogar, por lo que tiene 3 hijos a su cargo el se levanta muy temprano para realizar las compras de los granos básicos,  azúcar, aceite, frutas, verduras y bolsas plásticas. El financiamiento es para comprar materia prima. El sueño de Jorge es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Jorge Antonio is 44 years old.  His business is a bar and eatery.  He has had his business for more than 4 years.  It is currently at a point where it is busy with lots of customers.  He started the business with his wife with the aim of creating income for his home, as he has 3 children to support.  He gets up very early to make his purchases of basic grains, sugar, oil, fruits, vegetables and plastic bags.  The loan is for the purchase of raw materials.  Jorge's dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, sugar, oil, fruits, vegetables and plastic bags.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 41 años, casado con Marcelina de 37 años, juntos tiene dos hijos, Eduardo de 18 años y carolina de 17 años. Juntos viven en la comunidad de Puerto Mayo del distrito de Pichari. Durante sus años de adolescencia, José se dedicó a la actividad agrícola, ayudando a sus padres en la siembra y cosecha, desde entonces se dedica a la agricultura y por tal no se arrepiente de ello, ya que le genera las ganancias que le ayudan a sostener a su familia. Cuando es tiempo de cultivo necesita de trabajadores para que agilicen el trabajo, del mismo sucede cuando se tiene que recoleccionar sus frutos, entre ellos el café y el cacao, productos que son vendidos en los Centros de Acopio de Pichari. Su plan a futuro es comprar terrenos para que siga incursionando en esta misma actividad, por ende, darle mayores satisfacciones. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con esta actividad. Con los 1.500 que solicita, lo invertirá para que los peones poden las plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old and he is married to Marcelina who is 37 years old. Together they have two children, Eduardo who is 18 years old and Carolina who is 17 years old. They live together in the Puerto Mayo community in the district of Pichari. 

During his teenage years José worked in agriculture, helping his parents with the planting and harvesting. Since then he has made a living in agriculture and he does not regret it as it generates the income that helps him to support his family.  

During the growing period he needs workers to speed up the work. The same happens during the harvesting of the fruits, among which are coffee and cacao. He sells these products at the wholesale centers of Pichari. 

His plan for the future is to purchase land to continue carrying out this same activity, which will give him more satisfaction. This will be his second loan from MFP and as such he awaits the help of all of you to continue with this endeavor. He will invest the 1,500 nuevos soles that he has requested into the hiring of farm laborers to prune his cacao plants.

loans.use: to hire farm laborers that will help him prune his cacao plants.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

She has operated a clothes selling business for the past year, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. 

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu is to access loans to boost her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Zainab. She is married and has 2 children, aged 9 and 12 years. She has 1 additional dependent who lives with her because Zainab is her caretaker.  

In 2001, Zainab established her cooking utensils business. She grew up as a petty trader, assisting her mother. Since she was not sent to school, Zainab had wanted to start a business on her own. Therefore, she established the Osusu scheme, of which she was the leader. She was able to access funds and start her plastics business. Now, she is adding cooking utensils as a new product for better profits. Zainab got some additional stock from her husband in order to increase her business.  

Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL1,100,000 every month from this business. Zainab would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan. She now requires a new loan in order to buy cooking utensils (set pans -15 cartons @ SLL160,000, ceramic buckets - 5 doz @SLL100,000 and assorted suit pan designs, 2 cartons - SLL60,000,  and large coolman 10 @ SLL200,000). She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL350,000. 

In the future, Zainab plans to expand her business by opening a shop and by buying a commercial vehicle/motor cycle to increase her profits. Her challenges are rainy seasons that causes slow sales and the high cost of goods. She serves a high percentage of Makeni community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for  cooking utensils - set pans - 15 cartons @ Le160,000, ceramic buckets - 5 doz @ Le100,000 and assorted suit pans designs 2 cartons - Le60,000, large coolman 10 at Le200,000.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Julienne est mariée et mère de 5 enfants, tous scolarisés et évoluant bien dans leurs études. La relation réside chez son mari avec sa petite famille. Les charges financières du ménage reviennent au couple. 
Julienne est couturière de formation; parallèlement, elle vend des savons liquide, des cartes de recharges GSM, des boissons de la SOBEBRA, de la glace et du bissap, une boisson rafraichissante de fabrication locale très appréciée des enfants et même des grandes personnes. Pour disposer de revenus consistants, Julienne a ajouté à toutes ces activités la vente de nourriture. Elle a une large clientèle constituée des ménages de sa zone et de ses environs. Elle fait ses achats dans le plus grand marché du Bénin, Tokpa. 
Julienne est à son 2ème crédit qu'elle a sollicité et obtenu à FINADEV pour accroître son fonds de commerce afin de mieux diversifier son activité. Le revenu supplémentaire généré par ce micro crédit lui permettra d'être indépendante financièrement et de couvrir les charges familiales.
texts.en: Julienne is married and the mother of five children who are all in school and doing well in their studies. Our client resides with her husband and her small family. Household expenses are the couple's responsibility. Julienne is a seamstress by training; concurrently she sells liquid soap, rechargeable GSM phone cards, beverages from SOBEBRA, ice, and bissap, a refreshing beverage made locally (from hibiscus flowers) and very popular with children and even adults. To have substantial revenues, Julienne has included with all these businesses the sale of food. She has a large customer base composed of households in and around her area. She makes her purchases at Tokpa, the largest market in Benin. She is now on her second loan which she requested and obtained at the micro-finance institution FINADEV to increase her business capital in order to diversify her businesses further. The extra revenues generated by this micro-loan will enable Julienne to be financially independent and to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 2 dozen of liquid soap, 50 GSM rechargeable phone cards, and 25 cases of beverages

loans.name: Dinorah Judith

texts.es:
la sra. Dinorah tiene 37 años de edad, vive en unión libre y es madre de 5 hijos, Dinorah tiene un puesto de abarroteria, ha obtenido muchos beneficios a través de este negocio, a sacado adelante su negocio sumando su esfuerzo, dedicación y su amplio conocimiento en el comercio.
La Sra. Dinorah solicita un credito con el fin de abastecer su negocio, ya que nenecita más mercadería, porque el sitio donde esta ubicado su negocio es un excelente punto para el comercio debido a que tiene una gran cantidad de clientes.
tiene la ayuda de su compañero de hogar para atender sus clientes.
su anhelo es poder darle buenos estudios a sus 5 hijos.
texts.en:
Dinorah is 37 years old, she lives in a common-law marriage and she has 5 children. Dinorah runs a general store: this activity has been very profitable for her, and she has made her activity grow thanks to her efforts, dedication and her wide knowledge in the trade field.
Dinorah is requesting a loan to stock up her shop: she needs more products because her shop is located in an excellent trade area and she has a lot of customers.
She can count on the help of her life partner to tend to her customers.
She wishes to be able to pay for the good education for her 5 children, the youngest of which is an 8-month-old baby.

loans.use: To buy juices, cases of milk, honey, soaps, sandals and fruits.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 54 years old, widowed, and lives in the village of Turod Norte Cordon. She is thankful because she only has one child, currently studying. She is engaged in buying and selling pigs and direct selling, particularly Personal Collection, Avon and MSE. She has had this kind of business for one year and she is able to earn P4,000 a month. 

Norma is spending her income on her student and the payment of electric bills. That's why she is in need of additional capital amounting to P10,000 which will be used to purchase pigs and cosmetic products for her business improvement. 

With this loan amount, she will be able to increase her sales in  both businesses. She really hopes that she can obtain this loan amount in order to support her student and continue to sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy pigs to be sold in their village and in a market stall.

loans.name: Exavoir

texts.en:
Exavoir is a 33 year-old married man with five children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  He owns and runs a retail shop.  He has been in business for 5 years.  With the profits, he has been able to pay school fees for his children.  His dream is to have a wholesale shop.  

Exavoir needs the loan to buy bread, tea leaves, and match boxes to sell.

loans.use: To buy bread, tea leaves and match boxes tosell.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз женщина – предприниматель со стажем. Откормом он занимается более 6 лет. В этом бизнесе ей помогает брат. В приусадебном участке у нее 2 коровы  и 2 овца. Она хочет увеличить количество скота для развития бизнеса. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Дилафруз запрашивает займ для покупки скота.
texts.en: Dilafruz is a female entrepreneur with experience.  She has been involved in fattening up livestock for over six years.  Her brother helps her in this business.  She keeps two cows and two sheep in a yard by her house.  Dilafruz wants to increase livestock quantity for business development.  She wants to expand her business and maximize her profit.  Dilafruz is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a hardworking business woman aged 52. She is married and blessed with three children all of whom attend school. She has been selling scrap metals for recycling for the past three years. She also does farming to earn extra income. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy more scrap metals for resale.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals.

loans.name: Eva Marie

texts.en:
Eva Marie is 42 years old. She is married and has three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Eva Marie is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eva Marie has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Camino Al Mar Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Camino al Mar”, lo conforman 20 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran artesanía, venta de leña, venta de ropa, procesamiento de vellón (piel o lana de oveja), entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Montt. 
Marina integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila, en el lugar de en medio, sonriendo, quien además usa su cabello corto y un sweater color café. Se dedica al rubro de la artesanía específicamente realizando telares mapuches y tejidos.
Se dedica a éste oficio desde hace un año y medio. Ella ha sido autónoma con sus aprendizajes, pero también ha realizado algunos cursos de artesanía, costuras telares, comenta que siempre es bueno aprender, ya que de esta manera va innovando con productos exclusivos. Sus productos los comercializa en una feria artesanal municipal, donde arrienda un puesto y una carpa, además su hija ofrece sus productos por internet, los cuales también se venden. Comenta que la temporada de más alta demanda es durante el verano, ya que es en esta fecha donde llega una gran cantidad de turistas y cruceros. Su mercadería la compra en una pequeña distribuidora, lugar donde se especializan en el proceso de la lana.
Con el crédito comprará lana hilada y vellón.
Las metas para su negocio son tener un local propio que le brinde una estabilidad económica. 
Marina vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 28 y 16 años de edad, sus sueños a nivel personal son seguir prosperando en su negocio, para poder brindarle a su familia un mejor bienestar en su calidad de vida. 
Las motivaciones de Marina de continuar con la artesanía se deben a que disfruta mucho lo que realiza. 
Marina está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios entregados por Fondo Esperanza, sobre todo por el buen trato y acogida.
Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que ha sido una buena experiencia y que los demás emprendedores han sido comprometidos con el grupo y cada uno de sus negocios. Las capacitaciones por su parte le han servido para llevar bien su negocio.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
This community bank is called "Camino al Mar" and it is made up of 20 entrepreneurs who work in different fields including handicrafts, selling firewood, selling clothing, processing fleece (sheep skin or wool), etc.  All of the bank's members live in the city of Puerto Montt.

Marina is a member of this community bank.  She is in the second row of the photo, in the middle.  She is smiling, has short hair, and is wearing a coffee-colored sweater.  She is in the craft business.  In particular, she makes Mapuche [Indian] woven items and knitted items.

Marina has been in this business for one and a half years.  She is mainly self taught but has also taken some craft courses in weaving and sewing.  She says that it is always good to learn as this means that she is able to continue innovating with exclusive products.  She sells her products in a municipal craft fair where she rents a stall and canopy.  In addition, her daughter sells her products on the Internet.  She says that her peak season is during the summer as this is when there are a lot of tourists and cruises.  She buys her merchandise from a small wholesaler's where they specialize in processing yarn.  Marina will use her loan to buy spun yarn and fleece.

Marina's goals for her business are to have her own premises which will give her financial stability.  Marina lives together with her husband and her two children who are 28 and 16 years old.  Her dreams on a personal level are to continue doing well in her business so that she can provide her family with better well-being and a better quality of life.

Marina's motivation to continue making her handicrafts is that she really enjoys what she does.  She is very happy and thankful for the services provided by Fondo Esperanza and, above all, for the good service and welcome.

As far as her community bank is concerned, she tells us that it has been a good experience for her and that the other entrepreneurs have been committed to both the group and each of their businesses.  The training sessions have helped her to run her business well.

Puerto Montt is a city in the south of Chile, in Los Lagos region.  Some of the city's attractions are its beautiful green landscapes, its quiet beaches, its cuisine, the reputation of its fish and seafood, and its handicrafts.  It is also an entry point to Isla Grande de Chiloé which is rich in tradition and legends.

loans.use: to buy spun yarn and fleece

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy (pictured above) and her husband, Ry, have been married since 1996 and have one son and two daughters, who are in school. The family is living on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chanthy is a silk weaver, while her husband is a policeman. She is applying for another loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her brother, who has full-time employment in Phnom Penh, to get to work.  
 
Because Chanthy’s brother commutes to work on his old motorbike and the motorbike breaks often, he spends a lot of money to repair it and it’s difficult for him to manage income. To help her brother, Chanthy decided to pay off her previous loan and is asking for another loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her brother to get to work.

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Yat, 46, is married and has three children, who are still in school. She runs a grocery store in front of her house. She sells biscuits, detergent, seasoning, etc. She also sells medicine in her grocery store. Her husband sometimes works for others to raise additional income. Now she earns less than 8 US dollars per day to feed her family.

Yat leads a group of two female members. This is the first loan for her group. She is now requesting for a loan with VisionFund. She wants to buy grocery stock and some medicines for her store. 

This loan will enable her to increase her stock of groceries and she hopes to earn more income to better feed her family and also keep her three children in school.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store.

loans.name: Miluska

texts.es: Miluska sigue participando en el banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Miluska sigue dedicándose a la venta de vehículos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Miluska requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de la casa.
texts.en:
Miluska continues to participate in the “Chaska” communal bank, pertaining to the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco.

Miluska is still selling vehicles. She has done this for various years and it is going very well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work. On this occasion, Miluska needs a loan to carry out maintenance on her home.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her house.

loans.name: Gani

texts.ru: Гани  трудолюбивый, добросовестный человек. Он прекрасный семьянин отец одного сына. Его жена занимается пошивом национальных одеял. Они вместе трудятся на благосостояние семьи. Он сам занимается выращиванием и откормом скота. Начинал он с откорма одного теленка и постоянно расширил свой бизнес. Его труды приносят свои плоды. На сегодняшний день он имеет два голов крупного рогатого скота и 6 голов мелко рогатого скота. Он хочет получить займ для улучшения своих жилищных условий- ремонта дома. Ему надо завершить штукатурку, покрыть пол и потолки дома. Он надеется, что его поддержат в улучшении жилищных условий и предоставят запрашиваемый займ, он хочет получить займ  в размере 5000 сомони и завершить свои работы. Он уверен в вашей поддержке и благодарен вам. Спасибо большое!
texts.en:
Gani is a hardworking, honest man. He is a wonderful family man and father of one son. His wife works with sewing national blankets. They are working together on the welfare of their family. He works with breeding and fattening up cattle. He started with fattening up a calf and constantly grew his business. His labors are bearing fruit. Today he owns two head of cattle and six head of small cattle. 

Gani wants to get a loan to improve his living conditions - to repair his house. He needs to finish the plaster and cover the floor and ceiling of the house. He hopes that he will be supported in the improvement of his living conditions and that the requested loan will be granted, he wants to get a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni and complete his work. He is confident in your support and is grateful to you. Thank you very much!

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her eldest son’s motorbike repair shop. With the loan investment, he will purchase spare parts and tools to provide better-quality repair services to his customers. He has good technical skills, and his clients trust his quality services.

Shahnaz is hopeful that a loan investment will help her son to earn more profits by improving his business. She is a housewife, who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She has given birth to 3 sons and 3 daughters. Her second son is illiterate while the other four children are getting their education. Her husband is a driver and provides transport services to his passengers.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for a motorcycle repair business.

loans.name: Rolando Marcelo

texts.es: El señor Rolando se dedica al comercio de temporada emprendió su propio negocio hace 2 años en la temporada navideña sale a vender foquitos navideños, imágenes de porcelana, nacimientos entre otros, por este motivo solicito el crédito para la compra de focos, nacimientos, etc.  en la feria navideña pasadas las fechas ya tiene planificado dedicarse a vender otros productos según la temporada en las festividades que se aproximan, vive en alquiler junto a su conyugue y su pequeño hijo en la zona villa Busch  ubicado al norte de la ciudad de Cochabamba, indica que  con su actividad logra sustentar a su familia ya que este el único ingreso que tiene;  el señor esta muy agradecido por la confianza en la otorgación del crédito, ya que este es un apoyo muy grande para el para mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rolando sells holiday merchandise for a living.  He started his own business two years ago and around Christmas he sells Christmas lights, porcelain images, and Nativity scenes, among other things.  He is asking for this loan to buy lights, Nativity scenes, etc. at the Christmas fair.  When this season is over, he has plans to sell other products according to the holiday that is nearest.  He lives in a rental unit with his partner and his young son in the Busch neighborhood, which is in the northern part of the city of Cochabamba.  He tells us that his business supports his family as it is the only source of income they have.  He is very thankful for the trust shown in offering him this loan as it helps him improve his income greatly and, along with it, his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy Christmas merchandise

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon, 67, is married and resides with her husband and two daughters in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over twenty years, have extensive experience, and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and other agricultural crops. Her daughters are employed in a garment factory. 

In order to improve her family livelihood, Yon is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a store in the market where her daughters can sell groceries to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her children's business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase a store in the market where her daughters can sell groceries.

loans.name: Alirio De Jesus

texts.es:
Alirio es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Alirio siempre se ha rebuscado los ingresos para su hogar, por lo que ha desempeñado actividades como venta de mercancía, venta de morcilla, tamales, arreglo de electrodomésticos, entre otros. Gracias a esto, Alirio es reconocido en su municipio por muchas personas y esto le ha permitido sacar a su familia adelante. Debido a grandes adversidades que le ha presentado la vida, Alirio tuvo que abandonar su actividad anterior que era arreglar electrodomésticos, y ahora busca abrir una tienda general con la que pueda seguir garantizando el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Es por esto que Alirio ya cuenta con el local para poner su tienda y busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para ofrecer en la tienda que va a abrir. 
Alirio espera que de esta manera pueda seguir generando los ingresos para su hogar y su familia siga teniendo el sustento necesario. Alirio tiene la ventaja de que en el sector no existen tiendas cercanas, por lo que su tienda tendrá una muy buena acogida por parte de los clientes, además de que gracias a las actividades anteriores que desempeñó Alirio, lo conocen muchas personas de su municipio. Alirio sueña con tener una gran tienda la cual le garantice unos buenos ingresos con los cuales pueda ofrecer a su familia una buena calidad de vida.

loans.use: Compra de productos de la canasta familiar para ofrecer en la tienda que va a abrir.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida  is 51 years old married woman. She is shown in the photo with her son who is running a small shop successfully for many years where he sell various items such as calling cards, mobile accessories, chargers, etc. For the improvement of her son's business, Shahida  has applied for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase more items such as calling cards, memory cards, and mobile batteries. With the help of this loan, he can meet the increasing demands of his clients and generate more revenue. She is positive that his son's future earnings will increase.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as calling cards, memory cards, and mobile batteries

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
N. Irene is an active member of Life in Africa. She currently works in the Invisible Children Bracelet project making bracelets and also dyeing the materials they use. She is a young wife and as yet does not have children. However, she hopes to and she wants to work now to secure a solid source of income so that her children will not have to know poverty.

Her parents have given her a four room house but it is not finished. She plans to rent out the rooms which will be a secure source of income but she knows that she will be able to earn more and keep her tenants longer if the house is complete. This will also provide better housing for the families who rent from her.

To complete this house she is seeking a loan in the amount of 700,000. She will be able to repay this loan in 12 months.

Her loan description is as below:

1 trips of sand @ shs. 80,000...........80,000/= Bricks 2000 @ shs.65...................130,000/= Wooden doors 2 @ shs.30,000............100,000/= Wooden windows 4 @ shs.40,000..........160,000/= Cement 5 bags @ shs.18,000............. 90,000/= Labour.................................100,000/= Transport.............................. 40,000/=

Total..................................700,000/=

WE Team to benefit: Education

loans.use: Buying materials for finishing up building

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy motorcycle for taxi

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is 33 years old and is a hard working and tenacious woman. She is married and the mother of 2 girls (12 and 14) and hopes that her daughters will complete university. Her husband works in a meat packing company, however his salary does not cover all the family expenses. For this reason, Guadalupe was motivated to start her own business and started selling tacos in 1997. She started with very little capital in a rented space, but now, thanks to her reinvestment of income, she is able to rent a better space.

Now, Guadalupe needs a loan of $475 which she will use to buy shells, kitchen utensils and food items to make tacos. Guadalupe is confident that she will succeed in her business and is grateful for all the assistance received.

loans.use: Kitchen goods/Food production and sales

texts.en: Mrs. L. is 39 years old, and her husband is 40. They have 6 children, between 4 and 19 yrs., and four children are at school at the moment. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper middle of Vietnam. Her husband buys pigs and she sells the meat of these pigs. She bought a milling machine with a previous TYM loan and now she needs a loan to buy yellow rice so she can thrash it with her milling machine and sell the white rice. Her profit is $6.25 per day. The profit is used to upgrade their housing conditions and for the school expenses of their children.

loans.use: To buy "yellow rice" for her milling machine

loans.name: Ogtay

texts.en:
Ogtay is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is married with three children and lives with his parents in the village of Saatli in the south-central area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus.

Ogtay has four pedigree cows and he goes to Saatli daily and sells some milk there with his mother (she is in the picture), but the income from four cows is too low to support Ogtay's family. That’s why he decided to apply to Norwegian Microcredit's Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy one more pure-bred cow to make his monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region the price of good cow is about US$ 800-1000, but Ogtay has some savings to add to the loan to make up the purchase price of the cow.

loans.use: To buy one more pedigree cow

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos and his wife live in their own home in the 18th street of the Llojeta region in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. He sells charcoal and travels twice a week to Yungas and its outskirts where he does business with charcoal factories. He picks up large sacks of charcoal and returns to La Paz to distribute these to vendors. He also packages smaller sacks with aluminum and labels them "Barbeque Charcoal" and sells them in supermarkets throughout La Paz.

The loan he seeks will be used to buy large quantities of charcoal, since there is a very high demand for it in La Paz. Juan Carlos wants to take advantage of this opportunity to establish himself in this market. Although this is his first time with IMPRO, the nature of his business and analysis of his cash flow qualify him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Carlos vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la calle 18 de la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la venta de carbón, viaja dos veces por semana a los Yungas y sus alrededores donde tiene contratos con productores de carbon, el cual recoge en sacos grandes y al llegar a La Paz los distribuye a los comerciantes, pero también embolsa el carbon en sacos pequeños de papel aluminio viñeteados con la frase “carbón para parrillada” y los vende a los supermercados de la ciudad de La Paz. Para aclaración, la palabra parrillada es sinónimo de barbecue en inglés.

El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de carbón, en vista de que la demanda por este producto aun está insatisfecha en la ciudad de La Paz y Juan Carlos desea aprovechar esta oportunidad para consolidar su posición en este mercado. No tiene antecedente con IMPRO pero por la característica de su negocio y el análisis de flujo de caja puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Incraese inventory

loans.name: Azucena Gioconda

texts.es:
Before starting her business, Sra. M. worked as a hair stylist, working part of the time in a beauty salon and part of the time at home.

When she studied the options for setting up her own business, she decided with her husband to invest in the purchase of products for cutting hair. Today, the business continues to grow thanks to loans received from Ceprodel (19 loans) with which she has been able to buy new products for her business and above all to increase advertising to capture the attention of new customers.

Her hope is to continue with the credit plan offered by Ceprodel to improve her business even more and to pick up more customers for the services that her business offers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. M. antes de iniciar con su negocio se dedicaba a trabajar en un salón de belleza y a la vez realizaba trabajos a domicilio como estilista en horas de la tarde y los días domingo.

Al analizar la alternativa de poner un negocio propio, decide junto con su esposo invertir en la compra de los enseres para cortar cabello. Hoy en día, el negocio ha ido incrementando gracias a préstamos realizados en Ceprodel (19 créditos) con los cuales ha podido comprar nuevos enseres para su negocio y sobre todo aumentar la publicidad para captar la atención de nuevos clientes cada día.

De esta forma, son sus deseos seguir con el plan de créditos que le ofrece Ceprodel para mejorar aun más su negocio y poder ganar muchos clientes en los servicios que ofrece en el negocio.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Asiyah

texts.en: Asiyah, a 44-year-old widow, is the mother of 2 children aged 20 and 13. Every day she sells detergents door-to-door around the villages to provide for her family needs by herself since her husband passed away. She earns $2 a day. She is asking for a loan of $75 to buy more goods to sell. As a member of MBK, she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
"I have been building a small room on my land for a few months, but I had to stop building it due to the lack of money. I'm going to go on with the construction again even if it's little by little, because I really need to finish the room so my son can live in it". I'm asking for $700.00 in order to finish building the room.

Tranlated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo en construcción un cuarto pequeño dentro de mi terreno pero hace algunos meses pare la construcción debido a la falta de dinero, pero ya voy a empezar otra ves aunque sea poco a poco ya que necesito terminar ese cuarto para que mi hijo pueda habitarlo” Solicito $ 700.00 dlls para terminar la construcción de un cuarto.

loans.use: Finish building a room

loans.name: Rafiga

texts.en: Rafiga A. is a 59-year-old woman who raises milk cows and sells milk and yoghurt to the local people. She is married and has six children. Selling dairy products is the only financial source for her family, and it is not enough to cover the family's basic needs. To improve the situation, she need to improve and develop her business. For this purpose, she has applied for $1200 USD to purchase four calves for $300 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 24 years old, married and has two children, ages 8 and 7. Asia owns a small shop, which she started in 2006. She works at her shop from 8am to 9pm daily and can earn a monthly profit of about $225.

She would use this loan to buy items such as sugar, salt, oil and matches to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy more items for a small shop

loans.name: Grisel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Grisel del Carmen has been selling apparel for a living for 10 years. She started this business upon taking custody of her 2 children because she needed to help them get ahead. Her family supported her and introduced her to the world of business. Even though she currently lives with her common-law husband and her financial situation has changed, she continues with her business because it has helped her cover her children’s education; one of them will soon be attending the university. She would like to purchase more merchandise in order to increase her sales and pay for her son’s degree.

She needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which will be repaid in 3 months, so that she can purchase merchandise and boost her sales. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Grisel del Carmen, hace 10 años que se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa, lo inicio al quedar sola con sus dos hijos, ya que tenia que sacarlos adelante, sus familiares la apoyaron y le enseñaron el negocio de venta en mercados, ahora aunque vive en unión libre y la situación económica ha cambiado, continua con el negocio por que le ha ayudado con los costos de la educación de sus hijos, ahora uno de ellos va a entrar a la universidad, y ella desea comprar mas mercancía para mejorar sus ingresos, y poder solventar la carrera de su hijo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y continuar sus ventas. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Cristo Vive Group

texts.en:
Benita Pierre B. is a member of five person micro-bank, “Cristo Vive” which means “Christ Lives”. Only twenty years old, this young women has raised her three-year-old boy with the profits from her small business selling chocolates and other “peanut sweets” in the street. While this meager business has carried her thus far, she came to Esperanza International in search of something more. This will be each member of the group’s first loan. Benita intends to use the capital to begin selling shoes, shirts, dresses, and pants in the street, while continuing to make sweets on the side. It is her dream to earn enough money someday to own her own house to improve the living conditions for her entire family.

Other members of Cristo Vivo have similar occupations selling clothing, jewelry, blankets, and bread in the streets of Agrua, Dominican Republic. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.

On behalf of Benita, the Cristo Vive group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To milk, sugar, cocoa, and peanuts to continue making sweets, as well as clothing to sell on the side.

loans.name: Hilma

texts.es:
Hilma, because of her great love for her daughter, works in various places which forces her to frequently leave her fields and livestock to the care of her parents who help her with this task. Hilma’s father is shown in the picture presented. He tells us that he and his wife do not think twice about helping their daughter while she is away at work because they see the daily effort that she makes in taking care of them and their small granddaughter. Hilma’s wish is to increase her livestock so that she can obtain greater profits so that she will no longer have to leave her home and her daughter to take on the jobs that are necessary to support her family. Hilma comes before you with the hope that you will be able to loan her the money that she needs to purchase livestock and farming supplies so that she will be able to remain with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Hilma, por su gran amor a su hija, trabaja en diversos lugares, obligada en algunos casos a dejar sus terrenos de cultivo y a sus animales al cuidado de sus padres, quienes le ayudan en esta tarea. En la foto que presentamos, se encuentra el padre de Hilma, que nos cuenta que él y su esposa no dudan en apoyar a su hija mientras ella se encuentra fuera trabajando, porque ven a diario, el esfuerzo que hace para cuidar de ellos y de su pequeña nieta.El deseo de Hilma, es aumentar la cantidad de ganado, para que este le provea de mayores ganancias y ya no tenga que dejar su hogar y su hija por otros oficios que complementen el dinero necesario para su casa.Hilma se presenta aquí con la esperanza de que le puedan prestar el dinero que necesita para la compra de estos animales e insumos para sus terrenos de cultivo, y así pueda permanecer junto a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of animals for livestock and farming supplies.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Àçèìóðîäîâ Ðóñòàì ðîäèëñÿ 24 ñåíòÿáðÿ 1963 ãîäà, æåíàò. Îí òîðãîâåö îáóâè óæå ìíîãî ëåò è â åãî àññîðòèìåíòå ìîæíî íàéòè âñå ðàçíîâèäíîñòè îáóâè, íà÷èíàÿ îò ñàìûõ ñîâðåìåííûõ äëÿ äåëîâûõ âñòðå÷ è çàêàí÷èâàÿ äëÿ ñàìûõ ìàëåíüêèõ äæåíòëüìåíîâ.  À òîðãóåò îí íà ðûíêå «Õàéð» ãîðîäà Âàõäàò è ïîìîãàåò åìó â ýòîì æåíà. Àçèìóðîäîâ çàêóïàåò òîâàð â îïòîâîì ðûíêå «Êîðâîí».  Ó Ðóñòàìà â ðûíêå åñòü ëàâêà è ó íåãî åñòü ìå÷òà, êàê ó ëþáîãî íà÷èíàþùåãî ïðåäïðèíèìàòåëÿ, îí õî÷åò êóïèòü ñåáå ìàãàçèí. Â ñâÿçè ñ ýòèì è ñ öåëüþ ðàñøèðåíèÿ íàèìåíîâàíèå òîâàðîâ åìó áû õîòåëîñü ïîëó÷èòü çàéì â ñóììå 4000 ñîìîíè ñðîêîì 5 ìåñÿöåâ.
texts.en:
Rustam A. was born on the 24th of September, 1963. He is married. He has been in the business of selling shoes for many years now. He has a large variety of shoes for sale ranging from most modern shoes for business meeting to children's shoes. He works on the Hair market located in the city of Vahdat. His wife helps him with the business. Rustam purchases goods wholesale on the Kovon market. Currently he sells his goods at a sales point on the market, but he dream of purchasing an actual store. In order to be able to achieve his dream he plans to increase the amount of shoes he has in stock. For this purpose he would like to obtain a 12 months loan of $1175

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of shoes in stock

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: Mr. Koeun L., 36, a fisherman earning approximately US$2.00 per day, lives in Peam Ek Commune, Battambang Province. His wife, Mrs. Chem Cho, 33, is a housewife and stays home to care for the children and cook food for the family. Koeun has three young children; all of them are students and live in the family's home. With his growing business, he needs more fishing equipment. Hence, Koeun seeks a loan of US$200 to purchase nets. The loan will improve his business and increase the profit for his family.

loans.use: To purchase nets to catch fish

loans.name: Husniddin

texts.en: Husniddin works as a driver but the salary he gets isn’t enough to feed the family. So he has also rented a land for growing onions, melons, and wheat.  He also has a dream to buy a car with the money from his yield. With the money he wants to borrow, he plans to buy fertilizers and so have a nice crop.

loans.use: Purchasing chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 36 años, es madre soltera, de un pequeño niño llamado Jean Carlos, de 6 años de edad. Ella se dedica íntegramente a su trabajo en la tienda que abrió hace un año, en base a mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para poder educar y criar a su hijo. El trabajo de María empieza aproximadamente a las 6 de la mañana y se prolonga hasta altas horas de la noche, ya que su tienda es muy solicitada por la clientela que asiste diariamente, haciendo que su negocio sea muy rentable, pero el tener que atender durante todo el día se le hace muy agotador, ya que al mismo tiempo debe atender a su pequeño hijo.Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos para equipar su tienda.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old. She is a single mother with a young son named Jean Carlos, who is 6 years old. She devotes herself completely to working in the store that she opened a year ago. With much effort and dedication, she can afford to educate and raise her son. María's workday begins at around 6 in the morning and lasts until late at night. Now that her store is frequented by customers everyday, it is becoming a very profitable business. However, having to work in the store all day is very tiring, especially since she must care for her son at the same time. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she is requesting, she will buy a greater quantity of products to equip her store.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to supply her store

loans.name: Vorng's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Vorng Y. is the leader of a six-member group, who all live in the Au village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

Mr. Vorng Y. owns a rice mill in the village, and he owns 1 hectare of land on which he cultivates rice to earn a living. This plantation produces so little revenue from the rice that he cannot support the household. Thus, Mr. Vorng Y. is requesting a loan to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice.

His wife, Mrs. Khon Sok, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the household. Mr. Vorng Y. is 25 years old and is the father of a one-year-old child.

loans.use: Buy a piece of land to cultivate rice to increase income

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A., 47, is married and has three children. The children are still in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, cooking spices, table salt, skimmed powdered milk, and biscuits, etc. at the community market in her neighborhood. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. to increase her inventory.

Cecilia hopes to improve her savings to support her children who are in school. Cecilia A. belongs to a community group called Ebenezer Trust group. Cecilia says your support would boost her business, increasing the number of customers she serves a day.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose S. is thirty–three years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are males. The first two children are already in school. The last born is yet to start school. Rose’s husband is a commercial driver. He conveys goods and people, mostly market women from Offinso to Kumasi and other market centers. Rose lives with her husband and children in a rented house in Offinso. Offinso is a farming and commercial community in the Ashanti region of Ghana.
She trades to support her husband and take care of the family. She trades in vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, etc on a table top in the local market. She buys boxes of tomatoes, pepper, and other vegetables from farmers in the surrounding villages at affordable prices. She sells mostly to the food vendors in her community. Rose has been in business for ten years. She wants a loan to buy vegetables in large quantities so she can increase her profit margin. She is working hard to support her husband to sponsor their children to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To procure vegetables

loans.name: Marylin

texts.es: Marylin a sus 19 años, sabe que es hora de apoyar con los gastos económicos en su hogar, vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes le ayudaron a poner su negocio. Ella es una joven muy enterada de la moda actual, es por eso que decidió poner una tienda donde vende carteras, las cuales son muy bonitas y bien elegantes, su negocio siempre para repleto, sobre todo por las jóvenes y señoras que buscan algo novedoso. A ella le gusta su trabajo, principalmente le agrada aconsejar a sus clientes sobre cuál es la cartera que mejor le quedará. Para el futuro desea tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender toda clase de prendas de vestir, ya que desea incursionar más en el mundo de la ropa, lleva 2 años realizando este trabajo y lo más difícil de su negocio es conseguir las carteras, ya que busca modelos novedosos y poco comunes. Siendo este el primer préstamo de Marylin con MFP, está dispuesta a pagarlo por completo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos, ella es muy responsable en su banco comunal  y siempre recibe el apoyo de las socias de mayor edad. Marylin invertirá todo el dinero solicitado en comprar más carteras, con las cuales implementará mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Marylin at 19, knows that it's time to support with with the economic expenses in her home. She lives in her parents' home, who helped her to start her business. She is a young woman in touch with the actual fashions, which is why she decided to start a store where she sells purses, which are very beautiful and elegant. Her business is always full, mostly with young ladies and women looking for something new. She likes her work, primarily she likes to advise her customers on which purse fits them best. In the future she hopes to have a larger store where she can sell all types of clothing, now that she wants to get further into the world of clothes. She has two years doing this work and the most difficult part of her job is getting the purses, since she looks for new and uncommon models. This being Marlin's first loan with MFP, she is disposed to pay it completely, since she wants to be able to get other loans. She is very responsible with her community bank and always receives the support of the older members. Marylin will invest all of the money requested in buying more purses, with which she can make her store better.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Désiré

texts.fr:
A. Désiré est née vers 1978 à Porto-Novo, Capitale administrative du Bénin, dans le 5e  Arrondissement. A. Désiré est célibataire sans enfant. A. Désiré est gérant d’une cabine téléphonique et vend aussi de glaces sucettes. Pour diversifier ses activités et accroître ses  sources de revenu A. Désiré sollicite un crédit.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Désiré A. was born circa 1978 in the 5th arrondissement of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin. He's unmarried and doesn't have children. He runs a phone booth and also sells ice pops. To diversify his business and sources of income, he's seeking a loan. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell phone cards

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: El señor Eduardo labora para una plaza comercial en el área de frutería desde hace 2 años, su esposa la señora Imelda es empleada domestica de una residencia con una antigüedad de 3 años, cuentan con el apoyo económico del señor Ramón que es papa de la señora Imelda tiene tres hijos a los cuales les enseñan a ser personas responsables y trabajadoras, juntos están tramitando este crédito para la elaboración y colocación de un portón en el frente de su casa.
texts.en:
Eduardo has been working in a shopping centre in the fruit section for 2 years. His wife Imelda has been a domestic employee in a private house for 3 years. They rely on Ramon, Imelda’s father, for financial support. Imelda has three children whom she is bringing up to be responsible and hardworking people. Together they are asking for this loan in order to manufacture and install a front door to their house.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Manufacture and installation of a front door for their house

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane O. is the leader of the Beat art and craft group in Jinja. She is a businesswoman whose business is selling local brews, including malwa, tonto, and waragi, to her customers. She now also makes a local brew herself, though on a small scale, and this has helped her to earn much more compared to when she had to buy solely from other brewers.

Jane has a dream of opening up a small retail shop from her home to add on her local brewing and farming business. Since she must sometimes attend to her farming, she employs two people to help her with the local brew business.

She needs a new loan to help with stocking yeast and bananas for making her brew.

loans.use: Buying bananas and yeast for making her local brew.

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó a través de la Sra. Sara F., a quien le gusto el programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de Fundacion Paraguaya.  Ella decidio invitar a sus vecinas y amigas del Barrio La Floresta para trabajar juntas y poder progresar.  Ellas estan acostumbradas a organizarse por lo cual su grupo prospera. Ellas son independientes en sus labores como vendedoras de ropas, venta de comidas, venta de frutas, venta de joyas, modista, etc. y reciben de crédito en un promedio de Gs.588.000 cada una.  

Las integrantes son: 

1	Sara F. -  	Modista
2	Eliodora S. - 	Venta de Ropa
3	Victorina B. - 	Venta de Frutas
4	Perla V. - 	Venta de Frutas
5	Librada P. - 	Venta de Comida
6	Gladys V. - 	Despensa
7	Lourdes Y.	-  Venta de Mandioca
8	Maria V.	-  Venta de Menudencias
9	Julia B.	-  Venta de Mandioca
10	Maria L.	-  Venta de Frutas
11	Atanacia O.	-  Venta de Comida
12	Eladia V.	-  Venta de Mandioca
13	Carmen A.	-  Venta de Mandioca
14	Maria B.	-  Venta de Carne
15	Zunilda L.	-  Venta de Gallina
16	Mirta D.	-  Venta de Comida
17	Ana T.	-  Fotocopias
texts.en:
This group formed because Mrs. Sara F. liked the Mujeres Emprendedoras of the Fundacion Paraguaya program. She decided to invite her neighbors and friends from the La Floresta neighborhood to work and progress together. Because they are organized, their group prospers. They work independently in their work as a seamstress, sellers of clothes, food, fruit, jewelry, etc. The loan is for an average of $120 each. The members are: 1Sara F. - Seamstress 2 Eliodora S. – Clothing Sales 3 Victorina B. – Fruit Sales 4 Perla V. – Fruit Sales 5 Librada P. – Food Sales 6 Gladys V. – Mini Market 7 Lourdes Y. – Sells Cassava Melons 8 Maria V. – Sells Edible Organ Meats 9 Julia B. - Sells Cassava Melons 10 Maria L. – Sells Fruit 11 Atanacia O. – Sells Food 12 Eladia V. - Sells Cassava Melons 13 Carmen A. - Sells Cassava Melons 14 Maria B. – Sells Meat 15 Zunilda L. – Sells Chickens 16 Mirta D. - Sells Food 17 Ana T. - Photocopies

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, meat, flour, eggs,  jeans, t-shirts, skirts, shirts, fabric, soft drinks, vegetables, organ meats, cassava melons

loans.name: Marohathon

texts.ru: Марохатхон несколько последних лет занимается предпринимательством. Ее муж тоже работает и по выходным дням помогает своей жене по бизнесу. Постоянного места для торговли у нее нету и ей приходится сидеть на центральном рынке там, где есть свободное место. Она продает различные мелкие товары: носки, носовые платки, нитки для шитья и тп. Марохатхон является клиентом МикроИнвест  уже несколько лет. За время сотрудничества она значительно улучшила свой бизнес и свои социальные условия. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ и улучшить ассортимент своих товаров.
texts.en:
Marohathon has been doing business for the last several years. Her husband also works and helps his wife in the business on the weekends. She does not have a permanent vendor location and she has to take a place which is available on the central market. She sells different kinds of small items: socks, handkerchiefs, threads for sewing and etc. Marohathon has been a client of MicroInvest for several years. During this time she has considerably improved her business and her living conditions. Right now she plans to get a new loan and increase the variety of her offered products.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Maria Jundi

texts.en: Maria Jundi S. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 35 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Maria Jundi owns and operates a business providing public utility vehicle services to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Maria Jundi joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Maria Jundi is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used for renewal of the registration and franchise of the transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To renew the registration and franchise of her vehicle

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama K. est une dame de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt afin de mieux renforcer son capital de commerce de riz, savon, lait etc et ainsi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama K. is a lady of 43, married, and the mother of 6 children. She is requesting this loan so that she can bolster the working capital for her business selling rice, soap, milk, etc., and thus improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling rice, soap, milk, etc.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza es una joven emprendedora que tiene 26 años, tiene una pequeña hija de 2 años y vive con su madre y su hermana en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace 3 años decidió independizarse económicamente generando su propia fuente de trabajo con el bordado de fustanes. Cada día realiza estas prendas con la ayuda de su madre para lograr cumplir los compromisos pactados con sus clientes, quienes quedan satisfechos por el trabajo que ha realizado. Para Maritza es muy ventajoso realizar esta actividad porque le permite estudiar y trabajar a la vez, además su trabajo es económicamente bien retribuido. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta de formar parte de este nuevo grupo en su banco comunal, donde promete ser una socia puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de hilos y telas al por mayor para  seguir produciendo sus bordados.
texts.en:
Maritza is a young entrepreneur aged 26. She has a two-year old daughter and lives with her mother and sister in her parents’ house. Three years ago she decided to become financially independent and created her own work embroidering fustanes (traditional skirts). She works on the skirts every day with the help of her mother so that she can complete the orders requested by her customers, who are very happy with the work that she does. The job is a good one for Maritza as it allows her the chance to work and study at the same time; the work is also financially rewarding. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is very happy to be part of this new group in the community bank. She promises to be punctual with her repayments. The money will used to buy thread and material at wholesale prices so that she can continue doing the embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: César tiene 40 años, es un hombre muy responsable y dinámico, vive con la madre de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Su actividad principal es la agricultura, cultiva frutas cítricas (mandarinas y naranjas), las cuales le generan ingresos cada 15 días, pero le resultan más rentables en los meses de diciembre a marzo, ya que estos meses el costo de sus productos se elevan y son muy solicitados, por eso los envía directamente al mercado mayorista de Lima. El resto de los meses, cada quincena, adicionalmente vende licores como anisados, pisco y coñac, ya que le deja buenos dividendos a favor de su economía. Dedicarse a estas dos actividades le agrada mucho, ya que le gusta lo que hace y le permite captar ganancias, las cuales invierte en la educación de sus hijos que se encuentran cursando la escuela y el colegio. César espera que sus hijos se forjen una carrera profesional y él se sentiría un hombre dichoso. En este, su quinto préstamo con MFP, reitera su puntualidad en sus pagos, como hasta ahora. Y en su cargo de presidente de su banco comunal ha cumplido con responsabilidad, ganándose el respeto y estima de sus compañeros de grupo, quienes lo respetan por su buen carácter. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos y nuevas plantas de cítricos, con las que piensa incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
César, age 40, is a very responsible and dynamic man. He lives with the mother of his 3 children in his own house. His main business is agricultural, raising citrus fruits (mandarin oranges and oranges) which generate income for him every 15 days, but which turn out more profitable in the months of December to March. In those months, the cost of his products rise and they are very sought-after. That’s why he was sending them directly to Lima’s wholesale market. The remaining months, every two weeks, he also sells liqueurs such as aniseed liqueur, pisco, and cognac since these provide him with good profits.

Being in these two businesses brings him a lot of pleasure since he likes what he does and it allows him to gain profits, which he invests in the education of his children who are taking courses at school and college. César hopes that his children forge professional careers, and he would feel like a lucky man.

In this, his fifth loan with MFP, he reiterates his punctuality in his payments until now. He has fulfilled his position as president of his community bank with responsibility, winning for himself the respect and appreciation of his colleagues in the group, who respect him because of his good character. The money that he is now applying for is for the purchase of fertilizer and new citrus plants with which he hopes to increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and new plants

loans.name: Sayraw Group

texts.en: Sayraw is the group leader of Sayraw group. They are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for progress their business and make it larger. So they are requested a group of loan 42000 Afghani. Sayraw wants to take a loan for the business of embroidery. Saeda wants to take a loan for her husband who has P.C.O. D. M. wants to take a loan for the business of general store. So they are very happy from this process of loan in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: David

texts.en: Mr. S. David is a promising man of thirty-four years who owns a textile shop located in Lyantonde trading centre where he has been working for four years. He is using the loan to purchase more clothing material and ready-made clothing to sell. He is a married man blessed with one child. He is a hardworking businessman whose dream is to prosper and be successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing material and ready-made clothes

loans.name: Walo Group

texts.en:
In the New Foyah community, Market area, Foyah District, Lofa County, Finda lives with her four children whose ages range between 11 and 24 years, with education levels up to college.

Finda has sold dry goods and clothes for about three years now from whence she caters to her children and supports them in school. Her challenge has been the lack of finance but she is successful in attracting her customers by words of encouragement and by offering affordable prices. She dreams of owning a bigger business to adequately support her kids.

loans.use: To buy additional dry goods, adult and children's clothes, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza Maruja

texts.es:
La señora ESPERANZA MARUJA VILLACORTA Z., tiene 42 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES AL PROGRESO.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 2do de Secundaria porque quedo embarazada a los 16 años y se casó con su actual esposo, por eso dejo de estudiar para dedicarse al cuidado de su hogar y la crianza de su hijo.
Posteriormente ya con su hijo grande empezó a estudiar la carrera técnica de cosmetología la cual ejerce actualmente.
La socia es casada  y tiene 1 hijo de 23 años de edad quien depende económicamente de ella por que se encuentra estudiando en la universidad.
ESPERANZA se dedica a la cosmetología y actualmente  se encuentra implementando su salón de belleza que espera estar aperturando dentro de 2 semanas.
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de cremas, tintes, oxigentas, tijeras, etc.
Este crédito de 700 nuevos soles lo utilizará en la compra de un sillón de cortar cabello y utensilios para implementar su salón de belleza como: tijeras, secadora, vidulis, líquidos, cremas, etc.
La empresaria sueña con tener aperturar prontamente su salón de belleza y con tener éxito para así poder obtener dinero y seguir apoyándolo a su hijo para que finalice sus estudios.
texts.en:
Esperanza Maruja Villacorta Z. is 42 years old, and lives in the district of Trujillo, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progress” [“Women in Progress”]. This businesswoman has completed her studies up to the 2nd year of secondary school; she became pregnant at age 16 and married her current husband, and because of this she left school and dedicated herself to the caring for her home and raising her child. Now, with her son having grown up, she has begun studying cosmetology at a technical school. The bank member is married and has one 23-year-old son that depends on her financially because he is currently in university studying. Esperanza works in cosmetology and is currently setting up a beauty salon that she hopes will be ready to open in 2 weeks. She invested her first loan of 300 PEN in the purchase of creams, dyes, peroxide, scissors, etc. This loan of 700 PEN will be used to purchase a salon chair and utensils to set up her beauty salon, such as: scissors, a hair dryer, curlers, liquid hair products, creams, etc. This businesswoman dreams with opening her beauty salon as soon as possible, and also hopes to succeed in this venture so that she can earn money and continue supporting her son in his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a salon chair and utensils to set up her beauty salon, such as: scissors, a hair dryer, curlers, liquid hair products, creams, etc.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en: Estrellita R. is from the village of Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Estrellita owns and operates a business raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Estrellita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Estrellita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional animals. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es: Maria de los Santos tiene la edad de 51 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Maria tiene 7 hijos ninguno depende de ella. La actividad económica es la  venta y elaboración de comida. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Maria inicio este negocio con muchos esfuerzos y sacrificios, ya que tenía que dedicarse a sus hijos y al mismo tiempo tenía que comprar los granos básicos para la elaboración de sus platillos. Los propósitos de Maria para su negocio son de mejorar la calidad de su comida para obtener más clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo comprar granos básicos para la elaboración de gallo pinto, tortas rellenas, enchiladas, maduro, queso y huevo cocido. El sueño de Maria es convertir su pequeño negocio en un restaurante para que sus hijos tengan un porvenir para el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Maria de los Santos is 51 years old and single. Maria has seven children but none of them depend on her. She prepares and sells meals for a living. She has been in this business for more than 5 years. Maria started this business with much effort and sacrifice since she had to raise her children and simultaneously buy the basic grains to make her meals.Maria’s business goals are to improve her food’s quality and thus have more clients. The loan will be used to purchase basic grains for the production of gallo pinto (rice and beans), tortas rellenas (stuffed sandwiches), enchiladas, maduro (plantains), cheese and cooked eggs. Maria’s dream is to turn her small business into a restaurant so her children can have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bulk grains

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 29 years old, single, and has a primary school education. He has eight years of experience in his business and has one employee.

The purpose behind this loan is to purchase a new machine for his shop which will bring in more customers. He plans to hire more employees to help him, so as to deliver faster service to his clients.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine to fix punctures and change oil

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhon S. lives in Run Village in Takeo province. She raises pigs. Her husband, Mr. Khlouk Chet, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. He is also a construction worker.

Now Mrs. Sokhon S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow, a piglet to raise, and pig food. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family’s standard of living with this loan.

Mrs. Sokhon S. is 35 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow, a piglet and pig food

loans.name: Kul

texts.en:
Kul Y. is 50 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She and her husband are engaged in the agriculture sector, growing morning glories and other types of vegetables. They have been involved in farming since 1998 and are able to each earn an income of USD 7 per day.

Y. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, Y. is asking for a loan of USD 600 to purchase more seeds to grow morning glory and other types of vegetables. She thinks that her business will improve, since she has many existing customers and middle men who buy her vegetable products. This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. In the future, she hopes she will be able to build a nice new house for her family and send her children to good schools.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Zalfa

texts.en: Zalfa is a 24-year-old, married woman with one child. She has owned a clothes shop since 2008 in her village. After being well known in the whole region, Zalfa is asking to borrow $1,000 to expand her inventory for the winter and to provide a bigger choice of clothes to her clients.

loans.use: To expand her inventory.

loans.name: Leonor Maria

texts.es:
La Stra. Leonor Maria S. D. de  de 32 años de edad vive con su madre en casa propia en la Av. Principal de Comatrana – Ica ella es huerfana de padre por eso vive sola con su madre ya que su hermana es casada y está viviendo en otra ciudad.
La srta se dedica a la venta de cerveza y gaseosas en su domicilio pero tambien trabaja en una muebleria como vendedora ella tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante ella costea su estudio de ingles ya que desea poco a poco superase su anhelo es poder estudiar una carrera profesional la cual quedo trunca a raiz del terremoto ya que ha estado apoyando mas a su madre y ahorrando para construir su vivienda la cual ya levanto con esfuerzo de sus ahorros ahora ella esta solicitando que le financiemos por que le falta para el techado de la vivienda ya que desea que su madre este en un buen ambiente ya que mas de dos años han vivido en carpa y modulo de madera.
Ella goza de buenas referencias de los vecinos quienes manifiestan que es una hija bien buena y responsable.
texts.en:
Leonor Maria S. D., 32, lives with her mother in her own house on the Principal Avenue of Comatrana – Ica. She lost her father, and that is why she only lives with her mother. Her sister is married and lives in another city. She sells beer and soft drinks in her home. She also works as a salesperson in a furniture store. She has a great desire to get ahead. She pays to study English because she wishes to better herself little by little. She wants to be able to study a professional career, which was curtailed because of the earthquake. She has been supporting her mother more and saving to build her house. She used her savings to raise the house, and now she is asking for a loan because it needs a roof. She wants her mother to be in a good environment. For over two years they have lived in a tent and pre-fabricated housing. She enjoys good references from her neighbors. They say that she is a very good daughter, and that she is responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Leila Liga Group

texts.en:
Leila L. is from the village of Sta.Cruz in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Leila is the leader of a 3-member loan group sponsored by PMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Leila is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Leila owns and operates a general store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Leila has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Leila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Leila is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Leila's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Mrs. Phen N., age 40, breeds a few pigs in a stall next to her house, by which she earns a living. She breeds and sells her pigs at least twice a year and has been in this business for more than three years. She is able to sell the mature pigs to a slaughterer two or three times a year. Phen N. is married with two kids who are attending school. 

Her husband helps to support the family by selling fish that he catches himself. Recently the quantity of fish he catches is declining because his fishing equipment was ruined. Because of this, Phen N. looks for a loan for her husband to buy more equipment for fishing.
