loans.use: To buy more equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi is married with two teenage children. He lives in Vodyanoye, Ukraine and grows early spring vegetables for sale in the local markets in his region. Vitalyi owns six arch greenhouses where he does tomato and radish farming. He has been in the business for eight years. Vitalyi currently has 70,000 Grivnyas invested in his business. Annually he spends about 30,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene protective film. 

He is requesting a 10,000 Grivnya loan to buy five rolls of polyethylene film to repair the greenhouses damaged during heavy winter snowfalls and ice. The loan will give him the chance to sow seedlings in his greenhouses on time. One of Vitalyi’s short-term plans is to finish construction of the seventh greenhouse on his property. Profits generated last year enabled Vitalyi to buy a vehicle which helped in many aspects of his business.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene film and repair his greenhouses

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma F. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin province. She is 50 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Thelma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Thelma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Thelma is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda S. is from the village of Calaran Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Imelda is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Imelda owns a specialized retail store which primarily sells daily use products such as candies, snacks, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Imelda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane C. is thirty-eight years old and married to William Chebii.They have two children; Laura is eleven, and Dominic is seven. 

Jane runs a retail shop in Kabarnet Town; she started this business one year ago. She earns a profit of 14,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. Most of her clients are residents of Kabarnet Town.

She has borrowed a loan of 20,000 KES from KADET, and she plans to use 10,000 KES to purchase industrial goods, 5,000 KES to purchase maize for sale, and the balance to pay her employee. If this loan boosts her business she will use the extra profits to expand her business from retail to wholesale.

Jane has a dream of purchasing a vehicle for transportation purposes in the future, and she describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase stock for sale in her business

loans.name: Ilhombek

texts.ru: Саъдуллоев Ильхомбек проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Более 10 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он в основном продает мужскую одежду и обувь. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Ilhombek S. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 36 years old, married and has 5 children. He has a secondary education and has been involved in retail sales at a market for over 10 years. Ilhombek primarily sells men's clothing and shoes. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
Florencio es chofer propietario y trabaja  como transportista inter-provincial La Paz – Sahapaqui; esta es su  principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona Villa Bolivar “D”  de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la Transformación de su movilidad de gasolina a gas liquado, que cuesta mucho menos que la gasolina.
 
Es primer crédito con IMPRO, y el análisis de su flojo de fondos le permite solicitar este crédito.
texts.en:
Florencio is an independent driver and works along the inter-provincial route between La Paz and Sahapaqui. His business is the main source of income by which he supports his family. Florencio’s home is located in the District of Villa Bolivar “D” in the city of El Alto.

This loan will be used to convert his vehicle from gasoline to natural gas, since the cost of natural gas is less than gasoline. He is requesting his first loan from IMPRO. The analysis of his cash flow indicates he is able to request this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Convert his vehicle from gasoline to natural gas

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane E. is from the village of Magcamiguing Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 and married with one small child. To make a living, Jane owns a clothing business selling pants, miniskirts, and blouses. Jane has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jane from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Bozorgul

texts.en: Bozorgul is a very shy woman, but also very hardworking as a farmer and as the mother of four young children. She and her husband cultivate potatoes and corn. At the same time, they are engaged in raising cattle. What they urgently need right now are fertilizers and other chemicals for the care of their crops so that they can produce a product that is in line with the demands of the market. Bozorgul needs your help to buy the fertilizers, which are the most expensive and most necessary inputs for the cultivation of her crops. Her goal is to achieve better profits and benefits in the market. Bozorgul doesn’t just need good land; she also needs a friendly hand to help her out. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Niña

texts.en: Niña L. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Niña is married and has an infant. To make a living, Niña runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Niña has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Niña joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Niña is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Niña from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Badenya Ton 3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Badenya Ton 3 est constitué de huit mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles, avec en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et habitant toutes le village de Farabougou dans la commune rurale de Tesserela dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de parenté et de voisinage. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs superficies de culture et diversifier les spéculations, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er prêt de campagne. 
Les membres du groupe vont cultiver de l’arachide, du mil et du sésame.
Connue pour sa grande productivité d’arachide, Madame Djouma D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 50kg de semence d’arachide, 3 sacs de complexe céréales et recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de sarclage et de récolte d’arachide dans son champ. 
Elle se ravitaille en semence à la foire de Gouassola et en main d’œuvre avec les hommes du village. 
Elle compte récolter sur une superficie de 3,2 hectares: 30 sacs d’arachide et 4 sacs de mil. Le mil et une partie de la production d’arachide rentre dans la consommation familiale tandis que le reste est vendu à la foire de Ségou à une clientèle mixte. 
Le bénéfice obtenu est utilisé pour prendre en charge les frais scolaires des enfants et les dépenses du foyer au quotidien. 
Madame Djouma   D. a pour ambition l’achat des matériels agricoles qui pourra amoindrir les charges d’exploitation de ses champs dans le futur.
texts.en:
The Badenya Ton 3 group is made up of eight married women, most of whom live in large traditional families. They have an average age of 38 years and an average of 4 children and all live in the village of Farabougou in the rural commune of Tesserla in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali). They know each other through marriage, kinship, and neighborly ties. In order to increase their crop size and diversify the kinds of crops grown, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first seasonal loan. The group members will grow peanuts, millet, and sesame. Known for her impressive peanut production, Mrs. Djouma D. plans on using the loan to buy 50 kg of peanut seeds and 3 sacks of grains, and to pay for workers to weed and harvest the peanuts. She buys seeds at the market in Gouassola and she employs men from her village to work in the fields. On 3.2 hectares of land, she plans to harvest: 30 sacks of peanuts and 4 sacks of millet. The millet and a portion of the peanuts will be kept for the group's families, while the rest will be sold at the Ségou market to a mixed client base. The profits will be used to take care of children's schooling costs as well as household expenses. Mrs. Djouma D.'s goal is to buy agricultural materials that will be able to lessen the expenses incurred from working her fields.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pay workers

loans.name: Tulkinoi

texts.en:
Tulkinoi S. is a resident of Kadamjai, a small city in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Tulkinoi is 44 years old and she is married. She has four sons and two daughters; the eldest daughter is working and the other children are at school.  

Tulkinoi breeds cattle and her husband works as a butcher. Selling the meat they make 10,000 soms per month.  That money made it possible for them to save and purchase a piece of land to start building a new house.  

Tulkinoi hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase bulls for fattening and then to sell as meat.  In the near future she plans to build a new shed and start building a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase bulls to fatten

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: kossiwa est une revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale, elle fait son commerce il y a 4 ans déjà. elle exerce son commerce dans son quartier de gblinkomé en dressant un étalage à la devanture de sa maison. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. son stock de marchandises est en baisse, elle souhaite se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 5 bidons d'huile, 10 cartons de savons, 5 sacs de riz parfumés, 50 bols de maïs et divers. elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants.
texts.en:
Kossiwa sells food products. She sells in her district of Gblinkomé, setting up a stand in frond of her house. Her customer base is very diverse. Since her stock is getting low, she would like to replenish it, which is why she is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase 5 cans of oil, 10 cartons of soap, 5 bags of flavored rice, 50 bowls of corn and other miscellaneous utens. She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing food products

loans.name: Carmen Ines

texts.es:
Carmen de 52 años, tiene una tienda en la ventana delantera de su casa que es de caña, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Escogió tener una tienda debido a que necesitaba un ingresos para poder mantener a su familia, una de sus hijas le ayudo a comprar algunos víveres y readecuar su casa para ubicar la pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su cada de caña. Desde ese tiempo ella ha venido trabajando desde las 06h00am.    

Para seguir con su negocio el quiere con el préstamo comprar arroz, bebidas, azúcar, golosinas. En el futuro quiere tener su casa y que su tienda este muy surtida.
texts.en:
Carmen is 52 years old and has a store in the front window of her home which is made of cane. She lives in a periurban area named Duran which is characterized by the dissolution of its ecology. She decided to open a store because she needed income to be able to support her family. One of her daughters helped her buy some groceries and adjust her home to be able to locate the small store in the front part of her home. Since that time she has been working since 6:00 a.m. To continue her business, she wants to use the loan to buy rice, drinks, sugar and candies. In the future she wants to have her home and have her store be well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, drinks, sugar and candies

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia J. is a 63-year old married woman who supports her family by running a general store and food vending business. She lives in Lower Calasa within Caradio-an, a barangay of Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental province in the western Visayas islands. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and at her food vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 PHP.

Lilia is now borrowing 14,000 PHP so that she can purchase more inventory to sell. This will be her fifteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 11,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lilia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Perfume De Gardenias Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “ Perfume de Gardenias”, este grupo esta integrado por 10 clientas en este grupo se encuentra la señora Celia U. H. de 49 años de edad, nos platica que estudió carrera comercial en secretariado pero nunca la ejerció ya que se casó, hace 10 años decidieron poner su negocio de costura para poder sacar adelante a su familia, al principio fue difícil como en todo negocio que comienza, hasta que poco a poco se fueron haciendo de su cartera de clientes que dentro de la misma colonia los fueron  recomendando, poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo y las ganancias fueron incrementando,  la familia adquirió otra máquina para producir un mayor número de prendas y su producto fuera de mayor calidad. Los hijos de las integrantes de este grupo son su fuente de inspiración, el crédito lo quieren para invertir en sus negocios, su inquietud siempre ha sido que a sus hijos no les falte nada, y que su negocio crezca y sea cada vez más reconocido en su colonia.
texts.en:
This group is called “Perfume de Gardenias". It is made up of 10 clients.  One member of the group is Mrs. Celia U. H., who is 49 years old. She tells us that she studied business at a secretary school but she never practiced it because she married. Ten years ago she decided to open a business sewing to get her family ahead. At the beginning it was difficult like in every business at the beginning.  Little by little she was able to build her clientele in her own neighborhood. They would recommend her, and little by little her business grew and the earnings increased. The family acquired another machine to produce a greater number of pieces and to have a better quality product. 

The children of the group members are their inspiration source. They will use the loan to invest in their businesses. Their worry has always been for their children not to lack for anything and for their businesses to grow and be more well known in the neighborhood.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses

loans.name: Teofila Primitiva

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador”, ubicado en el distrito D. Capachica, provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, tiene 54 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, con dos hijos y con grado D. instrucción D. primaria incompleta.
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace diez años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles, el cual le permitió iniciar con su negocio D. venta D. jugo (papaya, plátano, alfalfa y otros).
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 700.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio. 
Su sueño  es progresar D. su negocio. Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la ganancia generada por el horro.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the San Salvador Communal Bank, which is located in the District of Capachica, Province and Department of Puno. She is 54 years old, married, and has two children. Teofila did not finish her elementary school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for ten years. The first loan she requested was in the amount of 300 PEN, which enabled her to start a business selling juices (papaya, banana, alfalfa, and other types).

Teofila is now requesting a new loan of 700 PEN to increase her business capital. Her dream is to make progress with her business. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the interest she earns from her savings.

loans.use: Operating capital for her juice business

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: El Sr. Abel  vive en la localidad de Puerto Rico, municipio de el Torno, es nacido en el departamento de Cochabamba, hace uno 10 años que se vino a vivir a la ciudad, su actividad es el transporte de personas (taxi), el destino del crédito es para la compra de materiales de construcción ya que están terminando un cuarto en su vivienda, hace unos dos año que se dedica a la actividad del transporte urbano su esposa con la cual tiene dos hijos, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, la cual le permite colaborar en la economía del hogar, es un apersona trabajadora y muy responsable esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Abel lives in Puerto Rico, in the town of El Torno.  He was born in Cochabamba department.  He came to live in the town 10 years ago.  His business is providing a taxi service.

Abel will use his loan to buy building materials since he is finishing off a room in his home.  He has been in the urban transport business for two years.  His wife, with whom he has two children, sells beauty products which allows her to contribute to the household finances.  Abel is a hard-working and very responsible man who is very grateful to the institution for the support he is receiving.

loans.use: To finish building his house

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es: Martha Beatriz da inicio debido a la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan diferentes productos tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella tiene experiencia en los diferentes créditos que ha realizado, la motivación que tiene para con su negocio es muy reconocida. Con el crédito comprara ropa, sabanas, toallas, ropa en general y calzado ya que se acerca una temporada muy buena.
texts.en:
Martha Beatriz started out because she needed to help her husband.  Her activity is general merchandise sales.  Most of the customers request different products.  She has three minor children in her care.

She has experience with the various loans she’s negotiated.  Her motivation for her business is very well known.

She will use the loan to buy clothes, sheets, towels and footwear because a very good season is approaching.

loans.use: To buy clothes, sheets, towels and footwear.

loans.name: Rukaya

texts.en:
Rukaya H. is married and has one child. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her  child.

Rukaya sells jewelries and fabrics in the vicinity of Takoradi by moving from one area to another. She is asking for the loan so she can buy more fabrics to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to sell

loans.name: Dorligsuren

texts.en: Dorligsuren P. lives with his children in Mongolia. His oldest two sons attend school. Dorligsuren operates a food products trading business in his town with help of his wife. He sells a variety of food stuffs to the workers in the gold mines. He started his grocery trading business in 2007 after operating a car and motorcycle repair center since 2002. After years of hard work, he has built a stable operation and his earnings have enabled him to pay his children's tuition fees. For the future, Dorligsuren wants to expand his business and plans to plant a variety of vegetables in his own 5 hectare field. He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to sell

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette L. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Jeanette is separated from her spouse and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jeanette owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods, detergents, biscuits & toothpaste in the local community. Jeanette has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jeanette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeanette has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jeanette is requesting a new loan of 21000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods, canned goods & biscuits. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Jeanette from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods, canned goods & biscuits

loans.name: Um

texts.en: From the province of Kompong Tom, Um K., 50, is a local rice cultivator who has been farming on her own farmland for many years. In addition, she raises a few pigs behind her house. She is married to Yorng, age 50, who also helps her in the farming business. They have seven children, of whom five are single and the other two are married. With growing family expenses, she needs to increase her income. Um K. is requesting a loan to purchase small pigs to raise for sale. With this loan she will increase her income and be able to support her family effectively.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs to raise for sale.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  food vending (barbeque pork/chicken) and farming.  She lives in the municipality of Narra, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,600. Priscilla is borrowing PHP 18,500 to continue to fund the operations of her business.  This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 16,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Priscilla aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old single man living with his parents and one sibling. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a mechanic for 18 years. He works on a freelance basis depending on customer's demands. He is a skilled mechanic, and he has a good number of clients asking for his high quality services. He helps his father with the household expenses. This will be his third Kiva loan. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase mechanical machinery which will help him make his work more professional. He has lots of plans in his mind and hopes to own a car repair shop in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase mechanical machinery

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia A. is from the village of Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old. Hermenia is separated from her spouse and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Hermenia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, breads, fruit juices in sachets and choco and milk drinks in the local community. Hermenia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Hermenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Hermenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Hermenia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the third loan taken out by Hermenia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Felibert

texts.en:
Felibert P. is from the village of Kimanait, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. He is 32 years old. Felibert is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Felibert raises pigs to sell. He has been in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Felibert joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Sala Sambila Plus Group

texts.en:
Julie is 31 and married with two daughters aged two and five years old. The oldest goes to school. 

Julie is the leader of the community bank named “Sala sambila Plus” which means "Work and pray" in English. The group is composed of five microentrepreneurs united in solidarity. The group was formed to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Julie runs a restaurant. With her first loan from Hope, she has expanded her business by adding beverages that are in high demand where she works in eastern Kinshasa. 

Julie makes the equivalent of $150 per week in profit. She has been a faithful Hope client, having four times obtained and correctly repaid loans. Since taking out loans from Hope her business has prospered. 

Julie is planning to use the coming loan to increase the stock of her restaurant by purchasing fish, chickens and so on with the aim of increasing the profits. She is working very hard and would like to continue receiving Hope loans in order to achieve her dreams of modernising her restaurant by using electrical appliances, such as hot plates instead of charcoal. She also plans to open a soft drinks facility.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her restaurant by purchasing fish, chickens and so on with the aim of increasing the profits.

loans.name: Aide Esperanza

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Aidé  tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos de 14, 12, 10 y 5 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio los otros dos están en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una ama de casa que realiza el crédito para el negocio de sus esposo el cual  se dedica al comercio, el  vende controles remotos para televisores y otros artefactos eléctricos, carcasas y accesorios de teléfonos celulares, a esta labor se dedica todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00. El recorre las calles de la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos. Sus productos los va a comprar en Guayaquil. Nos cuenta que su esposo lleva realizando este tipo de actividad desde hace seis años y que le va bien.

Este crédito es para comprar controles,  carcasas y accesorios para teléfonos celulares. Está en el Banco comunal  hace 10 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le ha dado la institución y por la oportunidad para apoyar a su esposo en el negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa de cemento ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
The May 3 Community Bank meets every 15 days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo celebrations and for its happy people.

In this place, we meet Aidé who is 34 years old, is married and, from that relationship, has four children who are 14, 12, 10 and 5 years old. The two eldest study in high school and the other two are in elementary school. Her husband is a trader.

She is a head of household who is requesting a loan for the business of her husband who is dedicated to trading. He sells TV remote controls and other appliances, cellphone cases and cellphone accessories. He is dedicated to this work everyday from 8AM until 6PM. He walks the city streets selling his products. He is going to buy his products in Guayaquil. She tells us that her husband has been doing this kind of work for six years and that it is going well.

This loan is to buy controls, cellphone cases and cellphone accessories. She's been in the community bank for ten years and she likes it for the help that the institution has given her and for the opportunity to support her husband with the business.

Her dream is to have a cement house since the one she has is made of cane.

loans.use: to purchase remote controls, cellphone cases and cellphone accessories.

loans.name: Marie Stella

texts.en:
Marie Stella is a married woman with 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marie Stella is 29 years old and her 2 children are in school.

Marie Stella has a fruit and vegetables vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruit and vegetables to sell in her fruit stall.

Marie Stella has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Marie Stella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, es socia de Banco Comunal Tarpuy, tiene 29 años, es soltera y un hijo de 13 años. Tiene cabinas de Internet. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de monitores planos para su negocio.
Gladys tiene una tienda de Cabinas de Internet en la casa de sus padres, comenzó con éste negocio hace tres años, decidió abrir este negocio porque antes ya habia trabajado en este rubro, aprovecho que en su cuadra no habia éste servicio y poco a poco lo fue implementando, ahora en sus cabinas también hay un locutorio telefonico, tambien vende gaseosas y golosinas. Le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal en FINCA Perú, por la facilidad a los créditos y las capacitaciones que reciben por parte de sus promotora que le enseñan a trabajar. Ahora está ahorrando para comprarse un terreno.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the “Tarpuy” communal bank.  She’s 29 years old, single and has a 13-year-old son.  She has Internet access booths.  She is asking for the loan to buy flat screen monitors for her business.

Gladys has Internet access booths installed in her parents’ house.  She started the business three years ago.   She decided to open it because she had worked in this occupation previously and took advantage of the fact that this service was unavailable on her block.  She gradually equipped it.  Now, she also has a phone booth there and she sells soft drinks and snacks.

She enjoys the meetings of her communal bank in FINCA Perú because of the ease of the loans and the trainings they get from their advisor that teach them how to work.  Currently, she’s saving up to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy flat screen monitors.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La Señora Beatriz, tiene 22 años, ella esta casada y tiene 2 hijos que todavía no asisten a clases, ella junto a su esposo  ofrecen Servicio de Amplificación para fiestas y otros eventos, además de ofrecer alquiler de sillas, mesas y manteles a los diferentes colegios y eventos particulares que atienden. Hoy ellos necesitan del crédito ya que con el tiempo han aprovechado de comprar una fotocopiadora que funciona junto a un colegio y quieren implementar un punto internet, ya cuentan con los monitores y sólo les falta la caja para colocar las tarjetas y sistema técnico de las computadoras por eso solicito el crédito para la compra de una  computadora, Ellos a pesar de jóvenes se caracterizan por ser responsables ya que no es la primera vez que trabajan con Emprender y hemos podido ver como empezaron vendiendo comida y luego ir implementado el servicio Alquiler de Amplificación,  fotocopiadora y ahora el punto internet.
texts.en: Señora Beatriz is 22.  She is married and has 2 children who are still too young for school. She and her husband rent sound systems for parties and other events, and also offer rentals of chairs, tables and linens to the different schools and special events that they attend. Today they need the loan as over time they have purchased a photocopier that is shared with a school, and now they want to start offering internet access.  They have monitors and lack only the hard drive and computer technical system.  This is why they asking for a loan to purchase a computer.  Although they are young, they are responsible and this is not the first time that they have worked with Emprender.  We have been able to see how they started selling food and then gone on to provide their audio systems rental service, photocopying and now internet access.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.en: Maria is a single mother of five who lives in the San Lorenzo region of Honduras. For the last three years she has made a living by operating a small convenience shop. Her shop is in a good location, given that it is very close to a local school. Maria is requesting a loan of Lps. 20,000 to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase meats, cheeses, fruits, vegetables, snacks, milk, soft drinks, basic grains, salt, butter, cooking oil, basic household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Paulina Naf.

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha na Provincia de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique, casada e mãe de 1 filho de 2 anos de idade. Fez a 12ªclasse e se formou como professora. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo é professora ha 6 anos afecta na Escola de Mahelane no Distrito de Namaacha e tem um salario de 5.300.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem e cliente. este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para a sua obra (ferro, tabua, prancha,cimento, e outros ).O primeiro emprestimo foi de 20.000.00mt. 
Sonha em concluir a sua casa, mobilar e iniciar um negocio e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en: Paulina was born in the district of Namaacha in Maputo province in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of a two-year-old son. She finished the 12th grade and trained as a teacher. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else. She's never left Mozambique. She's been a teacher for six years at the Mahelane school in Namaacha and earns 5300 meticals a month. She uses her salary for household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account. She's never had a loan from other banks. She heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client. This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (rebar, lumber, cement, etc.). Her first loan was for 20,000 meticals. Her dream is to finish her house, furnish it, and start her own business, for which she will request additional loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (rebar, lumber, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en:
Gibrilla is 27 years old and married to an experienced trader. The couple has two children, ages eight and 10. Gibrilla began his retail business in 2001. He had dropped out of school and worked with his father, learning the retail business. When he became an adult, he continued trading, selling cosmetics and items such as candy, biscuits, cigarettes and other items. Gibrilla works six days a week, 10 hours a day to earn 950,000 SLL each month. He gets his supplies from Freetown and he travels there by public transport weekly.

Gibrilla is requesting a 4,000,000 SLL loan to buy supplies such as cigarettes, sweets, and biscuits. He hopes that his loan will increase his monthly profit by approximately 220,000 SLL. In the future, Gibrilla plans to educate his children, build a house and start saving to open a larger shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, sweets, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Mélanie

texts.fr:
Veuve, Mélanie vit en location avec son unique enfant dont elle supporte la totalité des charges.
Dotée d'une expérience d'au moins 17 ans, la cliente est spécialisée dans la vente des sacs de charbon et des bois de chauffage qu'elle cède le plus souvent à crédit à ses clients moyennant paiement d'acomptes; la récupération des fonds se fait progressivement au quotidien. Elle a une large clientèle constituée des petits détaillants et des ménages de sa zone et de ses environs. Les sacs de charbon et les bois lui sont livrés à domicile par les grossistes ayant reçu l'agrément de commercialiser les produits forestiers. 
Après des ventes Mélanie ne se sent plus en mesure de satisfaire les nouvelles demandes de ses clients, raison pour laquelle elle à décidé renouveler son micro crédit afin d'augmenter sa capacité d'approvisionnement. Une partie du revenu supplémentaire sera réinvestie dans son commerce pour son renforcement et le reste lui permettra de subvenir à toutes les besoins de son enfant orphelin de père et à ses besoins personnels.
Elle est actuellement à son 7ème crédit à FINADEV.
texts.en:
Mélanie is a widow renting a place with her only child whom she supports entirely herself. Bestowed with at least seventeen years of experience, our client is a specialist in selling sacks of charcoal and firewood that she most frequently allows on credit for her customers via down payment; collecting the payments is done bit by bit each day. She has a large customer base composed of small-scale retailers and households in and around her area. Sacks of charcoal and wood are delivered to her home by wholesalers licensed for marketing forest products. 

After her sales, Mélanie no longer feels able to meet new customer orders. This is why she decided to renew her micro-loan for increasing her ability to stock up. Part of the extra revenues will be reinvested in her business to strengthen it, and the rest will enable her to support all her needs and those of her child, who was orphaned by the father. 

Mélanie is currently on her seventh loan at FINADEV.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of charcoal and a truck load of wood

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú), tiene 41 años de edad, Actualmente, ella vive en donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Ella tiene un puesto de venta de comestibles en el centro comercial el Molino II. Ya son once años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Rufina requiere el préstamo para comprar bolsas de azúcar, bolsas de fideos y bolsas arroz. 

El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Rufina was born in the city of Cusco, Peru. She is 41 years old and currently lives in the city where she was born, which is also where she engages in her business activities. Rufina has a vending stall at the Molino II Market where she sells food products. She has been in this business for eleven years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Rufina is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy bags of sugar, bags of noodles, and bags of rice.

The Communal Bank “El Molinito II” meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco in Peru. This city is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, and rice.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 66 years old and married with 10 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from selling Ready-to-Wear.

Erlinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 27 years old and married with a two-year-old child. He does carpentry to earn a living. He started this business six years ago and has employed one person. He also runs a grocery for extra income. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has been trained on business management. This has helped him to improve his business, save his money, and invest.

Pater hopes to own a timber yard within five years. With a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), he will buy timber to supply his business.

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Enos

texts.en: Enos, 39, is a hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with six children. For the last four years, he has been making and repairing shoes to support the family. He has improved his business with the previous loan from Faulu Kenya. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy shoe soles.

loans.use: To buy shoe soles

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Fe, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 2 años. 
Felicitas tiene dos carros y siembra papa, recuerda que el primer crédito lo invirtió en papa seca para poder vender, a ella le encanta las capacitaciones, le ayudan mucho en su vida personal como en su negocio, esta muy agradecida por todo el apoyo que recibe en Finca, ahora su préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de abono y llantas para sus carros, ahora su meta es poder sacar a delante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the “Fe” (Faith) communal bank.  She is 44 years old and has three children.  She has been a member of FINCA for two years.

Felicitas has two cars, and she grows potatoes.  She remembers that she used her first loan to buy dried potatoes to be able to sell.  She loves the trainings.  They help her a lot personally as well as in her business.  

She is very grateful for all of the support she gets from FINCA.  She will use her current loan to buy fertilizer and tires for her cars.  Her current goal is to be able to get her children ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Angela works hard to support her family.  She has a banana retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Angela is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell.

Angela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar tiene 20 años, es un joven emprendedor, dinámico y alegre. Es soltero, pero vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de uno de sus hermanos, su prima y una sobrina. El trabajo que realiza Omar es el alquiler de un equipo de sonido para la actividades sociales, siendo esta cada fin de semana. Tiene seis meses realizando esta actividad, lo que le ha permitido ser conocido. Paralelo a ello, también vende ropa masculina como polos, camisas y pantalones de buena calidad y que estén a la moda, mercadería que trae desde la ciudad de Lima, negocio que tiene un año y hasta el momento le ha ido bien y ya tiene diversos pedidos por la campaña navideña que se avecina. 
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el ingreso económico, con el cual puede apoyar en la economía de su hogar y pagar sus estudios, además de comprarse artículos personales. Desea seguir progresando y con esfuerzo lograr abrir una tienda de ropa. Este sería su primer crédito con MFP, se siente muy contento y agradecido por la oportunidad que le dan, asimismo se compromete en ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más ropa masculina para ello deberá viajar a Lima para comprar dicha mercadería.
texts.en:
Omar is 20 years old. He’s an enterprising, dynamic, and joyful young man. He is single, but he lives at home with his parents along with his siblings, his cousin, and a niece. 

Omar rents sound equipment for social occasions every weekend. He’s been doing this work for six months which has made him well-known. At the same time, he also sells high quality and stylish men’s clothing like polo shirts, shirts, and pants. He brings in this merchandise from Lima. He’s had this business for one year, and right now it’s going well. He already has several orders for the upcoming Christmas season. What he likes about his work is the income. With that he can help with the household finances, afford his schooling, and buy personal items. He would like to continue moving forward, and with hard work he will be able to open a clothing store. 

This will be his first loan with MFP. He’s very happy and thankful for the opportunity he’s been given. Also he is committed to making punctual payments. With the amount requested, he will buy more men’s clothing and to do that he will have to travel to Lima.

loans.use: to buy more men's clothing.

loans.name: Nen

texts.en:
Nen is 25 years old and her husband, Pous is 28 years old. The have been married since 2003 and have two young children - one son and one daughter. The family is living in a village about fifteen kilometers from the City.

Nen and her husband are farmers. They grow bean on their farmland in the village where they live. Nen is asking for her first loan in the amount of $100 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm.  

Photo: Nen is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex used the previous loan to buy sugar, salt, and soap for sale and has progressed amidst price fluctuations and inflation, customers not paying on time, and inadequate capital to purchase merchandise. His business goals are expanding his business into new markets and moving his business to a more permanent location. Alex needs the loan to buy powdered soap, millet flour, and sugar for sale ahead of this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy powdered soap, millet flour, and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 56 years old, married with 4 children. Leonora is from Kinuman, Ozamis city. Her husband is a farmer.
The family has a meager income, that's why Leonora decided to establish a small food stall. 

Leonora is in food business selling bread "puto maya, suman and coffee" in the market. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns 2,500PHP a month. Leonora 

In 2009, Leonora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Leonora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients for "suman and puto maya" glutinous rice . This loan will be her second cycle from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: purchase ingredients for "suman and puto maya" glutinous rice

loans.name: Gulshod

texts.ru: Гульшод замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Она является преподавателем в местной школе. Её зарплата не хватает на содержание семьи и поэтому она начала заниматься дополнительно агробизнесом. Этот бизнес является скотоводством и выращивание сельхозкультур. Более 20 лет она в этом бизнесе и она имеет хороший опыт. Гульшод хочет улучшить свои жилищные условия и хочет сделать штукатурку и покрыть пол и потолки. С этой целью он просит вас о помощи. Спасибо вам большое!
texts.en: Gulshod is married and is a loving mother of four children.  She is a teacher at a local school.  Her salary is, however, not enough to support her family, and this is why she also got involved in an agricultural business.  This business is animal husbandry and growing agricultural crops.  Gulshod has been in this business for over 20 years and has a good experience in it.  Gulshod wants to improve her living conditions and wants to make plaster and cover floors and ceilings.  She is asking you for help for this purpose.  Thank you very much!

loans.use: to improve her living conditions

loans.name: Renante

texts.en:
Renante is from Dalapang, Ozamiz City. He is 32 years old. Renante is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, he grows corn and rice for sale. He has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP each month. 

In 2008, Renante joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Renante is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, de oficio agricultor, habita en el municipio de San juan Limay en Estelí, el con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio aprendió a leer y a escribir. En este municipio donde sus terrenos son muy fértiles sobretodo para siembra de hortalizas el cultiva hermosos y frescos repollos, cebolla y tomates que con sus hermosos colores adornan los campos a orillas de la carretera. El lleva 15 años sembrando por sus propios medios. Antes el estuvo trabajando en Costa Rica y con lo que ahorro regreso su  tierra y fue que comenzó a sembrar sus hortalizas el tenia 20 años. Hoy en día el es que mantiene a su esposa y sus dos hijos con este negocio, también hace trabajos de albañil oficio que aprendió cuando estuvo en Costa Rica. 
El requiere el préstamo para compra de insumos, pago de mano de obra para sembrar ½ manzana de tomate. Esto le ayudara a sacar una producción de muye buena calidad ya que lo poco que tiene no cubre el costo de producción. 
Una de sus metas es mejorar el sistema de riego pata sus cultivos y comprar una motobomba para fumigar y evitar la propagación de plagas en su cosecha.  Siempre quiere diversificar sus cultivos y ampliar las áreas de siembra .
texts.en:
Francisco, a farmer, lives in the town of San Juan Limay in Esteli Department. Through a great deal of effort and sacrifice he learned to read and write. In this town with land that is very fertile, above all for vegetable cultivation, Francisco grows beautiful, crisp  cabbages, onions and tomatoes which adorn the fields along the highway with their lovely colors. He has been cultivating crops on his own for 15 years. Previously he was working in Costa Rica and he returned to his country with his savings and that was when he started planting vegetables. He was 20 years old. Nowadays he supports his wife and his two children with this business. He also works as a bricklayer, a job he learned while he was in Costa Rica.

Francisco needs the loan to purchase supplies and pay a workforce to sow approximately .865 an acre of tomatoes. This will help him to produce a very good quality crop since his own scarce resources would not cover the cost of production.

One of his goals is to improve the irrigation system for his crops and buy a pump to fumigate them and prevent the spread of pests.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay a work force to plant approximately .865 an acre of tomatoes.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод женат и любящий отец троих детей. Он занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Для содержания скота имеет хорошие условия, а также корм, который  выращивает сам. В бизнесе помогает ему жена и они дружно работают. Также он имеет коммерческий магазин по продаже мебели. Дилшод, хотел бы получить займ для покупки 2 голов крупного и мелкого рогатого скота, а на остальную сумму хочет купить семена ячменя для посева.
texts.en:
Dilshod is married and the loving father of three children. He makes a living by breeding animals, farming and selling furniture via his store. 
Dilshod boasts optimal conditions for animal breeding, and, additionally, he personally grows their feed. Dilshod's wife assists him with running the business; they happily work together. 
Dilshod requires a loan in order to purchase two heads of large and small cattle. He would use the remainder of the loan to buy barley seeds for sowing.

loans.use: To buy cattle and seeds of barley

loans.name: Megi

texts.en:
Megi, who is 33 years old housekeeper, is from Gori. She is divorced woman and takes care with school-aged son. In spite of her high education, Megi was unable to find any stable job. She had been involved in trading business with bed linens and was getting some income. Now she has no source of income and has start to seek credit among local financial institutions. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living.  So, she decided to re-start trading business with the loan but the local credit providers usually request some stable income from the borrowers. Megi’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Megi will purchase stock of bed linens at wholesale prices and sell among her clients in increased prices. 
The loan will greatly assist Megi, and she will be able to continue her lovely job. Due to her kind and nice attitude toward clients, Megi has a big list of loyal customers. She will be very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: To re-start her trading business with bed linens

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 56 years old, married and all her children are independent. Unfortunately, one of her daughters passed away and left three children. Margaret takes care of the three children. Two are in primary school while the oldest one assists her to run the business. She is working hard to educate them up to at least college level. She set her business near the busiest bus stage of Rongai. Her business is located near the bus stop and therefore makes a lot of sales in the evening when the residents going back home from work. However, in the morning she supplies to those who roast\boil maize along the roadside. She buys fresh maize from various markets; Wakulima, Kiserian and Kadisi.

loans.use: Margaret wants to start selling other food stuffs such as yellow bananas, mangoes, green pepper, and onions.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis sells cleaning products for the home. He started his business selling these products door to door. He launched his business selling polish, sponges and clothespins. He continues to sell those products along with cleaning clothes and aluminum cleaner.

Luis would use the loan to buy products wholesale in order to earn more profit. He aspires to one day be a distributor so he could help and give work to other people. He has faith that with additional merchandise in stock his business will grow. Luis is the father of 2 children. He is 37 years old and married. Luis has hope that with this loan he'll improve his family's quality of life and bring stability and growth to his business.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Luis vende productos de limpieza para el hogar. Luis empezó su negocio vendiendo estos productos puerta a puerta. Se inicio vendiendo lustre, esponja, pinza. Ahora el continua vendiendo este mismo producto junto con toallas de limpieza y aluminio blanqueador. Luis usara el préstamo para invertir comprando estos productos al por mayor y así obtener mejores ingresos. El tiene la aspiración de llegar a tener una distribuidora, de esta manera poder ayudar y dar empleo a otras personas. El tiene la fe que teniendo mas mercadería en stock su negocio crecerá. Luis es Padre de dos hijos, esta casado, tiene 37 años. Luis tiene la esperanza que con este préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y le dará estabilidad y crecimiento al negocio.

loans.use: Invest in cleaning products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

texts.en: Mrs. H. is 22 years old, and her husband is 27 years old. They have a 1 year old son. While her husband makes and installs iron frames for windows, she runs a rice cracker bakery. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the upper center of Vietnam. The bakery has been a family business for over ten years now, and her profit is $3.00 per day. She wants a loan to pay the supplier of rice and sesame promptly, instead of buying on credit with very high interest rates.

loans.use: To buy more rice and sesame for her business

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en: Sorie T. is a petty trader who owns a shop in Fadugu village in Sierra Leone.  He is the chairman of the Traders Union for the entire chiefdom. Sorie is married with five children.  Originally, Sorie operated his business as a partnership with two colleagues.  With his previous loan, Sorie decided to separate from the partners and started his own grocery business.  He is now requesting a loan of $350 to expand it.  Sorie said that he used the profit from the previous loan to put up the small kiosk for the business and needs more loan capital to increase the stock.

loans.use: Growth of his grocery business

loans.name: Koleti

texts.en:
Koleti loves planting and eating vegetables, which is why she is interested in running a vegetable garden business. She is 36-years-old, a mother of three kids, and is separated from her husband.

She started off with a loan of $300 USD, which was spent on buying chemicals for garden maintenance, as well as vegetable seeds for planting her crops. She works really hard, because this is her only source of income for her family needs, especially her children's school fees. Even though she feels exhausted sometimes, she remains strong. She knows that her family needs her. She is very happy for the financial support from SPBD’s loan program.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds and chemicals needed for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Zuberi

texts.en: Zuberi is a 44-year-old father of three and a resident of Bombom in Dar es Salaam. He runs a pharmacy, a business he has been doing for six years. He sells all sorts of common medicines for fever, malaria and other common diseases for women and children. He is in need of $725 to help him expand the stock in his pharmacy.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in new equipment and improve the appearance of her store

loans.name: Kalungi E Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for seven months. Leontina has a clothes selling business. She wants to use the extra business profits to increase capital by stocking more clothes. Annet makes and sells snacks and wants to use the loan to expand business. Edith has a public pay phone. Rebecca sells envelopes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es:
Mrs. Barbara belongs to the Bellavista Communal Bank, located at 367 Jr. Roca Fuerte Avenue, in the district of Calleria, the state of Ucayali. Barbara is 42 years old, she is the mother of 4 children and is separated. The first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she decided to invest in the sale of food. Nowadays she continues selling food, which has grown in earnings and it is due to the rich maturity that her food has. Barbara wakes up very early to go to the market, later in the mornings she dedicates herself to the preparation of her foods and at night, with the help of her children, she leaves to sell her product. With the loan of 1700 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy plates, forks, tables, seats, tablecloths and the rest of the capital she will designate to the daily purchase of the supplies. Barbara has a rough routine everyday, but without it she couldn’t take care of her family life. She has always had the thought in her mind to better her business with the sale of food and she hopes to continue this with the support of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bárbara pertenece al banco comunal Bellavista, ubicado en el Jr. Roca Fuerte N° 367, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años, es madre de 4 hijos y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. En la actualidad continua con la venta de comida, la cual ha crecido en ganancias y ello debido a la rica sazón que tiene. Barbara se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado, luego en las mañanas se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas y por las noches, con la ayuda de sus hijos, sale a vender su producto. Con el préstamo de S/.1,700, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará platos, tenedores, mesas, sillas, manteles y el resto de capital lo destinó para la compra diaria de los víveres. Bárbara tiene una rutina muy agitada todos los días, pero aún así no descuida su vida familiar. Siempre tiene en mente ampliar su negocio con la venta de comidas y espera seguir contando con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase plates, forks, tables, seats, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth L. and her daughter live in their own home in the Alto Sopocachi zone of La Paz. Ruth is employed and works as a secretary for a public transit company in the city. Her home has one bedroom in her home that is roughly constructed (simply brick walls with a metal roof). Ruth would like to complete this room so that it can become her daughter’s room. Her daughter is getting older and up till now still sleeps in the same room as her mother, Ruth.

The loan will be used to do the finish work on the room. This is the first time that Ruth has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis shows her to be a good candidate. She is approved for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ruth L. vive en casa propia en la zona de Alto Sopocachi de la Ciudad de La Paz con su hija. La señora Ruth es empleada, trabaja como secretaria en una empresa de transporte publico de esta ciudad. Su vivienda tiene una habitación que se encuentra en obra gruesa (construcción de muros de ladrillo y techo de calamina), la misma que la señora Ruth quiere concluir para que sea el dormitorio de su hija que ya esta alcanzando a la mayoría de edad y que aun se encuentra ocupando la misma habitación con su madre. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en obra fina de una habitación. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Complete the construction of a room so that her daughter can have a room to herself.

loans.name: Sawudatu

texts.en:
Sawudatu M. prepares food for sale. She is married and has 4 children. Business is doing very well, and customers are increasing.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more food stuffs to increase production.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more food stuffs to increase production

loans.name: Ngoc Thanh

texts.vi:
Ms. D. Ngoc Thanh is twenty six year old. Her family has a computer repair store and an internet business. Her husband does the repair works while she takes care of the accounting and administration. Her group already participated once in the 6 month loan program and they all repaid very well. This time she requests a loan of $VN2.242.000 to buy more equipments for her store.

Ms. D. thi Nga requests a loan of $VN 2.242.000 to start a business in cutlery.

Ms. Nguyen thi Tam requests a loan of $VN 2.242.000 to start a snack food business.

Ms. Le thi Quy requests a loan of $VN 2.242.000 to buy rice to make rice pastry for sales.

Ms Nguyen thi Ngoan requests a loan of $VN 2.242.000 to have capital for a breakfast food business..

Ms. Nguyen thi Hoa requests a loan of $VN 2.006.000 to start a retail store. .

Translated from Vietnamese by Hien, a Kiva volunteer

Chị Đăng Ngọc Thanh (MS:030005), năm nay 26 tuổi. Gia đinh chị có có cửa hàng kinh doanh Internet và sửa chữa máy tính. Chị trực tiếp đứng ra trông quán và thu tiền, chồng chị phụ trách việc sửa chữa máy tính. Nhóm chị đều đã trải qua một chu kỳ vay 6 tháng và đã hoàn trả rất tốt. Lần này chị vay 2.242.000 VND để mua linh kiện thay thế cho máy tính ở của hàng Internet. Chị Đặng Thị Nga (MS: 030001), vay 2.242.000 VND để mua hàng dao kéo về bán. Chị Nguyễn Thị Tâm (MS: 030002), vay 2.242.000 VND để mua đỗ nấu chè bán. Chị Lê Thị Quý (MS: 030003), vay 2.242.000 VND mua gạo làm bánh cuốn bán. Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngoan (MS: 030004), vay 2.242.000 VND để thêm vốn bán hàng ăn sáng. Chị Nguyễn Thi Hòa (MS: 030035), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua hàng tạp hóa về bán.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is married and has 5 children; 3 women and 2 man who are married, her husband is retired. She started her business to help her husband support their children and pay for their studies. She started the business 7 years ago selling different items and has been selling catalog cosmetics for approximately 3 years.

Following her friend's advice, she started offering them among her friends and acquaintances, who then recommended her products to other people and that's how she started building a client base.

She needs a loan of $550 USD that she will pay back in 6 months to buy merchandise and give better service to her clients by having the products ready in the moment they are needed. With your support Yolanda will make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda esta casada, es casada y si tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 son mujeres y 2 hombres ya casados, su esposo es jubilado. Inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo en la manutencion de sus hijos y pagar sus estudios. Comenzó el negocio hace 7 años vendiendo diferentes articulos y lleva aproximadamente 3 años vendiendo cosmeticos por catalogo.

Por consejo de una amiga, empezo a ofrecerlos entre sus amistades y conocidos, quienes la empezaron a recomendar a otras personas y asi fue creando su cartera de clientes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $550 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y darle mejor servicio a sus clientes, contando con los productos en el momento que se lo soliciten. Con tu apoyo Yolanda hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor de Maria dedicates her time to agriculture and farming. She raises cows and bulls, which also help with her crops. On weekends, Flor de Maria sells milk in the markets of the nearest city. She is a mother of three studious children, and she hopes to provide them with everything necessary for their studies.
