Our partner learned about the business to perfection and knows the suppliers so she decided to open her own stand in the same market. She requires the loan to travel and bring some merchandise and will continue doing this more frequently and with a little bit more capital. She is very excited because she will be able to become her own boss and will give work to other people that like her started since they were young. The partner will bring more clothing for young girls. She is grateful for being able to keep her business growing and is committed to fulfill the payment of her debt in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su propio negocio.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie, 33 years old, grows rice in her hometown. She is married and has four children. Her rice farm is the only source of income her family has. She wants to have an abundant harvest so that all her family’s needs will be met. 

She currently needs inputs at her farm. She requested 12,000 Philippine pesos from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use it to buy inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. She will also pay the laborers she hired to help till her farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena B. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 39 years old. Magdalena is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Magdalena raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Magdalena has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP whenever she harvests her crops.

In 2009, Magdalena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magdalena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. Magdalena is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Magdalena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity, 38-years old, is a reliable LAPO client with good repayment record. She owns a home-items shop where she sells goods like stainless pots, plastic bowls, baskets etc. She manages the business with the help of her four children who assist at the shop after school.

Charity is very determined and wants to expand the size of her business. She is requesting a loan of $950 to purchase more inventory. This will help her attract more customers and make a better profit. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for a home products business

loans.name: Luz De Fe 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Francisca is the coordinator of her group Luz de Fe (Light of Faith), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizzos, a dusty industrial town north of the Capitol, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with her long term partner and their three children.

Francisca is excited to be taking her first loan from Esperanza and she is excited at the opportunity to grow her business and have access to low cost capital. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a fantasia, small store which caters towards women, by investing in merchandise such as blouses, jeans, hair products and accessories. She will use the profits to invest in saving towards the future of her children who she wants to send to University and being able to purchase her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Hair products, clothes and accessories for resale

loans.name: Victoire Houndema

texts.fr: G. Victoire Houndema est née le 29 Décembre 1960 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à MAHOULIKPONTO Edmond, un maçon, Victoire est mère de huit enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Il y a 21 ans environs que Victoire s'est installée au quartier Akadjamey dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, où elle vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différentes charges de la famille. Victoire n'est jamais allée à l'école. Depuis 15 ans, Victoire mène comme activité la vente de feuilles et plantes de la médécine traditionnelle dans une barraque à Gbodjè (Cotonou). Victoire s'approvisionne à Adja, Sè et à Glazoué au Bénin. Victoire a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Dans le but d'augmenter son stock de produits et de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, Victoire sollicite un deuxième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Victoire Houndema G. was born 29 December 1960 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Married to Edmond MAHOULIKPONTO, a mason, she is the mother of eight children of whom some have had schooling. She settled 21 years ago in the Akadjamey borough of the Abomey Calavi commune, where she lives with her children and her husband. She shares with him the various family expenses. Victoire has never attended school; for the past 15 years, she has sold traditional medicinal leaves and plants in a stall located in Gbodjè (Cotonou). She gets her supplies from Adja, Sè and Glazoué in Bénin. Victoire has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was repaid in full. Wishing to increase her stock of supplies in response to customer needs, she is now requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 5 dozen canaris (earthenware), 7 bags of tree bark, 6 bags of tree roots, 8 bags of leaves.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en: Jonah G. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Jonah is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Jonah runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products, such as mineral water, snack foods, soy sauce and vinegar, in the local community. Jonah has been engaged in her business for years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Jonah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jonah is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Jonah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gulustan

texts.en: Gulustan H. is 32 years old and a trader who sells different kinds of goods. She sells candies, cookies, eggs, cigarettes and beverages. She is married and has three children. Income from this shop in only one financial source in the Gulustan family. Now she has applied for 1000 AZN to purchase more goods.

loans.use: To purchase more food goods

loans.name: Bwavumpologoma Women's Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
K. Charles is an affable and ambitious 37-year-old married father of one. He is a man with a business sense of purpose. To take care of his family, he knew he had to find a reliable means of subsistence. It is exactly five years ago that he made a decision to begin his small clinic and drugstore enterprise in Kiyoola, Lugazi.

Ever since then, Charles has made steady headway in firmly taking measures aimed at growing and expanding his franchise. Coming to terms with the fact that his neighborhood did not have a clinic, made him seize the opportunity to open up one. This business has been of paramount importance to him, especially in regard to the improvement in the welfare standing of his family.

In a week, Charles’ business generates him profits totaling up to 70,000 shillings. With this loan, he wants to buy a new consignments of drugs for his clinic and drugstore.

loans.use: To purchase a new consignments of drugs for his clinic and drugstore

loans.name: Henry Vicente

texts.es:
Henry es soltero y pertenece al Banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bello en quechua
Henry tiene una moto taxi con la cual realiza transporte publico en la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días, Henry solicita un crédito de 1000 soles que será destinado para la reparación de su moto.
Henry sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener una casa propio.
texts.en:
Henry is single and belongs to the Imasumacc Communal Bank which means How Beautiful in Quechua. Henry has a moto-taxi [motorcycle with attached cab for passengers] with which he provides public transportation in the city of Ayacucho seven days a week. Henry is seeking a loan of 1,000 soles which will be used for repairs to his vehicle. Henry dreams of expanding his business and having his own home.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For repairs to his moto-taxi

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace C. is from the village of Southwestern Pob. Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Grace is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from cultivating decorative trees like mangoes for sale. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Grace is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Grace from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Jose inicia con 17 socias.
Graciela es presidenta del Banco Comunal por segunda vez y es socia hace 8 meses y lo que le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro. 
Graciela es soltera y tiene 4 hijos por quienes trabaja para brindarles todo lo mejor, su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa D. material noble porque ahora su casa es D. material rustico, vive en la Asentamiento Humano San José cerca del penal D. la ciudad, Graciela venD. comida rápida como salchipapas, hamburguesas D. manera ambulatoria en una avenida transitada D. la ciudad para lo cual cuenta con una carreta, actividad que realiza todos los días por las noches desD. las 5 D. la tarD. hasta las 5 D. la mañana, además viaja a las fiestas patronales en donD. permanece por algunos días vendiendo sus productos.
Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. papa, aceite, descartables.
texts.en:
The San José Communal Bank began with 17 members. Graciela is the president of the communal bank for the second time, and what she likes about it is the incentive to save money.

Graciela is single and has 4 children for whom she works to offer a better life. Her dreams are that her children will become professionals and that she will be able to build her house with stronger materials because now her house is built with primitive material. She lives in Asentamiento Humano San José near the city jail. Graciela sells fast food such as salchipapas (fried potatoes and sausage) and hamburgers in an itinerant fashion from a pushcart on a congested avenue in the city. She carries out this business every day from 5 in the afternoon until 5 in the morning. In addition, she travels to festivals where she stays for a few days selling her products. Her loan will be invested in potatoes, cooking oil, and disposable plates.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of potatoes, cooking oil, and disposable plates

loans.name: Luvina

texts.en:
Luvina P. is from the village of Mozzozzin Norte. She is 37 years old, married and has 7 school-aged children. Luvina owns & operates a business, manufacturing & selling clay products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Luvina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the third loan taken out by Luvina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
J. Batiste is a 36 year old man who is married with a three year old child.  He and his wife also take care of several orphans.  They have been able to purchase health insurance for the immediate family and orphans.  

J. Batiste is a farmer and owns a small shop.  His wife is also a farmer and they have been farming together for over six years.  With a loan, he plans to buy more food items and household goods to sell.  In addition, he will start buying crops from other farmers to sell in his store.  With the profits he hopes to buy domestic animals to raise.  He eventually wants to become self-sufficient and not have to depend on financing.  Before that point, he plans to pay off his loans and qualify for larger loans.

loans.use: Buying more food items and household goods to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Teko Pora Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Ursula A. quien  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Y actualmente se encuentra trabajando cada una en sus actividades muy contentas dentro del grupo.

La Sra. Úrsula A. Morel se dedica a la venta de dulces, invirtió el dinero en la compra de materia prima como azúcar frutas (naranjas, duraznos, frutillas) para la elaboración de dulces, logrando obtener mayor variedad de dulces para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella prepara los dulces de acuerdo a los pedidos que recibe de sus clientes que en su mayoría son negocios.
Comenta que mediante esta actividad puede ayudar para cubrir los gasto de la familia y por ello se siente muy satisfecha.
texts.en:
Mrs. Úrsula A. was the contact for the start of this committee; she invited and organized a group of her friends to become part of the Enterprising Women Committee’s program. Each member is currently working in her activity and very happy in the group. Mrs. Úrsula A. Morel sells sweets. She used the funds to buy raw materials like: sugar and fruits (oranges, peaches and strawberries) to make the sweets managing thereby to have a greater variety of sweets available for her customers. She makes the sweets according to prior orders from her customers which, for the most part, are businesses. She comments that through this activity she is able to cover family expenses and she feels very satisfied to be able to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oranges, peaches, strawberries, sugar and others.

loans.name: Nick Parsokonte

texts.en:
Nick Parsokonte P. is 27 years old. He is married to Mugeso P. and he is a father of two children. Nick is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last five years.

He learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend the thirty thousand to prepare land for planting wheat which has proved to be doing very well due to favorable climatic conditions. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to plough a bigger piece of land for farming to increase his wheat production. 

His future dream is that he will become a large-scale wheat farmer in his area. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for planting wheat

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: El Señor Máximo se dedica a la venta de accesorios de  vehículos desde hace dos años, anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar como chofer pero vio que con la venta de accesorios se gana igual y a veces mejor que trabajando de chofer, razón por la que cambio de rubro, su negocio esta ubicado al borde del rio Kora, donde los transportistas traen sus vehículos para el lavado de estos, momento que aprovecha para la venta de sus productos, vive con su hija quien es casada  y trabaja de manera independiente. El señor  esta muy agradecido con la institución por la confianza a brindada en la otorgación del  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Máximo has dedicated himself to the sale of car accessories since two years ago. Before that, he worked as a chauffeur but realized that he would earn the same selling car accessories, which was sometimes better than working as a chauffeur. That is why he changed careers. His business is located on the border of the Kora river, where the haulers bring their vehicles to be washed. He takes advantages of the time it takes to wash the vehicles by selling his products. He lives with his daughter who is married and works independently from him. Mr. Máximo is very thankful for the institution for the trust he is given as he is entrusted with the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for selling car accessories

loans.name: Zula

texts.en:
Zula S. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has three children, two of whom are in school.  She has a retail business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for three years and works seven days a week.  She sells her charcoal from home.

Zula has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  Her main business challenges include the rainy season and transportation of bags of charcoal from the market to her home.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only.

Zula lives in a home that she owns; she does not have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Jebdany

texts.es:
Jebdany H. B. es un joven de apenas 21 años de edad y el quiere pagarle los  estudios a su hermana y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre.
El vive en una comunidad llamada Hernández de Alajuela, se caracteriza principalmente por  su cercanía con el Rio San Juan.  Desde muy niño él trabaja con ganado y ahora que su padre no está el es el encargado de su madre y su hermana necesita  mejorar la calidad de su ganado, aumentando su para así venderlo a un mejor precio. Pero para lograrlo necesita un préstamo de ₡604 000 (seiscientos cuatro mil colones) para la compra de semilla de pasto  y para la mejora de su propiedad. 
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica
texts.en: Jebdany H. B. is barely 21-years-old. He wants to pay for his sister's school and give his mother a better quality of life. He lives in a community called Hernández de Alajuela, which is characterized by its proximity to the San Juan river. Since a young age he has worked with livestock and now that his father is no longer around he's in charge of taking care of his mother and sister. He needs to improve the quality of his cattle so that he can sell at a higher price. To achieve this he needs 604,000 Costa Rican Colones ($1,200) to buy pasture seed and make improvements to his property. He's a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo (United Credit Company for Development), one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: Purchase of pasture seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Aesenio

texts.es:
Arsenio es un padre de familia que reside junto a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos en el sector Nazareno Cautivo del distrito de Monsefú, una zona bastante conocida en el norte peruano por sus festividades turístico – religiosas, así como por la elaboración artesanal de artículos en base de arcilla, madera, junco y carrizo. Se encuentra ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace once años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores en su domicilio. El cría animales menores como ovejas y aves de corral en algunos ambientes ubicados cerca a su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un óptimo desarrollo son ofrecidos en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona y al público en general. El negocio se ha constituido como una fuente importante de ayuda para el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Arsenio desea adquirir alimento balanceado para conseguir que sus animales se desarrollen de mejor modo y sean vendidos a un mejor precio, asimismo desea realizar algunas mejoras en sus corrales, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Arsenio se caracteriza por ser una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien honrado y de confianza.
texts.en:
Arsenio is a family man who lives together with his wife and four children in the Nazareno Cautivo sector of Monsefú district.  This is an area in the north of Peru which is quite well known for its tourist and religious festivities, as well as for the the handicrafts which are made in the area from clay, wood,  rushes and reeds.  It is more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For eleven years, Arsenio has been in business raising and selling young animals from his home.  He raises young animals such as sheep and poultry in areas close to his house.  When they have reached an optimum level of development they are offered for sale to the tradesmen who usually visit the area and also to the general public.  His business has become an important source of help in financially supporting his family.

Arsenio would like to acquire balanced animal feed so that his animals develop in the best way possible and sell for the best price.  He would also like to carry out some improvements in his pens.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Arsenio is a quiet and responsible person.  People who know him consider him to be honest and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed to make improvements in his business raising and selling animals

loans.name: Emperatriz Elena

texts.es:
Emperatriz, resiD. en Santa Elena, departamento D. Usulután, se dedica a la crianza D. cerdos, ella es V. y tiene un hijo D. 36 años él es el que la ayuda con el trabajo, doña Emperatriz vive junto a su hijo y un nieto, comenzaron este negocio por iniciativa propia, no tienen horario D. trabajo, y en este momento están con la necesidad D. adquirir un préstamo para comprar cerdos D. engorD. por un tiempo D. 3 meses para luego venderlos.
Este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar el negocio y que al momento D. la venta pueda tener la oportunidad D. recibir buenas ganancias, Su objetivo es crecer el numero D. cerdos en la granja para estabilizarlo y tener solvencia económica para enfrentar cualquier gasto imprevisto.
texts.en:
Emperatriz lives in Santa Elena, Usulután department.  She raises pigs.  She’s a widow and has a 36 year old son who helps her with the work.  Emperatriz lives with her son and grandson.  They started the business on their own initiative.  They have no fixed work schedule.  They currently need a loan to buy pigs to raise for three months and then sell.

This loan will help the business grow because at the moment of selling the pigs good profits can be earned.  Her objective is to increase the number of pigs in the farm to stabilize it and have economic solvency to be able to face any unforeseen expense.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina tiene 58 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Para la señora Luz Marina este es su noveno ciclo. Tiene 58 años, es madre soltera y de una relación que tuvo tiene 2 hijos que son mayores de edad. Tiene su negocio ubicado en su vivienda, trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Es en el mercado es donde tiene que comprar los diferentes productos que son necesarios. Este crédito es para comprar golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, pan entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Luz Marina, 58, is a grocer.  This is her ninth cycle.  She is a single mother of two children who are now adults.

Her store is located in her dwelling.  She is open for business daily from 6am until 9pm.  She buys her stock items at the market.  She will use the loan to buy sweets, soft drinks, basic grains and bread, among others.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 32-year-old man. Amer is the father of one daughter and three sons. He rented a space less than one year ago to start a grocery store where he sells all food varieties and frozen meat. The store is located next to a school and in a good location in the city. Amer hopes to be able to sell fruits and vegetables soon when the store's returns increase.

Amer came to FATEN and took out a loan to purchase a large variety of goods. The picture of Amer here was taken in the store.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell in the store

loans.name: Ginazio

texts.en:
Ginazio is a 37-year-old married man with six children living in a semi-permanent house in Kibaale, Uganda, with a dream of educating his children up to university.

He has a business of trading in local brew, called waragi, and has been doing it for five years. He started by brewing local gin, then later started buying from other brewers. 

He faces a challenge of customers who default on payments, but in the future he hopes to expand his business to bigger markets. He wants the loan for buying alcohol for resale.

loans.use: To buy alcohol for resale

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda G. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old. Belinda is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Belinda makes and sells homemade sausage or longganisa in the local community. Belinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Belinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital. Belinda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed, like spices and pork. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Belinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed, like spices and pork

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Prum Rothana's Group

texts.en: This group loan is made up of four members located in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. Mrs. Prum R. is the group leader, selected by the other members. She was born in 1984, is married and is a meatball seller in the local village. She is asking for a loan to buy more meatballs to enlarge her business. Her husband, Mr. Phorn Thal, is a soldier. With their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. The couple has two children: one attends a local school while the youngest one is just three years old.

loans.use: To buy more meatballs

loans.name: Jared Obwaka

texts.en:
Jared Oketa is twenty-seven years old and lives in Marera, a surburb in Migori County, Western Kenya. Jared is married to Eunice, and they have three children.

Jared operates a motor garage in Marera area, a business he has been running for the last three years.  He makes a monthly income of Kshs 28,000.  This is his fourth loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy a stock of automobile spare parts for his garage business. He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan.

His dream is to open another garage to maximize his profits.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for autos.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 39 and is married with three children, who are aged two and 15. Odette’s husband is a state official, while Odette owns and operates a small business selling various styles of clothes from her home. Her business is well organised. She employs one person to help her and she has been running the business for three years, working from 8am until 5pm every day.
Odette has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing extra men's and women's clothes. This loan will allow her to attract more customers, which will help her earn more profit.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to expand her business

loans.name: Mwanamgeni

texts.en:
Mwanamgeni is a married woman with 3 children, 2 of whom still attend school. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has been selling fish at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanamgeni faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the dry hot season, the available fish supply is inadequate. While during the cold winter season, the available fish is enough for supply. Mwanamgeni dreams of expanding and selling as a wholesaler in the future.

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase 5 sacks of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 39 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Elvira has been in this business for nine years and she also earns additional income as a food vendor. Elvira is borrowing 13,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream – to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester S. 30 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have three children. All of the children are in school. 

Currently, she is in a business of selling fish and her goal is to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene  23 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de su madre en una comunidad  pequeña en una zona rural de Pimentel, primer balneario del norte del Perú. Cuenta con los servicios básicos como agua y luz ya que por ahora no cuenta con desagüe.

Esther se dedica a la venta de cerveza y comida en su localidad.  Esta actividad la viene desempeñando hace mas de 03 años en los que ha adquirido  experiencia en el rubro.  Esta actividad la desarrolla en la vivienda de su madre. Su negocio ha estado experimentando un crecimiento sostenido a lo largo del tiempo.

Esther esta solicitando un préstamo  Edpyme Alternativa de S/. 1,500.00 para  comprar más mobiliario consistente en mesas y sillas.  Esto le ayudará a brindarles a sus clientes, la mayoría que son agricultores en la zona, una mayor comodidad en sus instalaciones.

Esther es cliente anterior de Edpyme Alternativa y ya ha tenido un crédito KIVA el cual canceló de manera puntual y responsable.  Su negocio ha mostrado un crecimiento después de acceder a los créditos otorgados por Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Esther, age 23, is single and lives with her mother in a small community in the rural zone of Pimentel, the first health resort in the north of Peru.  It has basic utilities such as running water and electricity although no sewage system for now.

Esther sells beer and food in her town and works out of her mother's home.  She has been in business for over three years, gaining much experience and sustained growth over this period of time.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN to buy furniture such as tables and chairs.  This will allow her to give her customers, who are mostly farmers in the area, the most comfortable environment.

Esther, a former client of Edpyme Alternativa, took out a KIVA loan before which she paid back on time and responsibly.  Her business showed growth after receiving the loan through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is from the village of Santa Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lily owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products, including fish such as milk fish and sardines, in the local community. Lily has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Lily joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products such as sardines and mackerel. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Lily plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as sardines and mackerel

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
Víctor, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 21 y 17 años de edad, él se dedica a la siembra de maíz y a la albañilería, aprendió este negocio de su padre, y tiene aproximadamente 12 años de dedicarse a este oficio.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra, ya que necesita obreros que le ayuden a limpiar la tierra, este préstamo le ayudara a solventar los gastos de fertilizantes y pagar a sus mozos.
Su sueño es ayudar a que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, tengan una buena oportunidad de empleo para que se puedan superar.
texts.en:
Victor lives with his wife and two children (ages 21 and 17). He grows corn and works as a bricklayer, a trade he learned from his father. Victor has been in this business for approximately 12 years.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor. Victor needs workers to help him with clearing his land. This loan will help him cover the cost of the fertilizers and the wages to be paid to his young workers.

His dream is to help his children finish their studies so that they will have a good opportunity to secure employment that will enable them to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua cooks banku, made from corn dough and cassava dough, at Abura.  She is a widow and has seven dependents.  Her loan will be used to buy corn dough and cassava dough for her banku.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards buying some land.

loans.use: to buy corn dough and cassava dough.

loans.name: Marleni Vanessa

texts.es:
Marleni nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 39 años de edad. Actualmente, Marleni vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con sus dos hijos. Marleni se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo pollos. Ya son varios que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Marleni requiere el préstamo para comprar  más pollos. El sueño de Marleni abrir una tienda de venta de flores. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Juntas y Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Marleni is 39 years old and was born in the city of Cusco (Peru).  She currently lives in the same city in which she was born, together with her two children.  Marleni raises animals such as chickens.  She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  On this occasion, Marleni needs a loan to buy more chickens.  Her dream is to open a flower store.

Marleni is a responsible and hard-working person and, owing to these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's 'Juntas y Unidas' community bank.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Lebbo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 21 février 2001. Il est composé de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Siré Abdou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 71 ans. Elle est mariée sans enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge trois autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de poisson sec. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (nourriture etc.…)
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on February 21, 2001.  It is composed of eleven women who live in the same neighborhood.  They are principally engaged in small businesses.

Mrs.  Siré Abdou, at the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the leader of the group.  She is 71 years old.  She is married and has no children.  She cares for three children entrusted to her by their parents.

She keeps busy selling dried fish.  She has a lot of experience in this field, as she has been doing it for several years.

This loan will enable her to build up her capital and to develop her business.  The profits will aloow her to improve the family’s living conditions (food, etc.)

loans.use: To buy dried fish

loans.name: Vincent Claude

texts.fr:
Client de  49 ans, celibataire avec 2 enfants a sa charge dont l’age varie entre 11 et 14 ans n’ayant pas pu faire des longues etudes , il arrete ses cours en  classe de seconde, et il fait des petits metiers durant plusieurs annees , apres quelques epargnes, il se lance en 2005 dans le commerce de la friperie.

Il achete des  pantalons en jeans, des jupes, pulls, tous ce dont ses clients  adorent, ses ventes sont en moyenne de 10000 a 20000 frs par jour.
A l’octroi de son prêt , il va s’approvisionner dans les magasins sur place en ville et acheter des ballots de pulls over , des survetements, des marinieres  et tous ce dont les clients aiment acheter.
Il a des strategies tres efficace, des qu’il achete un nouveau ballot d’habits, il appelle ses clients par telephone et  propose des prix abordables,

Tres discret, il a une grande et bonne  influence dans sa famille et son environnement, ayant déjà une grande charge, il prend soin de sa famille et assure la scolarite de ses enfants.
texts.en:
A 49-year-old client and single father of two children ages 11 and 14, he was not able to attend school for very long.  He dropped out at the 10th grade level, and did odd jobs for several years.  In 2005, after saving up, he got into secondhand clothing sales.

He purchases jeans, skirts, sweaters, everything that his clients love.  He averages between 10,000 and 20,000 Congolese francs in sales per day.

When his loan is disbursed, he will build his inventory from local stores, purchasing bales of sweaters, outerwear, long-sleeved shirts and everything that his clients like to buy.  He has very effective sales strategies; when he purchases a new bale of clothing, he calls up his customers on the phone and offers them affordable prices.

His good judgment gives him a wide-reaching and positive influence within his family and his area.  Already carrying lots of responsibilities, he also takes care of his family and makes sure his children attend school.

loans.use: to purchase bales of long-sleeved shirts, baby suits, skirts and sweaters

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is an ambitious and dedicated 26-year-old businessman. He is married and expecting a baby. He has been operating a general shop to meet the needs of his family. He wants, in the next five years, to have grown his business into a wholesale one so he is able to realize his dream of being financially independent. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, salt and soap. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to make wise investments and plan for his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, salt and soap.

loans.name: Fayia

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Fayia.  He is a widower, and has 1 child, aged 10.  He has no additional dependents. In 2006, Fayia established his soft drinks and mobile phone top-up voucher business. He began his business because he wanted to be self employed and get a reliable source of income to provide livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000.  Fayia needs a loan in order to buy cartons of beer, stout and mobile phone top-up vouchers. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000.  In the future, Fayia plans to give his child a quality education and build a house.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of beer and stout and mobile phone top-up vouchers for his business

loans.name: Mbolea Group

texts.en:
Gideon is the facilitator for Mbolea Group.  He and his group members joined One Acre Fund in 2010. Gideon joined One Acre Fund in order to access good input prices, grow enough to feed his family, have profits for school fees, and have inputs delivered right to his village market. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Gideon and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

In 2011, Gideon harvested 8 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.  He describes his harvest as excellent.  Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Gideon was harvesting 6 bags on 1/2 an acre.  

With the profits from his harvest, Gideon plans on paying school fees, repairing his home, saving for the future, investing in livestock and perhaps investing in a business.  

In 2012, Mbolea group will receive input loans for 9.5 acres of land.  Each farmer will plant between 1/2 and 1 1/2 acres.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Maria Marina

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella administra el negocio D. tortillas como un medio para recibir ganancias, al preparar la venta sale a ofrecerlas D. forma ambulante.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. leña y tiene la necesidad D. dos puertas para su casa, con la inversión le servirá una parte para comprar el material para la preparación D. las tortillas y otra para mejorar la vivienda.
Su aspiración es mejorar la vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos, continuando en el negocio y buscando alternativas para crecer.
texts.en:
María sells tortillas.  She lives with her husband and their three children.  She runs the tortilla business as a way of getting income.  When she is ready to sell she leaves to sell the tortillas in an itinerant manner.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy wood.  She needs two doors for her house.  She will use part of the loan to buy materials to make tortillas, and she will use the other part to improve her house.

Her goals are to improve her house, to support her children, to continue in the business, and to look for alternatives for growth.

loans.use: to buy wood for two doors for her house.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is married and blessed with two children. For the last 10 years, he has been selling polythene bags to earn a living. He has improved his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills. He has requested 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy more polythene bags for resale.

loans.use: To buy more polythene bags

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz Albina tiene 19 años, convive con su esposo hace 5 años, ambos tienen 2 hijos, uno de 4 y otro de 1 año de edad. Vive a demás con su hermana de 12 años de quien también cuida en su casa propia. Ella y su familia se dedican a la agricultura, sembrando piñas y plantaciones de café en las 4 parcelas que son de su propiedad. Además de otros productos de consumo personal como la yuca. Luz  después de las labores en el campo se encarga de arreglar su casa, preparar sus alimentos y atender a sus pequeños hijos, con la ayuda de su hermana; mientras su esposo continúa en la siembra y cultivo. “El cultivo de piñas es un poco complicado, por las espinas que rodean el fruto, pero aún así queremos seguir”, comenta Luz. Asimismo menciona que, por falta de la “inducción” (proceso en el cultivo de piñas que mediante abono, mejora su producción en cuanto a calidad y cantidad), la cosecha no tuvo buenos ingresos. Luz, después de esa experiencia espera que la suerte le sonría con obtención de buenos frutos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con MFP y un banco comunal, así que se muestra decida en sus convicciones por el respaldo de la entidad y compañeros. Comprará con el préstamo sacos de abono y fertilizantes para el proceso de “inducción” en sus plantaciones de piñas, que calcula costará 180 soles el costal.
texts.en:
Luz Albina, 19, has lived with her husband for the last five years; they have two children, a four-year-old and a one-year-old.  She also lives with her 12-year-old sister who she also cares for in at home.  She and her family farm; they grow pineapples and coffee on four parcels they own and also grow other products, like manioc, for their personal consumption.  

After Luz finishes with the field chores she tidies up her house, prepares the meals and tends to her small children with help from her sister while her husband continues with the planting and farming.  “Pineapple farming is a bit complicated because of the spines that surround the fruit but even so, we want to continue,” Luz comments.  She also mentions that because of the lack of “inducción” (a process in pineapple growing whereby the use of manure improves production both in quality and quantity) the crops did not produce good income.  After that experience, Luz hopes that luck will smile upon her and harvests will be better.

This is the first time she works with MFP and a communal bank and she’s committed to her goals thanks to the support she has from the institution and from her fellow members.  She will use the loan to buy sacks of manure and fertilizer for the “inducción” process in her pineapple plants that she calculates will cost 180 soles per sack.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 49 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

She has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her store for 24 years and also earns an income from fish vending. Mila aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 45 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. She is married with two children. 

Marcelina has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 1,200 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock for her retail store.
 
Marcelina has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her retail store

loans.name: 030202-Tây Hải-Hoằng Thanh Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tuyết works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and to sell in the future.

Tuyết is 42 years old and she is married, with 2 children.  She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 030202-Tây Hải-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group.  She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2007, Tuyết joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tuyết has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tuyết has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.  With her business profit, Tuyết hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy land of her own, and to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband, who is a scrap dealer. He purchases scrap from different factories at low rates and sells it at a profitable price to different clients and also to other scrap dealers.

Rani's husband is very good in his dealings with customers and his customers trust his good quality services.  Due to his good nature and professional business dealings, he receives a good number of orders every month.

Rani is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients.  She is very skilful and receives regular orders which earns her a reasonable income and helps her pay her utility bills.

She has given birth to five sons. Her eldest son is studying in the second class while the others are illiterate.

Rani has a lot of confidence in her husband and she is very sure that a loan investment will be a productive one for him and will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy scrap for her husband's scrap selling business.

loans.name: Randoll Harrison

texts.es: El señor Randoll es un joven de 21 años de edad a quien le gusta cantar música hip hop e integra esta actividad con su propio puesto a la salida de un colegio en el cual vende todo tipo de variedades tales como accesorios femeninos, papelería, entre otros artículos. El señor Randoll desea salir adelante y emprender sus estudios de música, para lo cual requiere de la compra de mercancía que le permita surtir su negocio para la temporada de fin de año y de esta manera además poder aumentar sus ventas, mejorar su calidad de vida y alcanzar su sueño de ser un gran cantante y tener su propio almacén de variedades.
texts.en: Sr. Randoll is a young man who is 21 years of age and likes to sing hip hop music while he manages his own vending post outside of a school where he sells all types of merchandise such as women’s accessories, stationery, and other items.  He wants to succeed and begin his music studies, but he needs to buy merchandise so that he can restock his business for the year-end season in order to increase his sales, improve his quality of life, and pursue his dream of becoming a famous singer.  Randoll also wants to own a variety store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell during the year-end season.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 year old a married woman with three children.  Two of them are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yambio South Sudan for one year.
Grace is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es: La señor Fausto es un cliente  distinguido de la  institución , ya  que a lo largo  de  sus  créditos se a  caracterizado  por  tener  una  excelente  cultura  de pagos,  es  por  ello  que   nuevamente   acudió  con    nosotros  para   la  culminar su proyecto, el cual  consiste  en  realizar  la  impermeabilización de su  vivienda, la cual  gracias  a su  esfuerzo  diario a  ido  acondicionando,  ve  en  el  crédito  la  posibilidad  de  brindar  a  sus  familiares  y  amigos  una  mayor  comodidad, es por  eso que  se  encuentra  muy contento  de  habernos  encontrado.
texts.en: Fausto is a distinguished client of our institution because, throughout the time he has been receiving loans, he has maintained an excellent repayment record.  He has come to us again to request help in completing his project of waterproofing his home which, thanks to his daily efforts, he has been making progress with.  Fausto sees in these loans the possibility of providing his family members and friends with greater comfort.  For this reason, he is very happy to have found us.

loans.use: to waterproof a concrete floor

loans.name: Jingle

texts.en:
Jingle is a housewife who lives at CApatan with her spouse and two young children. Jingle's spouse provide motorcycle transport services as his source of income while Jingle is raising hogs to re-sell fro profits. Together, they work hand in hand in order to amke their businesses profitable. Jingle had an insufficinet to sustain her hogs so she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy vaccines and hog feed. This will help ensure good growth of her hogs. 

Despite poverty, the couple still aims that someday, they will earn enough funds to provide a good education for their children.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and hog feed

loans.name: Magdlene  Tapia

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Magdalene. She is married and has two children aged 26 and 20. She has two neices who are additional dependents. 

In 1984, Magdalene established her building materials business. She began her business just after completing high school when she lost her dad and she didn't have a sponsor to continue her education. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 Leone (SLL) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Magdalene requires a loan in order to buy 60 PVC pipes, each costing 70,000 SLL; the balance is for transportation. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 800,000 SLL. In the future, Magdalene is excited for the loan and she is hoping to see her children educated to the university level. She is honest and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy PVC pipe and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther  is 63 years old and has 6 children. She has been a farmer for more than 40 years and is always said to be a very resourceful person. Even though Esther  is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Esther  started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills.

Esther ’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights."

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 53 years old a widow with 5 children. Two are in a local technical college and one in High School.

Jane has been in farming for 28 years and it’s from farming that she has been able to educate her children. She has 400 trees of coffee on a three-hectare piece of land and 2 Dairy cows, which in aggregate brings a net income of USD100 per month.

loans.use: She wants to replace in phases her current dairy cows which on average produce 8 litters of milk per day with hybrid cows that can give 15 litres per day.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva has a freezer from which she sells juices, soft drinks and beer. She started her business two years ago. Her husband motivated her and loaned her the capital to start selling beverages. Since the business is right in her house, she tends to it from 8 am until 11 pm every day.

She needs the loan in order to buy soft drinks and juices; she would like to expand her inventory to include sweets for children.

Eva was born in Guayaquil. She is 37 years old with 2 children. Her husband works as a soldier. He encouraged her to work. She has had to work since she was a little girl and she has not stopped up till today. They are humble and hardworking people with dreams of getting ahead. With their savings and a lot of effort they have succeeded in owning their own home, a cane house that they are remodeling with cement, little by little. Their dream is to strengthen Eva's business because it is something secure for them.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Eva tiene un congelador donde vende: jugos, colas y cervezas. Comenzó desde hace 2 años. Su esposo la motivo y le prestó algo de capital para que se ponga a vender. Como el negocio esta en su casa lo atiende todos los días de 8:00AM a 11:00PM.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar: colas, jugos y desea incorporar golosinas para niños.

Eva nació en Guayaquil. Tiene 37 años. Con 2 hijos. Su esposo trabaja como soldador. Él la motivo a su esposa para que trabaje. Eva tuvo que trabajar desde niña y no dejado de hacerlo hasta ahora. Ellos son personas humildes y trabajadoras deseosas de salir adelante. Con sus ahorros y mucho esfuerzo han logrado tener su casa que es de caña y poco a poco la están remodelando a cemento. Su ilusión es fortalecer el negocio de Eva porque es algo seguro.

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, juices, and sweets for children

loans.name: Wahida

texts.en:
Wahida, 22 is the daughter of Sardar M. and lives in District 8 of Kabul City. She is a high school graduate, but due to financial problems she wasn't able to attend University. She is single and is willing to help her family overcome financial problems. She shares a business with her father who has a chicken meat cart in one of the markets of Kabul City. Her father started the business with limited resources and little meat and it was hardly possible for him to keep his business going.

Then Wahida heard about the AFSG loan process and she decided to start taking loans for her father's business. She started with the first cycle through which she bought more meat for her father and their business improved by the time she took her 3rd cycle. She is now at her 4th cycle and is happy with the loan process.

loans.use: Buying Chicken Meat

loans.name: Amiraslan

texts.en: Amiraslan N. is 27 and owns a small sheep herd in Saatli. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorniy Karabakh, which he left in 1993. He has a very small farm, and it is not effective to run such a small farm. So Amiraslan is going to extend his farm by purchasing a cow. His farm has sufficient land to provide food for the animal. He has applied for a loan of $1,000 USD from Aqroinvest CU, to buy one cow.

loans.use: To purchase one cow

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Mrs. Martha P. has a store she opened seven years ago with money thanks to the traveling sales of candy [a confectioner's shop]. Her husband helps in her shop and little by little her profits have risen.

She needs to purchase more merchandise and to fully stock her store as the area where the store is located is very commercial.

She is 43 years old and has two sons, one of whom studies in a nearby establishment. Her home is made of rods and her dream is to expand her store each and every day.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Martha tiene una tienda que empezó hace siete años con un capital gracias a la venta de confitería ambulante en su negocio le ayuda su esposo y últimamente también ha incrementado con un pequeño comedor sus ganancias

Uso del Préstamo

Necesita comprar mas mercadería y de esta manera tener surtida su tienda ya que el lugar donde esta ubicada es muy comercial

Información Personal

Tiene 43 años y dos hijos uno de ellos estudia en un establecimiento cercano, su vivienda es de caña y su meta es ampliar su tienda cada dia mas

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
How can I tell you about Samuel in such a short space? This wonderful, hard-working petite, 58-year old man who raises over 600 hens in a two story hen house in his backyard just glows with a sense of caring and compassion gained from a lifetime of hard work. He has raised six children and cares for two dependents.

He only has layers (egg-laying hens) now, because the price of broilers went down about five months ago. He buys the chicks when they are one day old and keeps them warm with charcoal heat. After four and a half months the chicks are grown, and they start laying eggs.

His hens are just starting to lay eggs. When in full production, he hopes his 600 hens will lay about 450 eggs per day. He will use his loan to buy more chicken feed to keep his hens healthy and laying. Samuel dreams of adding another building and expanding the number of hens in his hen farm. (If you would like to learn more about this lending group, please visit the Kiva Fellows Blog: Alinyikira: “Continue Hard Work”)

loans.use: Samuel will buy more chicken feed

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn C. married in 1989. She has four children, three sons and one daughter. She has been in the business of purchasing and reselling longan fruit since 2003. In addition, she grows food crops. Her husband is a construction worker. He sometimes goes far from home. The elder two children are attending primary school and the other two are still at home. Mrs. C. hopes to expand her business so they can afford for their children to pursue higher education.

Mrs. C. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time; she hopes to receive US$ 1,000. She will use some of that amount to buy longan on contract to resell in the market in the city. The rest of the money will be used to change her motorbike so that she can better carry the longan to the market.

loans.use: Buying longan fruit on contract to resell in the market in the city and changing the motorbike she uses to transport the fruit

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice C. is a 27 year old married mother of 3 (ages 10, 6, and 3) who operates a charcoal business. She wants to expand the sell the charcoal business and use the loan with the proceeds of the charcoal sales to open a clothes selling business.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To expand her charcoal business and start a new business

loans.name: Eustochia

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Eustochia Michaeli. She is married with three children, aged 4, 9, and 13, and has one other dependent, who is her nephew. In 2005 Eustochia established a clothing business, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
Rano M.lives in the Khurson region. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 children. She makes her living buying and selling livestock. Rano purchases sheep and goats, fattens them for 40-45 days and then sells them at the same market for a higher price. Fattened animals can be sold for a higher price since they most commonly are used for their meat. This business allows Rano to support her family. Her business also contributes to the development of agriculture in her region and allows the locals to purchase fresh meat at reasonable prices. Rano is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Меликова Рано проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 42 года , замужем имеет 3 детей.Занимается купле продажей мелко рогатого скота.Покупает овец и коз на рынке ,затем откармливает около 40-45 дней, после чего реализует на тех же рынках по более высокой цене.. Откормленные животные стоят дороже , так как чаще всего их используют на мясо. Это позволяет клиентке обеспечивать свою семью, а так же этот бизнес способствует развитию животноводческого сектора, что помогает населению покупать свежее мясо по доступным ценам. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of goats and sheep

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abass dropped out of school at the age of 18. He learned how to drive and gained employment as the driver of a passenger taxi. After 10 years, he had saved enough money to buy his own minibus for hire.

Abass has been working tirelessly to save enough money to purchase a second vehicle for his minibus taxi business. With a loan from Kiva to match his savings, he will be able to purchase his second minibus and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a second minibus and expand a taxi business

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Christina N., who is married and has two children, aged 5 and 10. Christina established her clothing and cosmetics business in 2005. Working six days a week, and eight hours a day, she earns about $40 every month from this business. Christina has already received and repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to expand her range of clothing and cosmetics. In the future, Christina plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Soro

texts.ru:
Soro Faizalievna S. lives in Fayzabad. She is 26. She lives with her family. She is married and has 2 children. She has been selling vegetables and fruit for two years. She has a shop in the area’s central market. She wants to increase her sales volume by taking out a loan. It will help her make her business more profitable as well as help provide the population with fresh vegetables. She plans to pay off the debt in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer

Сатторова Соро Файзалиевна жительница района Файзабад. Возраст 26 лет. Живет со своей семьей. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Два года занимается торговлей овощей и фруктов. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке района. Хочет увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита. Он поможет ей увеличить прибыльность бизнеса , а так же поможет обеспечить население свежими овощами. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales volume

loans.name: Nadège Diane

texts.fr:
Born around 1975 in Cotonou in the south of Benin, Mrs. Diane Nadège O. is the mother of 3 children, all of whom are enrolled in school and for whom she is solely responsible, as she is divorced from her husband. She is involved not only in selling fruit which she provides wholesale to women who retail it, but also in the sale of various items and of liquors. She is requesting her third loan to bolster her capital for liquors.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1975 à Cotonou au sud du BENIN, dame O. Nadège Diane est mère de 3 enfants tous scolarisés et dont la charge lui revient entièrement car ayant divorcée d'avec son mari. Elle intervient non seulement dans le commerce des fruits qu'elle livre en gros aux femmes qui les revendent en détail, mais aussi dans la commercialisation de divers articles et des liqueurs. Elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour renforcer son capital de liqueurs.

loans.use:
Purchase of 20 cases of liquor

Achat de 20 cartons de liqueur.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap R. is a dessert seller in Kork Village in Kampong Chhanng Province. Previously, Mrs. Sopheap R. had obtained a loan to start her current business, and she has fully paid it back. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Sopheap R. decided to ask for a loan to buy beans and white sugar in order to make a delicious dessert for her customers. She is a 42-year-old widow with three children who are all attending school.

loans.use: To buy bean and white sugar in order to make a delicious dessert for her customers.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 22, 20 and 18 years old. She has been a firewood and coconut seller since 1988. She works every day from 6 am to 8 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Mwanaidi now hopes for a loan to buy more firewood and coconuts for her business.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Baby

texts.fr: Baby D. est âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de légumes à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle et augmenter la capacité de son commerce, Baby désire avec ce crédit, acheter des légumes auprès des jardiniers pour la revente. Cette chance lui permettra d’intervenir dans la prise en charge des dépenses du foyer.
texts.en:
Baby D., 48, is married and the mother of 5 children. She sells vegetables in Adeta, a village situated about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. In order to better respond to the demand from her clientele and expand the capacity of her business, Baby wants to use this loan to buy vegetables from market gardeners for re-sale. This will allow her to start paying expenses for her household.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying vegetables

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
Doña Melania tiene 41 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, su esposo trabaja de albañil y tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad que esta cursando la primaria. El negocio de la Sra. Melania es la venta de ropa, con seis años de experiencia, e inició con fondos propios y con ayuda de su esposo
Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para hacer mejoras en su vivienda en la reparación del techo para lo cual va a comprar láminas de zinc, y materiales de construcción. A largo plazo es incrementar su inventario, captar más clientes y poder ofrecer variedad a sus clientes, seguir haciendo mejoras en su casa, y apoyar a su hijo con los estudios
texts.en:
Melania is 41 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. Her husband is a bricklayer and she has a 12-year-old son in elementary school. Melania has had a business selling clothing for the past six years. She started her business with her own money and with help from her husband. Melania plans to use the requested loan to make improvements to her house, including roof repair. To do this, she will purchase zinc sheeting and construction materials. Over the long term the loan will be used to increase her inventory, attract more clients, be able to offer a variety of products to her clients, continue making improvements to her house, and support her son's studies.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace roof of her house

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos tiene 38 años, es soltero y vive en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. Se dedica a  la construcción de muebles en su taller de carpintería desde hace ya 20 años, negocio por el que optó gracias a las habilidades que descubrió desde muy joven en este campo, que siempre le gustó. Al ser soltero trabaja mucho por su futuro, para conformar una familia y poder brindarles lo mejor, lo bueno de su negocio es que es muy solicitado por la clientela que ya conoce su trabajo. Lo más difícil es el esfuerzo físico que amerita, terminado agotado al final del día. Este es su primer préstamo en Micro finanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero adquirirá madera para elaborar sus muebles y aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
38-year old Marcos is single and lives in the house that was left to him by his parents. He has been working as a carpenter, making furniture in his workshop, for the last 20 years. He chose this line of work based on the skills that he realised he possessed when he was a young man. He has always enjoyed his work. Because he is a bachelor, he is always looking towards the future so that he can have a family one day and be able to offer them a good standard of living.
