The best thing about his business is that his work is very sought after by his customers. The most difficult thing is the physical strength that it requires—by the end of the day Marcos is exhausted. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he plans to be very punctual with his payments. With the money he will buy wood to make furniture and increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Mrs. Hen H. is a villager in Ty Buon village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She sells bamboo. Her husband, Mr. You Me, uses a horse with a cart to transport passengers. Even though they have different businesses, they still earn insufficient income to provide a better life for their family.

In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Hen H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to be a motorbike taxi driver. She is 35 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the younger one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to be a motorbike taxi driver

loans.name: Cruz Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Cruz del Carmen D. originaria de Chichigalpa, se ha destacado por dedicarse a la actividad de crianza y destace de cerdos para la venta de la carne. Desde que inició esta actividad desde hace 16 años, ha logrado salir adelante proporcionando mejores condiciones en su vivienda y a la vez ha apoyado a sus dos hijos en edad escolar.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel parar ser beneficiada con un crédito para ser utilizado en la compra de cerdos para su respectiva crianza, destace y venta de la carne. Con el crédito que le sea proporcionado se beneficiará grandemente y logrará salir adelante en su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Señora Cruz del Carmen D. originates from Chichigalpa. She has distinguished herself by being dedicated to the activity of breeding and butchering pigs in order to sell the meat. Since she began this activity sixteen years ago, she has managed to do well in in improving her living conditions, and at the same time supported her two school-aged children. Today, she has come to Ceprodel, an affiliate of Kiva, in order to be the beneficiary of a loan with which to purchase pigs for their respective breeding, butchery, and sale. With the loan that is provided, she will benefit greatly and will manage to do well in her economic activity.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de cerdos

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria G. esta casada con el Sr. Clotilde hace 40 años, el matrimonio posee 2 hijos mayores de edad ya casados.

Ella es docente jubilada y posee su negocio de venta de artesanías hace 4 años.

 Se dedica a la venta de productos artesanales como ser: hamacas, jarrones, macetas, floreros de barro y varias otras  producciones artesanales tradicionales.

Comenta que en el negocio la venta es muy buena y que necesita de un préstamo para compra de mayor número de mercaderías debido a la demanda que tiene de las mismas.
texts.en:
Maria G. has been married to her husband Clotilde for 40 years and they have two children who are grown up and married. She is a retired teacher and has had her business selling crafts for four years. She makes a living selling artisan work such as hammocks, vases, flowerpots, clay pots and other traditional crafts. She says that her sales are very good and she needs a loan to purchase a larger supply of merchandise due to the demand it is receiving.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase craftwork

loans.name: Mrs. Sambin Chhim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, consisting of thirteen members, is located in Smeth village in Kampong Chhnang province. The members plan to use the loans they have obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Sambin C. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is a farmer wH. owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. She does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to grow, S. she is requesting a loan to purchase rice seeds to cultivate on the field to earn her living. Mrs. Sambin C. is a 58-year-old widow with a child wH. works as a jeweler.

Six members in this group loans have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Such loans allows borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to purchase rice seed to cultivate on the field to earn for living.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
A. Bakhtiyor is from Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He has been working for the past five years in agriculture and cattle. He is well known as a small producer in his community. His young son is the motivation for his many efforts and the reason why he is always looking for ways to work hard and get ahead.

He has applied to IMON International with the goal of obtaining a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crop. Bakhtiyor hopes the loan will allow him to increase his yield above and beyond what it was in previous years. As for his future plan, he wants all of his children to go to university and to get good jobs. You can be an important part of the growth of Bakhtiyor’s business.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en: Antonieta M. of Sebaste, Antique has been an active member of ASHI(Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) for one year. She has five children, four have graduated college and presently all are employed. One of her children still lives at home. She joined ASHI not only for loans but for pleasure since every week the group meets at their center meeting. She wants to be involved in the community in order  to get out of the house and not be bored. She applied for a loan to buy pigs and raise capital for fish vending. She wants to venture in this business to save money for an operation on her chin.  She hopes that in the future she could have a sewing machine to practice her sewing ability, and dreams to have a beautiful house.

loans.use: To buy pigs and fish for resale.

loans.name: Dorjpalam

texts.en:
Dorjpalam B. is 44, married, and the father of three. He has one son who is a 19-year-old university student. His two daughters go to elementary school. Dorjpalam's family lives in a "ger" (nomadic Mongolian tent) district in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces.

In 2006, together with his spouse Bulgantamir, he started running a family business selling dairy products by going door to door. Then in 2008, they rented a food stall at the local food market "Terh" that sells products such as flour, rice, and a variety of vegetables. His wife works as a saleswoman at their stall while Dorjpalam buys and picks the goods. His working capital is 3.0 million tugrugs. He is a friendly and kind person.

Dorjpalam requests a loan to buy more food products to increase his inventory. His hope is to have his own grocery store. In the picture: Bulgantamir, Dorjpalam's wife, is at their food stall.

loans.use: To buy more food products to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Munhbazar

texts.en:
Munhbazar A. is 45, married and the father of one child. His family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2004, Munhbazar started working as a self-employed taxi driver. After two years, he started working at a local spare parts market as a salesman. His monthly salary is 200,000 tugrugs ($1 USD=1,400 tugrugs) and is not enough to cover his family's needs.

Munhbazar runs a retail business as well as working as a salesman. He buys car batteries and tries to resell them for a better price. His average monthly income from car batteries is 600,000 tugrugs. With this loan, he would like to buy more car batteries to increase his business inventory and monthly income. Munhbazar's dream is to have his own stall to sell spare parts.

loans.use: To buy car batteries

loans.name: Rhina Esther

texts.es:
RHINA ESTHER E. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LORETO” con domicilio en el Jr. COMANDANTE SUARES N° 398 del distrito de Callería, tiene 47 años y 02 hijos que son independientes.

La señora vende parrilladas (carne a la parilla) todos los domingos en la vereda de su casa, desde hace buen tiempo el motor de su moto taxi viene funcionando mal lo que la obliga a hacer un nuevo préstamo.
Su primer prèstamo fue de S/. 300.00 que le ayudo a  comprar un nuevo motor.

Actualmente se dedica a administrar su mototaxi y con el préstamo  de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en la compra de un motor para un moto taxi, y además va a comprar un nuevo moto taxi que pagara en cuotas.

En el poco tiempo que esta trabajando con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rhina Esther E. A. belongs to the "Loreto" Communal Bank. She lives in the district of Callería, is 47 years old, and has two independent children. She sells grilled meats every Sunday on the path in front of her house. A while ago the engine of her motorcycle taxi began malfunctioning, so she sought a loan. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which helped her to buy a new engine. Now she is running her motorcycle taxi business, and with this loan of 2,000 soles, she will invest in another engine as well as another motorcycle, which she will repay in installments. In the short time she has worked with Manuela Ramos, she has been happy with the support it gives women so they may succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an engine and a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Née en 1960, Mme Ami Z. est marié et a en charge sept (07) personnes. Elle a pour activité principale l’achat, la préparation et la vente de haricot dans un petit marché de la place. Afin de pérenniser son commerce et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires, elle sollicite un financement pour stocker du haricot, du charbon  de bois, de la farine et de l’huile. Les profits réalisés l’aideront ainsi à l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1960, Mrs. Ami Z. is married and has seven people in her care. As her main business, she buys, prepares, and sells beans at a small local market. In order to make her business run year-round and to increase her sales, she is seeking a loan to stock beans, charcoal, flour, and oil. The profit from her business will thus help in the development of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare and sell beans

loans.name: Cristo Redentor #5 Group

texts.en:
Francisca C. was unemployed and struggling to make ends meet until she heard of Esperanza. She borrowed 5,000 Dominican pesos from Esperanza (~140 US dollars) to fund her jean-selling business. She sells women's and men’s pants in her community as well as other nearby communities. She says that her business is just taking off and that is why she is back for her second loan, now borrowing 7,000 Dominican pesos, the equivalent of ~200 US dollars.

Francisca is the young mother of three children, ages 7, 5, and 2 years old. She lives in Victorina, a batey (company town where sugar workers live) belonging to De la Llanos, Dominican Republic. This particular batey does not have the typical bare look after the sugar cane season has passed. Victorina is filled with many mango trees and green hills, yet the beautiful landscape doesn’t reflect the hard life of its inhabitants. When sugar cane season has passed, so has the employment and because many live day to day, when employment ceases the quality of life declines.

Francisca maintains a positive outlook on life and hopes that her business will continue to grow. Please don’t hesitate to help Francisca and her group become successful entrepreneurs in their community. Thank you.

loans.use: To purchase women's and men's pants

loans.name: Lhane

texts.en:
Lhane D. R. owns and manages a welding shop. She earns a good income from this business. Her husband, Melchor D. R., is the welder. Her role is to make sure that they have served their customers well so that they will keep coming back every time they have something to weld.

Now, she is requesting additional capital of PHP 16,000. She wants a loan from Community Economic Ventures because of its very interesting credit services. 

CEVI is reaching more people to sustain their livelihood. Lhane receives the loan, training and insurance coverage with CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the welding shop.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 35 years old. She is married to Jerry B., who is a soldier. They both work hard to maintain their farming business. They are blessed with five children, four of whom are in school. Their youngest  child is only one year old. 

Mary Jane maintains a hog-raising business. The business enables her to earn a good profit that is really beneficial in providing the education of her children, especially those in college. 

She is now requesting a loan of  PHP 22,000 from Kiva lenders.  She prays that lenders will entrust her with the amount she needs to maintain and, eventually, develop her business. She wishes the best for her family and gives her full support to her husband who works very hard for their children to have a better future.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a mother of six children. She is 30 years of age and is married to Alexis. Evelyn and Alexis's children range in age from two to 15 years old. Four of them go to school: the eldest and the second child are in high school.

Evelyn and her husband's source of income since last year is livestock raising. They had pig for hog fattening (pig raising), and ducks and chickens for a poultry-raising business. Evelyn realized that profit with these kinds of businesses is double as much as the capital thus she decided to join ASHI which opened a year ago in their town, to apply for a loan to be used in financing her poultry-raising.

Evelyn is so happy to have the opportunity of getting a loan because she really dreamed of strengthening her businesses and being able to get bigger profit. Profits she will be making out of the business financed by her loan will be used to send all of her children to school until college and for all of them to have better life in the future.

loans.use: To finance her duck- and chicken-raising business

loans.name: Liliana Yiovana

texts.es:
La señora LILIANA YIOVANA R. B., tiene 39 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA , provincia de TRUJILLO, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EN ACCION.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, refiere que quiso estudiarla carrera de enfermería pero que sus padres no la apoyaron por falta de recurso económicos y por eso también tuvo que dedicarse al campo.
LILIANA es casada , tiene 1 hijos de 1 año de edad.
LILIANA se dedica a la venta de pollo, tiene  5 años viviendo en Trujillo, nos cuenta que ella vivía en Cajamarca y tenía una tienda de productos alimenticios al por  mayor pero cuando junto a su esposo realizó un viaje a Chepen a comprar arroz al por mayor le robaron toda su tienda, fue difícil para ella perder todo y por eso decidió venir junto con su esposo a Trujillo y empezar de  nuevo por ese motivo se encuentra vendiendo pollo en un mercado cerca a su casa.
El primer crédito de 200 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra  de pollos, una mesa y cuchillos.
Este crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar más pollos y criarlos, y también comprará pollos para vender.
LILIANA sueña con  tener un atienda de productos alimenticios como la que tuvo antes.
texts.en:
Liliana Yiovana Rodríguez B. is 39, and she lives in the La Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertabd department, Perú. She belongs to the Mujeres en Accion Communal Bank. This business woman went to school until her fifth year of high school. She wanted to study for a career in nursing, but her parents did not support her because of lack of economic resources. Therefore, she had to work the land. Liliana is married and has a one year old child. Liliana sells chicken. She has lived in Trujillo for five years. She used to live in Cajamarca, and she had a wholesale food store there. When she and her husband traveled to Chepen to buy wholesale rice, her store was robbed. It was difficult for her to lose everything. She decided to come to Trujillo with her husband and start again. That is why you will find her selling chicken in the market near her house. She used her first loan for 200 PEN to buy chicken, a table, and knives. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy more chickens to raise. She will also buy chickens to sell. Liliana dreams of having a food store like she had before.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens to raise

loans.name: Georgia

texts.es:
La señora Georgia tiene 49 años, está casada con el señor Sidonio B., la pareja tiene 3 hijos.
Doña Georgia emprendió su pequeño negocio en el año 1999, vendiendo bebidas, luego fue ahorrando y con la ayuda económica D. uno sus hijos amplio su negocio, hoy día tiene una despensa, gracias a la buena atención y a la calidad D. sus productos tiene clientela formada, la Sra. Georgia comenta que sus ingresos son muy buenos y sus ventas  aumentan ya que mantiene bien surtido su despensa.
Doña Georgia agradece a fundación paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo constante que les brinda para fortalecer su microempresa y a la vez espera recibir siempre tan valioso apoyo.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra D. yerba, azúcar, aceite, arroz, entre otros.

loans.use: Compra de yerba, azúcar, aceite y mercaderias varias.

loans.name: Top

texts.en: Top S., 23, raises pigs to earn a living and is able to make US$2 every day. She lives in the Takeo province and has two young children living at home to support. Her husband has been running a moto-taxi business since 1999 and is able to make US$4 of profit each day. Top wants to make a new investment so that she reaches CREDIT to apply a loan of US$500 to purchase a cart that can squeeze sugar cane juice.

loans.use: To purchase a sugar cane squeeze-cart

loans.name: Sara Mariela

texts.es: Sara Mariela S. M. es una señorita de 28 años de edad, quien actualmente labora en el Banco Reformador como cajera y ella utiliza el credito para gastos personales como por ejemplo de remodelacion de su vivienda donde actualmente vive, en ella se puede ver una persona responsable, para realizar sus pagos ya que por medio de este creditos apoyamos las necesidad de los jovenes asi como la de Sara que son jovenes con muchos sueños y que tambien desde sus edad ya ven cuales son las necesidades que se nosa atraviezan en el camino.apesar de que ella es joven por medio de este credito ayuda a sus padres a mejoras sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Sara Mariela S. M. is a 28 year old Guatemalan woman who works as a teller at Banco Reformador. She is asking for a $275 loan in order to remodel her house and help her parents. She is a responsible woman who pays her bills on time. Young adults like Ms. M. face difficulties in their way to accomplish their dreams, but we are here to help them get there and improve their lives. Help Sara today!

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal Use: improve life conditions

loans.name: Corazon De Maria Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Corazón de María" esta representado por la señora Norah y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales cuentan con un ingreso diario generado por sus propios negocios pequeños como la venta de frutas, yogurt, empanadas, F., comida y prestando servicios como peluquería y albañilería. En lo que representa a la competencia las socias son gente que produce y vende productos de calidad hechas por ellas mismas por lo que tienen clientes  fieles que les ayudan a generar un ingreso necesario para el sustento de sus familias, es por esta razón que requieren del préstamo para hacer crecer sus negocios con la adquisición de insumos materiales y nuevas herramientas que ayuden a generar una mayor cantidad de productos y una mejor prestación de servicios que genere mayores ingresos y le permita brindar a sus familias una mejor calida d de vida. En cuanto a al experiencia en grupos solidarios una gran mayoría de los socios ya cuenta con experiencia en instituciones similares pero ninguna le brindo el apoyo y la confianza que le otorga la fundación para progresar y salir adelante en sus proyectos de crecimiento y así darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Corazon de Maria Communal Bank, represented by Ms. Norah, is comprised of 13 members who earn daily wages generated by their small businesses selling fruit, yogurt, empanadas, flowers, and food, or providing hairstyling or bricklaying services. In terms of competition, the group members are people who produce and sell high-quality products that they make themselves, which is why they have faithful customers who help them generate the profits necessary for their family expenses. For this reason, they need this loan in order to make their businesses grow by obtaining supplies, materials and the new tools that they need to make a greater quantity of products and offer better services. Thus, they can generate more income, which will allow them to give their families a better quality of life. Regarding experience with solidarity groups, a large majority of the members have previously worked with similar microfinance institutes, but none has ever given them the support and trust that the Fundación has given them so that they can make progress with their plans of growth, in so doing, giving their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gladys Njeri

texts.en:
Gladys Njeri is a 36 year old enterprising mother of three aged 11, 8 and 4. She is married to Joseph Omondi. She has been operating a poultry business for the last 5 years. She currenly has forty chickens used for laying and fifty used for slaughtering and selling. She has established contacts with cafe owners in Kisumu City, who provide a steady demand for her eggs and poultry meat.

Gladys also has one rental house she has developed with income derived from the poultry business. She expects to construct three more in the next three years, to enable her to pay school fees comfortably for her first son, who will then have joined high school.

This is her fifth loan from KADET Ltd and she intends to use the funds to purchase more poultry feed and some building materials for furnishing a rental house she had constructed. Gladys was introduced to KADET Ltd by her aunt, who was an existing customer of KADET Ltd.

She aspires to own many rental houses because she feels that would be a better guarantee for regular income.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase poultry feed and building materials for her poultry business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina L. is from the town of Carosucan Sta. Barbara, Pangasinan. She is 41 years old. Marcelina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marcelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Marcelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are comprised mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn L. is from the "barangay" (village) of Tuyabang, part of Oroquieta city. She is 43 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Merlyn owns and operates a food stall selling fish and seafood products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 11th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alida

texts.es:
Alida tiene 58 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores que viven la capital del Perú (Lima), en busca D. un futuro mejor y una adecuada educación. 
DesD. muy joven ha trabajado duro, es por eso que su cuerpo se acostumbró a los horarios y actividades pesadas menciona. Actualmente se levanta muy temprano y acompañada D. la música que le gusta e inicia sus actividades domésticas, luego atienD. a su esposo y ambos se dirigen al pequeño restaurante D. comidas típicas D. la selva que tienen. Los platillos que elaboran son bastante demandados en su zona porque es el único establecimiento cerca; con las ganancias que obtienen pueD. educar a sus hijos, mantener los gastos D. la casa e incluso ir ampliando el local D. su negocio, pues para el futuro desea que funcione en las noches como un video pub para obtener mayores ingresos.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura que pagará sus cuotas puntualmente, como siempre, para no perder la confianza que deposita la institución y su grupo en ella. También menciona que está feliz D. ser parte D. un banco comunal porque sus compañeras cumplen las normas y eso logra que estén muy unidas. Alida tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra D. juguetes para venderlos, aprovechando las fiestas D. fin año.
texts.en:
Alida, 58, lives in her own house with her husband. They have three grown children who live in the capital of Perú (Lima) and looking for a better future and an adequate education. She has worked hard since she was very young. That is why her body became accustomed to the heavy schedules and the activities she mentions. She currently gets up very early and, accompanied by the music she likes, she starts her domestic chores. She then takes care of her husband, and they both head to their small restaurant, which sells typical food of the jungle. The dishes they make are popular in her area because it is the only establishment nearby. With the earnings they get they are able to educate their children, pay the household expenses, and even expand their place of business. In the future she wants to operate as a video pub in the evenings in order to get more income. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She is sure that she will make her payments punctually, as always, in order to not lose the confidence that the institution and her group has placed in her. She also mentions that she is happy to be part of a communal bank because her colleagues follow the rules, and this makes them very united. Alida plans to use the money she is requesting to buy toys to sell, taking advantage of the end of the year parties.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Isela

texts.en:
Isela J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal to sell.  Isela is 30 years old and divorced. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Evangelina S. is from the village of Banquero. She is 41 years-old and is married with eight school-aged children. Evangelina raises crops and plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Evangelina has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Evangelina joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangelina is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and North-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mr. Sin S. is selling and buying recyclable goods (used goods) in the village to earn a living. In addition, his wife (who appears in the photo) raises a few pigs in a stall behind their house.  The couple have three kids; all of them are studying in school. Sin S. needs a loan in order to pay the expenses of repairing and decorating his old house, which often needs repair.

loans.use: To pay the expenses of repairing and decorating his old house

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en: Kareem sells blocks at retail prices. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He is requesting a loan of  N100,000 to purchase more blocks to sell. He is a hard working man and is determined to lift his business above poverty. He is 55 years old, married with 5 children. Kareem’s wife sells groceries to help her husband provide the basic needs for their family. He says thank-you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more blocks to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 36 years old, is married, and lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband and three young children.

To supply additional income for her family, Maricel is opening a local convenience store as her primary business and operates a secondary business of sewing in her neighborhood. She has been an entrepreneur for almost nine years.

Maricel would like to receive a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase inventory including rice, sugar, shampoo, detergent, canned goods, and other items for her store. She believes in offering a relevant assortment of goods in her store for customers seeking convenient purchases.

Maricel joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, in 2006 to obtain secured access to capital and loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams.

Maricel’s longterm goals are to expand her general store business, fund the education of her three children, have their own house and lot, and support her family financially. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve business success with her entrepreneurial endeavors.

Maricel hopes that these dreams will come true and that ASHI will, in fact, give the best direction and opportunity to her family.

loans.use: To purchase inventory including rice, sugar, shampoo, detergent, canned goods, and other items

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie F. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old. Melanie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Melanie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Melanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Melanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe sells foodstuffs in Ibadan, Oyo state. She is a hard working woman and she is so determined to excel in her business and family life. She is married with 5 children and she is 41 years old. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. She sells foodstuffs to make a living. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger in the future.  She is requesting for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Fenix De Fuego Group

texts.es:
Fénix de Fuego es un grupo integrado por dos mujeres y dos hombres ellos están ubicados en la Av. Alfredo del Mazo Colonia Santa Cruz en la comunidad de Valle de Chalco Estado de México. Todos se sienten muy a gusto en el grupo hasta ahora ya que se conocen y la comunicación que tienen es buena. 

La señora Alejandra B. L. es la representante del grupo tiene 40 años, estudió hasta el nivel medio superior, su esposo trabaja de chofer y tiene dos hijos, una mujer y un varón los cuales estudian la primaria y la secundaria. Ella comenzó trabajando para un local de instrumentos musicales y después se decidió por abrir su propio negocio, actualmente se dedica a la venta de instrumentos musicales y a la renta de equipos para eventos, diariamente ella abre su negocio desde temprano y necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio y así poder comprar artículos como: micrófonos, cuerdas para guitarras, baquetas, parches para baterías, maquinas de humo, etc. Alejandra dice que aun que tiene competencia no se da por vencida y trata de mantener a sus clientes y ganar recomendaciones con los demás dando buenos precios. Sus planes son; poder agrandar su negocio y abrir otro local en otra parte y seguir creciendo como persona.

Los otros tres integrantes se llaman: María de Jesús O. (Venta de ropa para dama), Amado G. R. (Veterinaria) y Marcelino Martínez Hernández (Taller de bicicletas) y aunque es un grupo pequeño tiene muchos deseos de superarse y quieren invertir en su negocio para poder tener ganancias y  cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Fénix de Fuego is a group comprised of two women and two men. They are located on Alfredo del Mazo Avenue in the Santa Cruz neighborhood. This is in the state of Chalco in México. All of them feel pleased being in the group because they know each other and have good communication. Alejandra B. L. represents the group. She is 40 years old, and she went to school up to high school. Her husband works as a driver. They have two children, a girl and a boy. They go to elementary school and high school. She started working for a musical instrument place. Later, she decided to open her own business. She currently sells musical instruments and rents equipment for events. She opens her business very early everyday. She needs the loan to invest in her business. She will buy things like microphones, guitar strings, drum sticks, drum patches, and smoke machines, etc. Alejadra says that even though she has competition, she does not give up. She tries to keep her customers and win recommendations from others by giving good prices. Her plans are to be able to expand her business, open another location in another place, and to keep growing as a person. The other members of the group are: María de Jesús O.: Sells Clothing for Women Amado G. R.: Veterinarian Marcelino Martínez Hernández: Bicycle Shop Even though it is a small group, they have a great desire to improve themselves. They want to invest in their businesses to be able to have income and meet their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, replacement parts for bicycles, musical instruments, and pet food

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Aquiles Lanao Flores Group

texts.es:
Marisol es socia hace 1 año del Banco Comunal Aquiles Lanao que tiene 15 socias, durante este tiempo Marisol aprendió a ahorrar con la esperanza D. cumplir sus metas o para alguna emergencia.
Marisol vive en una casa alquilada hace mucho tiempo y su mayor deseo es comprar una casa propia, Marisol es casada, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos D. 15, 8, 4 años. Marisol junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta D. moliente (bebida caliente preparada con hierbas curativas y semillas D. Lino), sus ventas los realizan D. manera ambulatoria en 2 distintos lugares en donD. hay mucha afluencia D. personas, para lo cual tienen baldes en la cual llevan sus productos. Su préstamo será destinado para la compra D. baldes y una carpa para protegerse del sol y D. la lluvia.
texts.en:
Marisol has been a member of the Aquiles Lanao Communal Bank for one year. The group has 15 members. During this time Marisol learned to save in the hope of meeting her goals or for some emergency. Marisol has lived in a rented house for a long time. Her greatest wish is to buy her own house. Marisol is 32, married, and has three children; 15, 8, and 4 years old. Marisol and her husband sell “moliente” (a hot drink prepared with curative herbs and flax seeds). They sell as traveling merchants in two distinct places where there is an influx of a lot of people. They have buckets to carry there products. The loan is to buy buckets and a tent to protect them from the sun and the rain.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy buckets and a tent to protect them from the sun and the rain
